loan.name: Morm

texts.en:
Mr. Morm S. is 32 years old and the father of one school-aged child. He lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is employed as a village chief, earning around $2.50 each day, while his wife works selling woman's clothing at a busy market and typically generates about $4/day in revenue.
In the photo, Mr. Morm S.'s wife is pictured as he was unavailable to be photographed. Mr. Morm S. is requesting this loan in order to provide working capital for his wife's business. He hopes to use his loan to help her expand her inventory and meet her growing customer demand. They will work together to be sure this loan is paid back in time.

loan.use: To purchase more clothing to sell to meet customers' needs.

loan.name: Gita

texts.en:
Mrs. Gita R., 27 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives with her mother, her husband and three children. Her husband, Jay Kumar R., is a driver for a brick factory, her daughter is in grade 4 and her son is in grade 2.
Her family's condition is not strong enough to fulfill their needs, and she cannot provide better education for their children.
A few months ago, Mrs. R. opened a vegetable shop to earn money. Now she seeks a loan of $150 to buy vegetables for her shop such as green vegetables, potatoes and others to be able to sell more. She wants to generate income and change their life style.

loan.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loan.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina C., 27 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint family household with 6 members: her husband, mother, 2 daughters and a son. Her Husband, Mr. Puspa C., has no work. He is illiterate and unemployed. Her life is miserable and she is unable to run her house smoothly.
Her two daughters are studying in grade 6 and 4 respectively and her son is in primary school. All her children are studying in a government school due to the lack of money. She wants to send her children to boarding school, but cannot afford the school fees.
Mrs. C. opened her vegetable shop a few months ago to overcome her family's problems. She seeks $150 to buy vegetables such as green vegetables and other vegetables to sell in the market to earn more.

loan.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loan.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. Nat P. is 28 years old, and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works for a private school as a cleaner and earns around $2.50 each day. Her husband earns money by working as a taxi driver.

Mrs. Nat Prek requests this loan to purchase a passenger cart for her husband. He can attach the cart to his existing motorbike to operate a tuk-tuk. Operating a tuk-tuk, he can earn more money than at his current job. (This is a picture of her husband and his customer sitting at the back of the motorbike.)

loan.use: Purchase a passenger cart to operate a tuk -tuk service.

payment.comment: Thanks to the successful of his business that is why he can pay off the loan a head of time. He would like to say thank deeply from his heart.

loan.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi T., 29 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family household with her husband and a son. Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Netra T., both work in their own small hotel and her son is studying in primary school.
She, with the help of her husband, opened the small hotel two years ago. In their hotel they sell newari food. Now she seeks $150 to buy goods such as meat, food grains, vegetables and other food materials to improve the standards of her shop. She is ready to pay back her loan on a monthly basis.

loan.use: To buy food materials for her shop

loan.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Kumari S., 37, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and three sons. Her economic condition is not good, so she can't send her children to a good school. Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Narayan S., is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. Her older son took the SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year, and the other two sons are in grades 6 and 4.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop two years ago. Now she seeks a loan of $225 to buy cosmetic goods such as chura (glass bangles), cream and powder to improve her business. She wants to use her income to help her husband and fulfill the family's basic needs, and she also wants to save some money for further study for her children.

loan.use: To buy cosmetic goods

loan.name: Beli Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Beli Maya N. and her husband, Shyam N., both are tailors in the town of Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. They have their own tailor shop. Tailoring is their traditional work, which they learned from their forefathers. Their specialty is making custom-fitted dresses like the Kurta Sulwar pants and shirt, which are very popular in Nepal. They seek a $225 loan to buy raw materials for their tailoring work.

They have three sons and a daughter. Their older son works in a restaurant. Their second and younger sons are studying in grade 8 and 9, and their daughter is in grade 10.

Their economic condition makes it very hard to fulfill the basic needs of their family. So they need the loan to expand their business so as to earn more money to support their family.

loan.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring work

loan.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok C. sells vegetables at a busy market to support her entire family. She is 57 years old, a widow, and has four children. Her only son works with her in the market. They earn around $5 each day. Her other children are married and live with their own families.

Mrs. Mork C. humbly requests a loan to purchase more vegetables to fulfill the needs of a growing number of custormers, and to buy a motorcycle to help transport vegetables to the market. (This is a picture of Mrs. Mok C.'s son.)

loan.use: Purchase more vegetables to meet needs of growing number of customers.

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Mok Chhorn start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabitri M., 27, lives in Thecho, Nepal, with her husband and a daughter. Her husband, Dharma lal M., works in Nepal Telecom as a field worker, and her daughter is studying in higher secondary school in grade 9.

Mrs. M. opened a wood shop 4 years ago. She is a very hard-working woman and does all her work perfectly. She is a wood dealer and supplies wood to a local carpentry shop which makes windows, doors and other items. Now she needs $225 to purchase more wood to fulfill the demand of the local markets.

Mrs. M. wants to save money for the future and also wants to be able to afford further study for her daughter.

loan.use: To buy wood

loan.name: Parbita

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbita G., 32, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She is one of the active group members of Patan Business and Professional Women. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband, two daughters and a son. Her husband is the older son of his father, so according to Nepali culture his father lives with them.

Her husband, Shankar G., is a farmer and works in their own field. Her daughters are studying in grades 8 and 4, respectively, and her son is in grade 2.

Mrs. G. opened the grocery shop 4 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. Now she seeks $150 to buy grocery goods like rice, biscuits, noodles and other items for the betterment of her shop.

Her family's economic condition is poor, so she wants to spend her income in fulfilling the needs of her family.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Tara

texts.en: Mrs. Tara M., 29, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and two children, a daughter and a son. Mrs. M. and her husband, Raju M., both work in their own shop. Their daughter and son are studying in lower secondary and nursery school, respectively. Their family income is so low that it's difficult to fulfill their basic needs. They cannot provide better education for their children. So Mrs. M. and her husband opened the grocery shop 4 years ago. They seek $300 to buy grocery goods for the improvement of their shop. They want to invest a little more this year to increase their income so that they can improve their standard of living and send their children to boarding school.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Thun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thun S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her five children in Kompung Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, along with two children, work in a brick-making factory. Together, they generally earn about $9 each day.

Mrs Thun S. requests this loan so her husband can purchase a fishing net and a boat. He wants to fish when he is not working in the factory.

loan.use: Purchase a fishing net and a boat.

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Thun Sron has successfully paid back this loan early!
Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world are able to access low-interest loans for their businesses and daily lives. We hope that you will continue your support of Kiva entrepreneurs.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mr. Chuon S. is 23 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support his household, he works near a market driving a trailer (a motorcycle with a trailer attached) to transport passengers and goods. He earns around $3 each day. His wife breeds pigs to supplement their income.

This couple hopes to use this loan buy a motorcycle for the transportation business, and to purchase more pigs.

loan.use: Purchase a motorcycle to transport passengers and goods.

loan.name: Asuncin

texts.es:
Sra. Asuncion C., 53, is married with 5 children. She sells the basic ingredients required to make chipas. Chipas are a traditional food, much like bread, made with corn starch, cheese, milk, and vegetable oil, that is widely eaten in Paraguay. She has done this for more than 20 years and she told us that thanks to this work, she and her husband, Sr. Mario Fernandez, were able to give their family a good education and even buy their own house.

Her main customers are factories where they make chipas and bakeries in the neighborhood; they buy the ingredientscorn starch, cheese, vegetable oil, etcfrom her daily. The San Francisco de Caacupe neighborhood, where she lives, is a prominent area for chipas production which helps her sales, especially on the first days after every weekend.

In the months up to December 8, the demand for chipas production is incessant because of the Virgin of Caacupe celebration on that day. Pilgrims from various parts of the country go to the city of Caacupe to attend the mass at the basilica there. Sales are very good during this period and the neighborhood hums with activity as everyone in the neighborhood busies themselves making chipas for sale.

Sra. C. is asking for the loan to buy more corn starch, cheese, and maize so that she can meet the huge demand for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Asuncin, tiene 53 aos, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de materia prima para la elaboracin de chipas. La chipa es una comida tpica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y esta hecho a base de almidn, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Ella se dedica a esta actividad ms de veinte aos, nos comenta que gracias a ste trabajo, ella y su marido, el seor Mario Fernndez, pudieron brindarle a su familia una buena educacin y hasta adquirieron su casa propia.

Sus principales clientes son las chiperas (fbricas de chipas) y panaderas de la zona, quines en forma diaria compran los productos que ellos venden como ser almidn, queso, aceite vegetal, etc. El barrio San Francisco de Caacup donde ella reside, es una zona eminentemente productora de chipas, por lo que su movimiento de ventas es muy bueno especialmente en los das prximos al fin de semana.

En los meses cercanos al 8 de Diciembre el movimiento de produccin de chipas es incesante, ya que en esa fecha es el da de la Virgen de Caacup y peregrinantes de diferentes partes del pas van hasta la ciudad de Caacup van a asistir a la misa que se realiza en la baslica. Por ello la venta es muy buena en esa poca y genera un dinamismo en el barrio ya que casi en todas las casas de la ciudad elaboran chipas para vender.

Desea el crdito para comprar ms almidn, queso, maz, porque la demanda de sus productos es bastante alta.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loan.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, 48, is married and has two children. She owns a small grocery store and, in addition to that, a business selling mens and womens clothing. Her husband is in charge of selling the clothes and goes out on his motorcycle to sell them in the towns around Caacupe.

She has had her store for more than 15 years and some years sales have been good and in others, not, but she considers herself a fighter and an entrepreneur because she always looks for ways to improve and sell what her customers need. In recent months, she invested much of her savings in clothes for sale. In her store, she sells basic commodities like oil, milk, eggs, cheese, vegetables, etc. Her main customers are workers such as the neighborhood bakers.

She would like to continue stocking her store because theres been a rise in demand for her products, so shes asking for $1,000 to invest in the purchase of sugar, milk, meat, wine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita, tiene 48 aos, est casada y tiene dos hijos, ella posee una despensa, y como actividad adicional tambin se dedica a la venta de ropas para caballero y para damas, en ste negocio el encargado de vender es su marido quin con su motocicleta sale a vender por las ciudades aledaas a Caacup.

Su despensa lo tiene ya hace ms de 15 aos en algunos casos con buenas ventas y en otras con bajas, pero no obstante se considera una luchadora y emprendedora ya que siempre busca innovar y vender lo que la gente necesita. En estos ultimos meses invirti gran parte de sus ahorros en la compra de ropas. En su despensa vende productos de primera neceidad como aceite, leche, huevos, queso, verduras, etc. Sus principales clientes son los obreros, como as tambin los panaderos de la zona.

Ella desea seguir surtiendo su despensa ya que registra un alza en la demanda de sus productos, por lo que solicita la suma de $ 1000 que los invertir en la compra de , azcar, leche, carne, vino, etc.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loan.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is 45 years old, married to Alicia Medina and father of a girl; the couple owns a cattle ranch of 2 hectares, with six milk cows, four heifers and two bulls. Mr. Felipe starts his work activities very early in the morning: along with his wife, he starts milking his cows at 3:30 am. A great percentage of the daily production is sold at their place, as the neighbors come by early to buy the milk. They have a regular clientele in the adjacent neighborhoods and Felipe delivers the milk using a cart he owns; once he is done delivering, he takes care of the animals. His wife makes cheese twice a week and her clients are the chiperos (people who make chipa, a typical meal from Paraguay, similar to bread). They place their orders in advance. Thanks to their honest work and sacrifice, they are able to make a living and pay for their daughters education. He is requesting the loan in order to buy food for the cattle, especially bran.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe tiene 45 aos, est casado con la esposa Alicia Medina, con quien tiene una hija; el matrimonio tiene un tambo con 6 vacas lecheras, 4 vaquillas, y 2 toros, en un predio de 2 hectreas. El seor Felipe empieza sus actividades laborales a muy temprana hora de la maana; a las 3:30 hs, junto con su esposa, empieza su labor de ordear las vacas. Gran parte de la produccin del da la venden en su misma casa, ya que sus vecinos a temprana hora se acercan a comprar la leche. Poseen clientela fija, de los barrios vecinos a su domicilio; su reparto lo realiza en un carrito que poseen y, una vez culminado su reparto, se dedican a la atencin de los animales. Su seora elabora queso dos veces por semana y sus clientes son los chiperos de la zona (personas que se dedican a elaborar chipa, una comida tpica del Paraguay, parecida al pan). Ellos realizan sus pedidos con anterioridad. Gracias a este trabajo honesto y sacrificado, ellos pueden mantener su casa y la educacin de su hija. Solicita el crdito para comprar comida para los animales, especialmente afrecho.

loan.use: Purchase of bran to feed cattle.

loan.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina, 38, is married and has 5 children. She began working as a seamstress more than 20 years ago, a skill that she learned from her mother who advised her and gave her an industrial sewing machine so that she could complete her initial orders.

She now works independently and owns 3 sewing machines. When she has large numbers of orders, one of her daughters who has also learned the trade helps her. Her daughters help speeds the work so that she can meet the requirements of her customers who want their orders delivered in as short a time as possible. Thanks to honest hard work, shes been able, with the help of her husband, to support her family and give her children good educations.

She has been thinking about expanding her small workroom so that can have all of her sewing machines in one place; for this, shes asking for a $250 loan to expand her workroom.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina tiene 38 aos, ella est casada y tiene 5 hijos, se inici como costurera hace ms de 20 aos, oficio que lo adquiri gracias a las enseanzas de su madre quien le orient y le regalo una mquina de coser industrial, para realizar sus primeros trabajos de confeccin.

Actualmente ya trabaja de forma independiente, y posee 3 mquinas de coser. Cuando tiene gran cantidad de pedidos una de sus hijas le ayuda pues tambin ha aprendido el oficio, de esa forma agiliza su trabajo para poder entregar todos los pedidos de sus clientes quienes en algunos casos desean que sus pedidos sean entregados en el menor tiempo posible. Gracias a ste trabajo honesto y sacrificado pudo, junto con su marido, mantener a su familia y adems darle una educacin digna.

Tiene pensado ampliar su pequeo saln de trabajo, de forma a que el espacio fsico sea mayor y poder tener todas sus mquinas en un mismo lugar, por ello solicita un crdito de $ 250 para invertirlos en la refaccin y ampliacin del saln.

loan.use: Expand workroom for sewing business.

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. She owns a grocery store. She started this business 15 years ago, and she tells us that she started with little capital. She had only a little bit of savings, and those days it was difficult to get a loan because she didn't have a credit history.

The first few years were difficult because the sales were not good, but she persevered and nowadays she has many customers. She also sells fast food to the workers in the neighborhood that already eat breakfast from her products.

Her main accomplishment was to have her own business and to be able to provide and maintain her family. She is requesting a loan to buy products like milk, yogurt, meat, beer, soft drinks, wine, fruits, etc.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La seora Francisca tiene 44 aos, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, posee una despensa , se inici en sta actividad hace ms de 15 aos, comenta que empez con un pequeo capital, producto de unos ahorros que tena, ya que ese tiempo le fue difcil acceder a un prstamo a nivel de financieras ya que no contaba con referencias anteriores.

Los primeros aos a su inicio fueron difciles porque las ventas no fueron las ms buenas, no obstante sigui perseverando y hoy da tiene muchos clientes, tambin vende comidas rpidas para los obreros de la zona que hoy da ya habitan desayunar sus productos.

Su principal logro fue el de poder cumplir su meta de tener su negocio propio y el de proveer a su familia del sustento necesario. Desea el crdito para comprar productos como leche, yogurt, carne, cerveza, gaseosas, vino, frutas, etc.

loan.use: to purchase products like milk, yogurt, meat, beer, soft drinks, wine, fruits, etc.

loan.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Ms. Liliana is 21 years old and single. She owns a nursery where she sells all kinds of garden plants. She opened this business more than 3 years ago and she runs it from the yard of her parents' house.

Liliana took over this business from her parents who left it her so she could start generating her own income and pay for her studies. Her parents have another, larger, nursery where they themselves work.

In her city, Compaa Cabaas de Caacup, there are many nurseries with a large variation of plants, due to the good climate and quality of the soil. Therefore, this line of business is very competitive, but at the same time, there is a large number of customers that come to this city from all over the country to buy plants.

She is requesting a loan to buy rose seeds of different colors and fertilizer to grow the roses. These are in high demand by the customers that visit her store.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La seorita Liliana tiene 21 aos y es soltera. Posee un viveros dnde vende todo tipo de plantas para jardn, abri este negocio hace ms de 3 aos y lo tiene en el predio de la casa de su padre.

Liliana, hered ste negocio de sus padres quienes dejaron a su cargo la administracin del mismo de tal manera de que ella pueda generar sus propios ingresos y poder solventar sus estudios. Sus padres tienen otro vivero ms grande en el cual ellos trabajan.

En la ciudad donde reside, Compaa Cabaas de Caacup, existen una gran cantidad de viveros donde uno puede encontrar variedades de plantas de todo tipo, por el buen clima de la zona, y la buena tierra. Por ello este rubro es bastante competitivo, pero a la vez con una gran afluencia de clientes, pues vienen desde distintos puntos del pas para adquirir las plantas de esa ciudad.

Desea un prstamo para comprar semillas de rosas de diferentes colores y abono para plantar rosas, ya que esta es la de mayor demanda por los clientes que visitan su local.

loan.use: To purchase seed for different colors of roses and fertilizer.

loan.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata C., Elisa Pariona, Sonia Quispe, and Hilda Ccorahua belong to a village bank called Ccatarisun which is a quechua (native language) word that means Dawn. As part of the village bank, the four of them receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment is on all four women. They are asking a total loan of US$ 1200. Fortunata will use her share to buy more ingredients to prepare her "moliente".

In the midst of a bustling street market in Ayacucho, Peru, Fortunata can be found every day behind her cart selling moliente, hot herbal beverages. In addition to herbs and teas, she also has a small supply of homeopathic remedies. Her most popular product is a blend of sbila, a type of cactus leaves that she cuts open and then scrapes out the insides. She adds honey, and a variety of herbal teas. She tops this mixture off with a little hot water, and stirs well. It helps with digestion and is good for the immune system.

This drink as well as many others are very popular, and are sold for 1 Nuevo Sol (or about $0.30 U.S.) Fortunata's customers speak both Quechua, the indigenous language of Peru, and Spanish. Many are regulars, who come to Fortunatas cart every day. Although hesitant to have her picture taken, Fortunata is a friendly woman who always engages her clients in conversation; they talk about her plants, market gossip, or their family lives.

Fortunata begins each day at 4:30 AM, in order to set up her stand by 5. She caters to a steady stream of customers until 9 a.m., before returning home to care for her four small children. She occasionally has time for a nap before returning to sell beverages, although a different variety, from 8 PM to midnight. Her husband helps out with the children when she is operating the cart, as well as helping prepare the plants she uses for tea each day before work.

Fortunata, Elisa, Sonia, and Hilda are looking forward to receiving this loan of US$1200, to be distributed among the four of them.

loan.use: buy more ingredients to prepare her "moliente"

loan.name: Mara

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband makes a living making and selling chipas, which is a bread-like food made out of a starch, cheese, milk and vegetable oil. He sells chipas on the streets, mostly on the weekends, when he sets up a stand outside the stadium during soccer matches.

Maria runs a small food stand in her home and also helps her husband make chipas. Her food stand has been around for 15 years. They plan to expand the food stand to allow them to sell fast food and ice cream during the summer months. They are requesting this loan to finance the expansion of their small grocery stand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara tiene 51 aos, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Su marido se dedica a la elaboracin y venta de chipas, la chipa es una comida tpica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y est hecho a base de almidn, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros. Es as como el elabora las chipas y las vende de forma ambulante, especialmente los fines de semana que va a vender a las canchas de futbol durante los partidos. Mara tiene una despensa en su casa adems tambin ayuda a su esposo en la elaboracin de la chipa. El negocio ya lleva 15 aos de funcionamiento. Tienen proyectado realizar una pequea ampliacin del espacio fsico de la despensa para empezar a vender en la temporada de verano comidas rpidas y helados; para concretar ste proyecto solicita un prstamo de $ 250, ya los presupuestos de mano de obras y materiales a ser utilizados oscilan ese monto.

loan.use: To expand the grocery stand

loan.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is a hardworking mother of 2. She was born in Ayacucho, Peru, where she now lives in a modest home with her husband. Monday through Friday she sells Avon cosmetics, from her home and door-to-door. On the weekends, Rosal wakes up early and heads to the center of town to purchase pescado y mariscos, fish and seafood. The fresh fish comes in every Saturday, and so she only sells the fish through Sunday when it is the freshest.

Rosal's clients are el pueblo or the people of her neighborhood. She sells fish at a small market, but is one of the only vendors and does very well. Her most popular product is jurel, which is also her cheapest fish. It is silver in color and sells for about $1 U.S. She began this business 9 years ago, and has been steadily growing the business ever since. Recently she hired an employee to help her transport the fish, so that she can buy and sell larger amounts. She hopes to continue to grow her business with the help of a $300 loan.

loan.use: to buy larger amounts of fish for resale

loan.name: Sullaiman

texts.en: Sullaiman T. is the father of four children. He runs a small business selling plastic sandals and clothes. The business is the only source of income for the family and Sullaiman would like to expand it. He is therefore requesting a loan of $200.

loan.use: Expansion of clothing shop

loan.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie B. is forty-nine years old and married with five children. He runs a business selling plastic sandals and clothes. Alie says most of his income goes to his childrens education requirements and medical care. Although the previous loan helped him increase his income, he now needs another loan of $175 to allow him to further expand the business, especially to purchase more clothing for resale.

loan.use: Purchase more clothing for resale

loan.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita A. and Zoraida Machao belong to a village bank called Muchuy Warakaq, which is a quechua (native language) word that means Fight against poverty. As part of the village bank, they receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment rests on both of them. They are asking for a total of US$ 1000; the loan will be divided between them.

In the local market in Ayacucho, Peru, past the flowers, raw meat, and dry goods, Margarita can be found chatting with customers and coworkers. Seven days a week, she sells live chickens and cuy, guinea pigs. The latter is a delicacy in Peru, prepared and eaten on special occasions. Because of the high altitude, grass is difficult to grow so raising cattle is almost impossible. This makes poultry and small animals the most practical source of protein.

Margarita says guinea pigs are the most popular item, and she has over 70 in cages in the market. She purchases all of her animals once a week at a livestock fair on the outskirts of town. She sells live animals, and also chickens and guinea pigs ready to cook. Guinea pigs are sold for US$ 2-3, depending on their size.

Margarita A. and her friend Zoraida Machao, who also works in the market, hope to expand their micro-businesses and increase their profit with this loan of US$ 1,000.

loan.use: to buy more live animals to sell in the market

loan.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul T. is the eldest of ten children. He could not continue with his education as his mother was unable to afford school expenses after the death of Abdul's father. He then started a small business selling essential items such as lotions, toothpaste, pens, etc. in the town of Magburaka. Abdul's previous loan helped him diversify his business and he would now like to expand his inventory with a second loan of $175.

loan.use: Increase cosmetics and stationery supplies

loan.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. and her friend Carmen Rosa Maldonado belong to a village bank called Poder, which means Power. As part of the village bank, they receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment rests with both of them. They are asking for a total loan of US$ 500 to be divided between them.

Victoria owns a grocery store on a block with five other similar stores. She sells fruits, vegetables, sodas, firewood, groceries, cooking supplies, bread, and about anything you can think of. She purchases the items fresh from the market once a week in bulk. Without Victorias store and other surrounding stores, the locals would have to walk almost 30 minutes to the market to get a stick of butter. The little grocery store is so convenient that parents can even send their 4-year-old children with a couple of nuevos soles in their pockets to purchase items for the household.

Victoria works here with her husband, who translated her Quechuan answers to our questions into Spanish. She and her husband have 4 children of their own. Five years ago they adopted a boy from the local orphanage and just recently they have added a 6th member to the family from the same orphanage.

This time, Victoria and her friend Carmen Rosa are asking for a loan of US$ 500. They will use this money to purchase higher quality products in hopes that this will attract more customers. A two-year member of FINCA, Victoria says she feels happier with her friends at FINCA than she does anywhere else

loan.use: to purchase higher quality products in hope that this will attract more customers

loan.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie T. is twenty-five years old and married with a child. He runs a small kiosk selling various essentials in Magburaka town. Mr. T. plans to develop the kiosk into a shop on the outskirts of town. His previous loan helped to build the small shelter for his business. He is requesting an additional $175 to further expand the business.

loan.use: Expansion of kiosk selling essential items

loan.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda Q. and Doris Calderon belong to a village bank called Solidaridad, which means Solidarity. As part of the village bank, they receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment rests on both of them. They are asking for a total loan of US$ 850 which will be divided between them.

Hilda Q. D. C. owns a wonderful little panadera (bakery) close to the main plaza in Ayacucho. 300-400 loaves of fresh breads and sweets are baked every morning and every evening. Types of bread incluD. francs, bizcochos, chapla, wawa, and pionono. Chapla is the most popular bread all year round, being a traditional food of the Peruvian highlands. It resembles an English muffin, but it has a hollow insiD.. People eat it with jam, butter, cheese, vegetables, or meat. The large chapla is sold for 0.20 nuevos soles ($0.07), while the small chapla is sold for 0.10 nuevos soles ($.04). From August to October, Pan D. "Wawa" (baby in Quechua), an infant-shaped bread that is meant to be consolation for women who became pregnant during Carnaval in February, is very popular.

Hilda begins her day at 5 am and finishes at 7pm. She works in the bakery with her husband of five years and her mother and sisters. Her two children both attend school. Hilda and her friend, Doris, are asking for a loan of US$ 850 to share. Hilda plans to use her share of the money to purchase flour, butter, sugar, and other materials to create new varieties of breads and sweets for her customers to try.

loan.use: to purchase flour, butter, sugar and other materials to create new varieties of breads and sweets for her customers to try

loan.name: Lonia Margarita

texts.es:
Lonia Margarita S. R. lives in the Marcar district, Carhuaz Province, in Ancash Department. She is 36 years old. She became a widow 6 years ago and she has 3 children, to whom she must be both mother and father.

She sells chocho (which is a salad made with lupin beans, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and condiments) from the door of the house where she lives. Five years ago, she heard there was an institution that gave loans to women. She learned about how Manuela Ramos works and decided to become involved in the Madres Marcarinas Communal Bank.

The loan for S/. 1,500.00 (approximately $475.00) that she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients for her business. She says that the loans she has received in the past have helped her business a lot. It has grown, and thanks to it, she can educate her children, pay the rent for her house, and it allows her to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Seora Lonia Margarita S. R. vive en el distrito de Marcar, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash. Tiene 36 aos, desde hace 6 aos enviud y se qued con 3 hijos, siendo para ellos padre y madre. Su actividad econmica es la venta de chocho (es una ensalada elaborada a base de chocho, cebolla, tomate, lechuga y condimentos), vende en la puerta de la casa donde vive. Hace cinco aos se enter que haba una institucin que daba prstamos a las mujeres, se inform del funcionamiento de Manuela Ramos y decidi formar parte del Banco Comunal Madres Marcarinas. El prstamo solicitado por S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles (US$ 475.00) lo invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio. Ella manifiesta que los crditos le ha ayudado mucho en su negocio, ha crecido y gracias a ello puede educar a sus hijos, pagar el alquiler de su casa y le permite vivir mejor.

loan.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loan.name: Ibrahim B.

texts.en: Ibrahim is married with three children. At thirty-one years of age, he is a trader selling clothing in the town of Magburaka in Northern Sierra Leone. Because of his hard work and advice to other traders, he was named the Executive Member of the Magburak Traders' Union. His previous loan improved his business greatly, Ibrahim says, and so he is requesting another loan to further build up his business capital.

loan.use: Increase capital for his clothing business

loan.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab C. is married with five children. This thirty-five year old mother has had her business selling clothes for 3 years. Thinking about the education of her children, Zainab says, she managed to make a profit from her previous loan and has saved some money to pay for school requirements for the coming semester. She is requesting a loan of $250 to further expand her business.

loan.use: Expansion of her clothing business

loan.name: Adama

texts.en: At forty-five years of age, Adama is married with four children. She sells fresh fish and has been in business for a long time but her business was disrupted by the civil war. Due to lack of sufficient capital, she started again 3 years ago on a small scale. With her previous loan, she managed to increase her sales and profit but as this is her only source of income, the profit was spent mostly on household expenses. Adama is now requesting a loan of $200 to further expand her business.

loan.use: Increase fish selling business by purchasing more inventory

loan.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie L. is forty-six years old and married with five children. Her husband works for the government as a sanitary officer but his salary is insufficient to meet the family expenses. L. started selling fish in Magburaka market in northern Sierra Leone to increase the family's income. She is requesting a loan of $200 to expand her fish business.

loan.use: Expand her fish business and increase her profits

loan.name: Yama Musu

texts.en: Married to a local court chairman, Yama Musu has eight children. She runs a store selling palm oil since her husbands salary could not meet all the family's expenses. With her previous loan, Yama Musu was able to increase her stock and sell wholesale. There is high demand for palm oil in Sierra Leone because every family uses it for cooking. Six of Yama Musus children are still in school and she is working hard to see them through their education. She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase 70 gallons of palm oil. She prefers to sell wholesale and that is the direction she intends to take.

loan.use: Purchase palm oil to resell wholesale for greater profits

loan.name: Alisahib

texts.en:
Mr. Alisahib is 52 and married with two children. He and his family live in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alisahib and his son (shown in the picture) run a family business. Alisahib sells beef in Saatli while his son takes care of their cows. However, the income from the sold beef is not enough to support their family.

Thats why Alisahib applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Mara

texts.es:
Maria is 44 years old, married to Mr. Cirilo Ortega, and they have 2 children. They own a small "chipas" factory at their home. Mrs. Maria, with the help of one of her sisters, is in charge of the production. The "chipa" is a typical Paraguayan food; it is similar to bread and consists of dough, cheese, milk, vegetable oil, and other ingredients.

Her husband Cirilo is in charge of the sales. He travels every day to the city of Clorinda, Argentina (the neighboring country) to sell his tasty products. He has a well-known stand in this city, where he has been working for about 25 years now.

They are requesting a loan to enlarge the roof of their barn which will give them more space to produce the chipas. Thanks to this business, they have been able to buy their own home as well as pay for the studies of their two children, who at this moment are enrolled at the university.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Maria, tiene 44 aos, ella est casada con el seor Cirilo Ortega y tienen 2 hijos, ellos poseen una pequea fbrica de chipas en su mismo domicilio, la encargada de realizar la produccin es la seora Maria con una de sus hermanas quien la ayuda en la elaboracin del producto. La chipa es una comida tpica muy consumida en Paraguay, es parecido al pan y esta hecho a base de almidn, queso, leche, aceite vegetal, entre otros.

Su marido Cirilo es el encargado de las ventas, el viaja todos los das hasta la Ciudad de Clorinda Argentina (pas que limita con Paraguay) para vender sus ricos productos ya que tiene su puesto de venta en esa ciudad y que ya es bastante conocido en el lugar ya que lleva trabajando unos 25 aos en esa zona.

Estn solicitando el prstamo para ampliar el techo de su galpn y as tener mayor comodidad para elaborar y producir las chipas. Gracias a ste trabajo ellos pudieron comprar y hacerse de una casa como as tambin educar a sus dos hijos quienes actualmente estn estudiando en la universidad.

loan.use: To enlarge and renovate her store

loan.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has 20 years of experience selling vegetables because she started working with her mom since she was very young at the markets. Little by little, she was able to open her own business, which helps her make ends meet and provide a good education for her children. Teresa and her husband, who has been a great support, open the business everyday from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm.

Teresa would like to have her second loan so that she can continue to invest in her business. She has previously bought grains and more vegetables, and these products have been welcomed by her clients. She will use this loan to buy larger amount of goods from farmers in the rural sectors.

Teresa is 47 years old. She has 2 sons who are already adults and help her as much as they can. Her husband works as a construction worker and helps her with the business whenever he has free time. They hope they can finish building their house, which is currently made out of cane.

loan.use: Invest in new more vegetables and grains

loan.name: Miryusif

texts.en:
Mr. Miryusif is 28, single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Miryusif tends to a flock of sheep which he grazes daily until the weekends. On Saturday and Sunday he sells the sheep in the local market but is not able to get much from the sale.

Therefore, Miryusif has applied to Norimicro - Saatli branch for a $750 loan to buy a few dozen sheep. A $750 loan, will allow him to buy 15 lambs at $50 a lamb. In a half a year he could to earn up to $1,500 from this investment.

loan.use: To increase the number of sheep

loan.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 49 years old and married with seven children. He and his family live in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Every day, Murad goes to his shop to sell goods. However the turnover is very low, because having so big a family (10 people) he is not able to save enough money to invest in his business, once he has paid for his family's basic living expenses.

Therefore, Murad has decided to request a $600 loan from Normicro Saatli branch to enable him to purchase a greater variety of goods for his shop and increase the shop's daily turnover. It makes good business sense for him to repay this loan in small monthly instalments. This arrangement will allow him to maintain a steady monthly income as well as save some money each month which he can use to invest in his business.

loan.use: To increase variety of goods

loan.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, 30, is married and has 2 children. She makes a type of clothing called "aho poi", a Guarani term for a traditional technique for making clothes. (Guarani is one of the official languages of Paraguay.) Aho poi clothing is much sought-after in the country, especially among tourists.

Like the majority of women, Maria learned the skill from her mother, a skill that has been passed down from generation to generation. There's a huge demand for articles of aho poi clothing and they're sold in shopping centers and even exported. In this way, Maria can help her husband by contributing to family expenses, all the more urgent now that her two children are in school and expenses are going up and up.

She's asking for a loan to buy cloth and colored threads in bulk so that she can get significant disounts and prepare for the increase in demand for her products that the summer season will bring.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara, tiene 30 aos, est casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la confeccin de ropa aho poi, el aho poi es un trmino escrito en guaran (uno de los idiomas oficiales del pas) es una tcnica tpica del Paraguay, que se utiliza para confeccionar ropas y es bastante apreciado, especialmente por turistas que visitan el pas.

Al igual que la mayora de las mujeres, Mara, aprendi las tcnicas de su madre pues va pasando de generacin a generacin. La misma tiene una gran demanda, pues se venden en los centros de compras y hasta son exportados. De sta forma y con ste trabajo, Mara ayuda a su marido aportando dinero para cubrir los gastos propios de la familia, ya que sus dos hijos estn en la escuela y los gastos aumentan cada vez.

Ella solicita el crdito para poder comprar telas e hilos de colores al por mayor, pues de esta forma consigue importantes descuentos y la demanda de sus productos aumentan en la poca de verano que se acerca.

loan.use: Buy supplies in bulk for traditional clothing business.

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victoria D. C.. I run a business out of my home selling new clothes and footwear, which I also deliver. I have been doing this for a number of years, and it helps me earn income while also allowing me to tend to my family. Thanks to this business I have been able to help pay the bills and educate my children. Currently, I need to increase my stock since the demand is outweighing the supply, and I need fresh capital to make that investment.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Vicotoria D. C., mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitacin de venta de ropa nueva y calzado el que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por emcargo, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso y al mismo tiempo me permite atender a mi familia. Gracias ha este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, y gastos de estudio de mis hijos. actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito de capital fresco para tal inversin.

loan.use: Purchase jeans, shirts, tennis shoes, blouses, etc.

loan.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza, 34, is married and has 4 children. She makes dulce de guayaba (a sweet preserve made from the guayaba fruit) in a small workshop that she's set up on the patio of her house, a workshop that has all the equipment she needs to make the dulces in as hygenic a way as possible.

She has customers in various places including San Lorenzo, a large city that lies an hour away. She begins very early at 3:30 in the morning, normally with the help of her husband, Roberto Barreto, who is also a driver with a transportation company in the city of Caacupe.

With her income and help from her husband, Mariza was able to buy a lot and build her own house. Now she's thinking of expanding her work space by building a floor and roof. This will increase the space she has to work in and make her job easier and more productive. According to her budget estimates, the addition will cost $300, the amount that she's asking you to loan her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariza, tiene 34 aos, est casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella elabora dulce (mermelada) de guayaba, posee su pequea fbrica en el patio de su casa, con todas las comodidades y elementos mnimos requeridos para elaborar los dulces de la forma ms higinica posible.

Ella tiene clientes de diferentes ciudades, especialmente de San Lorenzo una ciudad grande que queda a una hora de viaje. Ella inicia su actividad laboral muy temprano a las 03:30 de la maana, su ayudante suele ser su marido Roberto Barreto quin a la vez es chofer de una empresa de transporte de la ciudad de Caacup.

Con este trabajo y ms la ayuda de su marido, Mariza pudo comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, actualmente tiene pensado ampliar su negocio con la construccin de un techo y piso, con esto lograr ganar ms espacio fsico, trabajar con mayor comodidad y producir ms; segn el presupuesto que maneja esto le costar aproximadamente 300 dlares, por lo que solicita el crdito.

loan.use: Improve work space for food business.

loan.name: Dinora Lizeth

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Dinora Lizeth and for three years I have made a living selling home items and novelties on the street and door to door. Some of the items I sell are cosmetics, sandals, tennis shoes and plasticware. The work suits me because it lets me tend to my family and the money I make helps with the expenses. Right now I am looking for ways to boost sales and I need to raise some capital to be able to carry a greater variety of goods.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Dinora Lizeth, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de Achineria (Cosmeticos, sandalias, tenis y productos plasticos), los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, en las diferentes comunidades de mi ciudad, cuento con 3 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mi familia. Actualmente se acerca el tiempo de mayor venta y necesito de una mayor inversin, para ofrecer a mis cliente variedad de productos.

loan.use: To buy body lotion, sandals, womens' tennis shoes and plastic basins and underwear.

loan.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Claudia del Carmen and I have a small home-based business baking and selling bread. I have run this business for several years and generate enough income to cover my family's living expenses and pay my suppliers. I am a single mother and have two children who attend school and help me with the business in their free time. Thanks to this business I have been able to support my children.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Claudia del Carmen, mi actividad principal es la elaboracin de pan ( producto para consumo Humano) cuento con una micro empresa de elaboracin de pan en mi casa de habitacin, tengo varios aos de realizar esta actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos lo que estan en la escuela y me colaboran en su tiempo libre. Gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis dos hijos.

loan.use: To purchase firewood, flour, sugar and lard

loan.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, 56, is married and has 3 children. She own a small grocery store and earns extra income selling milk and home-made cheese. One of her children helps her with the new business because revenue from milk sales is notably growing. She's had her grocery store for more than 18 years, through ups and downs, through periods when she couldn't immediately stock it because of other large expenses that had to be covered first. She says that in the last few months, competition has increased because several supermarkets have opened in the area. Even so, she provides everyday products like sugar, pasta, milk, flour, etc. to neighborhood families. A large percentage of her revenues comes from the sale of milk and home-made cheese.

She would like to better stock her grocery store with soft drinks, milk products and beer as there's a lot of demand for those products. She's asking for a $250 loan to buy those kinds of supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina tiene 56 aos, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee una despensa, y como actividad adicional tiene venta de leche y elaboracin de queso, uno de sus hijos es el que ayuda en el negocio, ya que la venta de leche le genera un ingreso ms rpido e interesante. Su despensa lo tiene ya hace ms de 18 aos con sus altos y bajos, ya que en algunas oportunidades tuvo grandes gastos que cubrir y no poda surtir su despensa inmediatamente. Comenta que en estos ltimos meses, la competencia ha aumentado pues se han abierto varios supermercados en la zona, no obstante ella provee a las familias de productos de primera necesidad como azcar, fideos, leche, harina, etc. Un gran porcentaje de los ingresos se genera de la venta de leche y elaboracin de queso.

Ella desea surtir ms su despensa y desea comprar gaseosas, lcteos y cerveza pues tiene bastante demanda de estos productos, para ello solicita un crdito de $ 250 para comprar dichos productos.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loan.name: Adan De La Cruz

texts.en:
My name is Adan de la Cruz and I have a small grocery stand in the city market. I have run this business for several years and generate sufficient income to cover my family's living expenses and to meet my obligations to my suppliers. Thanks to this business I have been able to finance my children's education and allowed them to obtain their high school diplomas.

I feel very fortunate to have my children's help in their free time. I am requesting this loan to purchase more inventory to allow me to offer my customers a greater product selection.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Adan de la Cruz, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con una pequea pulperia uibcada en el Mercado Municipal de mi ciudad, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a esta actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias ha este negocio he dado a mis hijos educacin. logrando asi titulos de educacin media para cada uno ( 4). me siento muy contento ya que cuento con la colaboracin de mis hijos en su tiempo libre actualemnte necesito surtir mas el negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loan.use: To purchase rice, corn, sugar, lard, poultry, oil, dairy products and soap

loan.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Jose Victor and I sell CD's and DVD's in the center of my town. I have been doing this for a number of years to support myself and my family. At this time I want to boost sales and meet rising demand and to do so I need to buy a greater variety of discs.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Jose Victor, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de CD Y DVD ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que la demanda ha crecido y necesito de mayor inversin para ofrecer a mis clientes variedad del productos.

loan.use: To buy CD's and DVD's.

loan.name: Maria Pastora

texts.en:
My name is Maria Pastora and I have a small business selling used and new clothing from a stall located in the city center. I have been in business for several years and generate enough income to pay my suppliers and cover my living expenses. I am a single mother and senior citizen. Thanks to this business I am able to support myself, which makes me happy because I still feel strong and have a desire to move forward with my life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Maria pastora, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada y ropa nueva, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios aos de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para mi sustento diario, lo que me satisface porque todavia me siento fuerte y con deseos de salir adelante.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Ana Maria. I am the single mother of three and for a number of years I have supported my family selling corn-on-the-cob and tamales. I am proud to say they are all in school and I hope to give them the means to get ahead.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Ana Maria, cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de elotes y nacatamales ( productos para el consumo Humano), tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos los que gracias a Dios estan estudiando y que con las utilidades que me genera este negocio puedo cubrir estos gastos y sacar adelante a mis hijos.

loan.use: To buy corn, lard, firewood and charcoal.

loan.name: Martir

texts.es: La seora Mrtir tiene 53 aos, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la elaboracin de dulces artesanales hace ms de 30 aos, stos conocimientos los hered de su madre y abuela quienes le ensearon como elaborar los dulces de distintas variedades, preferentemente de las frutas de estacin. Su pequeo negocio est ubicado en un lugar de mucha concurrencia ya que esta al costado de la ruta 2 que une varias ciudades, y las personas que viajan hacen una parada obligatoria para comprar dulces y frutas de los vendedores que estn ah. Mrtir, comenta que en la poca de verano cesa ms la venta de dulces, por lo que ella busca otras alternativas de generar recursos para cubrir sus necesidades y la de su familia, entonces complementa sus ventas de dulces con la venta de frutas y bebidas heladas. Desea comprar ms variedad de productos para vender como miel, bananas, manzanas, mamn (papaya), etc. por ello solicita un crdito de $ 275 para la compra de los mismos.

loan.use: Para compra de man, miel, mamn, etc.

loan.name: Enma Lili

texts.en:
My name is Enma Lili and I have a small business selling produce in a city market. I have been in business for several years, and the income my business generates allows me to help cover my family's living expenses and my children's education. My children attend high school and help me in their free time. The most important thing is that I can take care of my children while continuing to run my produce stall.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Enma Lili, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de verduras en el mercardo municipal de mi ciudad, cuento con varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares, gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de educacin de mis hijos, actualmente ellos estan cursando la secundaria, los que me colaboraran en el negocio en su tiempo libre y lo mas importante es que puedo atender a mis hijos y el negocio.

loan.use: To purchase white onions, potatoes, tomatos, pineapple, sweet potatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, sweet chilis, plantains, and yucca.

loan.name: Nidia

texts.en:
Nidia is 44 years old, single and has a son. She studied hairstyling and got her certificate a year later. Her salon is located in the populous Cabaas de Caacup neighborhood and she has been working for 15 years. She has an established clientele, mostly government workers who visit her salon to get manicures, pedicures, haircuts and hair coloring.

Her greatest accomplishment, thanks to her hard work and with her brother's help, is that she was able to become successfully self employed, opening her own salon and obtaining the training required to provide great service. This enabled her to expand her clientele and become well known in the neighborhood.

She needs a loan in the amount of $250 to buy beauty products, such as hair coloring, shampoo, conditioners, hair spray, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Nidia tiene 44 aos, ella es soltera, tiene 1 hijo, estudi peluquera y se recibi como profesional 1 ao despus, su saln est ubicado en un barrio muy populoso de la compaa Cabaas de Caacup, y ejerce el oficio hace ms de 15 aos, posee clientela formada y la mayora son funcionarias pblicas quienes le solicitan los servicios de de manicura, pedicuro, tintes, peinados, etc.

Su mayor logro es de que gracias a su esfuerzo, y la ayuda de su hermano pudo obtener la independencia laboral, habilitando su saln propio, y adquiriendo los elementos necesarios para realizar los servicios ms exigentes, esto le facilit aumentar su clientela y hacerse conocer en el barrio.

Desea el crdito para comprar productos de belleza como tintes para cabellos, shampoo, cremas, fijador de pelo, etc. el monto solicitado es de $ 250.

loan.use: To purchase hair coloring, condtioners and shampoos

loan.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara R. S. belongs to the Perlas de Pucallpa Communal Bank of Jr. Pachitea from the town of Ollada, in the Calleria District, in Ucayali department.

Sara is 44 years old and is a single mother with 5 children. When her husband abandoned the family, he left them with a lot of debt and she and her children had to work. The first loan she requested from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 300.00 (approximately $94.00). They decided to buy snack foods and sodas with that money. Over time they decided to incorporate food sales, for which they requested a loan of S/. 1,500.00 (approximately $475.00), also from Manuela Ramos.

Now the family works together to tend the business. They wake up at 4:00am and each has their obligations, from cleaning the store to the preparation of the food to serving the customers. However, they dont neglect their studies. At 6:00pm they all meet to go over what went wrong and what went wrong in the business that day. In this way, the continue with more enthusiasm the following day.

The requested loan will be used to improve the store, which is build of wood. They need to paint the exterior so that it will be more visible. Additionally, the kitchen requires maintenance and they need to buy 3 large cooking pots and some tables. Sara is very happy to have paid off her debts. Above all, she and her family are united and they are getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara R. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal "Perlas de Pucallpa" del Jr. Pachitea del sector de la Ollada en el Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Sara tiene 44 aos, madre soltera con 5 hijos, desde que el padre de sus hijos la abandon dejndoles muchas deudas, ella y sus hijos tuvieron que trabajar, solicit un primer prstamo S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) a Manuela Ramos, con ese dinero deciden vender golosinas y gaseosas, pero con el transcurrir del tiempo deciden incorporar la venta de comida, para lo cual solicitaron a Manuela Ramos un prstamo de S/. 1,500 (US$ 475.00 Aprox.). Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio, se levantan a las 4.00 am. y cada uno ya tienen sus obligaciones, desde la limpieza del local hasta la preparacin del alimento y atencin al cliente. Por cierto, no descuidan sus estudios. A las 6.00 pm se renen para ver los errores o aciertos del negocio y as seguir con mas animo el da siguiente. El prstamo solicitado ser para mejorar su local que es de madera y necesita pintar la parte de afuera para tener mejor visin, adems su cocina necesita mantenimiento y requiere comprar 3 ollas y un juego de mesas. Ella esta muy contenta de haber cancelado las deudas pendientes y sobre todo tiene a sus hijos unidos y estn saliendo adelante.

loan.use: For maintenance of kitchen equipment and the building. To buy tables and kitchen items.

loan.name: Ermin Antonio

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ermin and my main occupation is my small grocery store, which I run from a room in my home. I have had this business for several years now and it generates enough income to cover my family's living expenses and other obligations. It has also allowed me to help out my siblings since my parents separated.

I need this loan to purchase additional inventory in order to offer a better selection to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Ermin, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequea pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacin, llamada Pulperia "ERMIN", tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera utilidades para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mis hermanos ya que mis padres se separaron. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice, lard, beans, soap, dairy products, sausages and flour

loan.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca C. H. is 52 years old and she belongs to the Santa Barbara Communal Bank. She lives in the Calleria District. She is separated from her husband and has 6 children. She currently sells medicinal plants from the area, such as rue, basil, and aloe. After Blanca separated from her husband, she found herself in a difficult economic situation. When she saw that it is custom in the region to use plants for medicines and also for some rituals, she decided to get into this business, but she didnt have enough capital. The Movimiento Manuela Ramos gave her the opportunity to invest in this. It was four years ago that she began with a small amount of capital, S/. 300.00 (approximately $94.00). Her current request is for approx S/. 2,000.00 ($625.00).

She will use the money to buy more medicinal plants at whole-sale price. With this amount she could buy 6 bunches of rue, 5 bunches of rosemary, 2 of aloe, and 2 of Holy Wood, 6 of charamasho, and a dozen bottles of scented water.

Blanca is happy with this opportunity because in this way she will be able to get ahead and provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca C. H., tiene 52 aos de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal "Santa Barbara", vive en el A. H. Los Rosales MZ Z Lt 15, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Es una mujer separada con 6 hijos, actualmente vende plantas medicinales de la Regin como Ruda, albaca y sbila. Blanca despus de su separacin con su esposo se encontr en una situacin difcil en lo econmico, fue cuando vio que las costumbres del uso de plantas as como algunos rituales es lo cotidiano en la Regin, entonces se propuso poner este negocio pero no tenia el capital, sin embargo Manuela Ramos le dio la oportunidad de invertir en este rubro y hace 4 aos empez con un pequeo capital de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.), siendo su prstamo actual de S/. 2,000 (US$ 632.00 aprox.). Este prstamo lo requiere para comprar mas plantas medicinales por atados, es decir, ms cantidad a un costo menor, con esto podr comprar 6 atados de Ruda, 5 atados de Romero, 2 atados de sabila, 2 docenas de Palo Santo, 6 atados de Charamasho y 1 docena de agua florida. Blanca esta contenta con esta oportunidad ya que de esta manera podr salir adelante junto a sus hijos.

loan.use: To buy medicinal plants at whole-sale prices.

loan.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
My name is Mariano de Jesus and I have a small cement block manufacturing business called Bloquera C.. I've been in this business for several years and it generates enough income to support my family and cover other living expenses. I have three children who attend elementary and high school and who help me in their free time.

I need this loan to invest in raw materials to meet increased demand in the approaching busy season.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Mariano de Jesus, mi actividad principal es la elaboracin de bloques, cuento con un pequeo negocio llamado Bloquera "C.", tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, tengo 3 hijos los que estan estudiando cursando la secundaria y primaria los que me apoyan en su tiempo libre. Tomando en cuenta que se acerca la epoca de mayor venta, neceito mayor inversin para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loan.use: To purchase cement and sand, raw materials used in the manufacture of cement blocks

loan.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.en:
My name is Juan Crisosto and I have a small home-based business making baskets used in the harvesting of coffee beans. This business generates the income necessary to support my family and meet financial obligations to my suppliers. It has also allowed me to make improvements to my home.

Coffee harvest time is approaching and I need to manufacture enough inventory to meet demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Juan Crisosto, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una Micro empresa de elaboracin de utencilios de Carrizo, ubicado en mi casa de habitacin, gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, tomando en cuenta que ya se acerca la temporada de corta de cafe necesito preparme con producto para poder satisfacer la demanda. Con las utilidadade que me genera este negocio he podido hacerle algunas merjoras a mi vivienda.

loan.use: To purchase ditch reed to manufacture baskets

loan.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is a hard-working, active married mother of three kids, ages 20, 23 and 24. Her husband earns very little, and their kids moved up in their studies the bills increased considerably. In order for her kids can continue their education, Araceli started a business selling clothes four years ago. Soon after, she incorporated selling decorative items and received a very good response from her customers. Thanks to her people skills, Araceli has increased her clientele.

In order to offer her customers a better service and to increase her supplies for the upcoming season, Araceli is requesting a loan of $750, which she plans to repay within six months. By contributing to the growth of this business, you can help Araceli's children finish their schooling and have a better future. Araceli and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Araceli es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 20, 23 y 24 de edad. El salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y cuando sus hijos comenzaron a estudiar a nivel superior los costos del hogar se incrementaron considerablemente, para que sus hijos pudieran continuar con sus estudios Araceli inici su negocio con la venta de ropa hace cuatro aos, poco despus incorpor la venta de artculos decorativos y obtuvo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y gracias a la facilidad de relacionarse con las personas Araceli ha incrementado su nmero de clientes.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y surtir mercanca de esta nueva temporada Araceli est solicitando un prstamo de $ 750 dlares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. T puedes ayudar a que los hijos de Araceli culminen sus estudios y tengan un mejor futuro, contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loan.use: Purchase supplies

loan.name: Maria De Los ngeles

texts.es:
Maria de los ngeles is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She is married, and has a 27 year old son. They are originally from Escobedo in Nuevo Len. Her husband receives a very small salary and it is not sufficient to meet the expenses of the house. Because of this, Maria has set herself up to the sale of natural products and thanks to their good quality she has succeeded in pulling in large numbers of clienents and has been able to expand her business

Maria is asking for a loan in the sum of $750 so she can fill her current log of orders. She has dedicated herself to repay the loan in 6 months, and with it she hopes to improve the quality of her service and continue expanding as before. Maria sincerely thanks you for the confidence and help you give her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de los ngeles es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, est casada y tiene un hijo de 27 aos de edad, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo Len. Su esposo recibe un salario muy bajo y no es suficiente para solventas los gastos de su hogar, por esta razn desde hace 10 aos Maria se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y gracias a la buena calidad de stos ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene Maria est solicitando un crdito de $ 750 dlares mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses, con esto ella espera mejorar la calidad de su servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Maria agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le birndas.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Sindia Adalitza

texts.en:
My name is Sindia Adalitza and I run a small grocery store from a room in my house, which is centrally located within my community. I have been running this business for 3 years and it generates enough income to pay my suppliers and help with my family's living expenses. I have 2 sons who attend elementary school.

Because my sales have increased, I need to buy additional inventory to offer my customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Sindia Adalitza, soy comerciante, cuento con una pequea pulperia en mi casa de habitacin, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo 3 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los compromisos con los proveedores y contribuir con los gastos de mi familia , tengo 2 hijos los que estan cursando educacin Primaria.

Considerando que el volumen de venta ha crecido necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loan.use: To purchase sugar, lard, flour, oil, sausages, dairy products and soap

loan.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
Maria Susana lives in the locality of Escobedo. She is married, and has three children. Her husband works in a professional company but as their children have grown his salary became insufficient to cover household expenses and school fees. Therefore, Maria began to sell footwear among her relatives and neighbors and has done so for ten years. Her gusto for salesmanship has helped her to develop and augment her portfolio of clients.

In order to meet the demand of her clients and improve the quality of her service Maria needs a loan for $750, which she will use in the purchase of merchandise for the new season-with which she hopes to increase her sales. She promises to repay this money in 6 months. Maria and her family thank you for your help in improving the quality of life of her family and contributing to the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Escobedo vive Maria Susana, ella est casada y tiene tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero al crecer sus hijos el salario de su esposo se volva insuficiente para cubrir los gastos del hogar y las colegiaturas, as que Maria comenz a vender calzado entre sus familiares y vecinas hace diez aos, pero su gusto por las ventas le ha ayudado a crecer e incrementar su cartera de clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio Maria necesita un crdito por $ 750 dlares que emplear en la compra de mercanca de la nueva temporada, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas y promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecern.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia is an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has three children aged 21, 22, and 24. Her family has financial problems because of her husband's small salary. Given the necessity of an extra salary, for the past ten years Patricia dedicated herself to the production and sale of food, with which she has been able to cover several family debts and pay for the continued education of her children. Thanks to the good quality of the products she prepares, she now has many orders and has incresed the variety of foods she prepares.

So that she can increase her production to cover her demand, Patricia is asking for a loan of $750, which she will use to purchase kitchen hardware. She has promised to repay her loan in 6 months. With part of her profits, Patricia hopes to continue expanding her business and thanks you very much for the help you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 21, 22 y 24 aos de edad. Su familia tenia problemas econmicos causados por el bajo salario que recibe su esposo, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, desde hace diez aos, Patricia se dedica a la elaboracin y venta de comidas con lo que ha ayudado a cubrir algunas deudas y apoyar a que sus hijos continen en la escuela. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora, ahora tiene muchos pedidos y ha incrementado la variedad de alimentos que prepara.

Para poder incrementar su produccin para cubrir su demanda, Patricia esta solicitando un prstamo de $ 750 dlares que emplear en la compra de utensilios de cocina, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Patricia, ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loan.use: Purchase of kitchen hardware

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and has four children. Fortunately, they were able to acquire their own house but the mortgage has greatly reduced the family income. In order to help her husband with routine expenses, Maria began to sell tacos and hamburgers in her house, but when the demand for her products increased and she began to require the help of her older daughter to help fill her orders, together they improved the service they could offer and created a business.

At the present time, Maria is asking for a loan of $550 dollars which she will use in the acquisition of a cart so she can be able to travel to the factories with which she hopes to continue expanding her business. Maria promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Patricia and her familty sincerely thank you for deciding to help them. The wellbeing of her family is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Guadalupe est casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Afortunadamente pudieron adquirir su propia casa pero las hipotecas reducan mucho el ingreso familiar y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, Maria comenz a vender tacos y hamburguesas en su casa, poco despus la demanda por sus productos se increment y requiri la ayuda de su hija mayor para poder cubrir sus pedidos, juntas han mejorado el servicio que ofrecen y han hecho crecer el negocio.

En estos momentos Maria est solicitando un prstamo de $ 550 dlares que utilizar en la adquisicin de un carrito para poder ubicarse cerca de las fbricas con lo que esperan continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos est el bienestar de esta familia, decdete a apoyarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: Purchase of a taco cart

loan.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children.
