Her husband works in a tire repair shop, but his salary is meagre and does not manage to cover the basic necessities of his family. This is the reason why Dora began her own business in the sale of cosmetics. She started by selling door to door, and thanks to her talent for communicating and good service that she offers, she won over many clients. Now she counts on the help of her older son for the delivery and collection of money for her products.

To continue expanding, Dora needs a loan of $550 to cover some orders that she has and to offer good service. She has agreed to repay the loan in 6 months. You can help improve the livlihood of this family by contributing to the expansion of the business. Dora sincerely thanks you for your confidence and the help which you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Dora es una mujer entusiasta y muy trabajadora, est casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Su esposo trabaja en una vulcanizadora pero su salario es muy bajo y no alcanzaba a cubrir las necesidades bsicas de su familia razn por la que Dora comenz su propio negocio con la venta de cosmticos, empez vendiendo casa por casa, gracias a su facilidad para relacionarse con los dems y al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logr tener muchos clientes, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo mayor para la entrega y el cobro de los productos.

Para continuar creciendo Dora necesita un crdito de $ 550 dlares para cubrir unos pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, Dora agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loan.use: Purchase of merchandise

loan.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is considered a strong, responsible woman with a lot of perseverance. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is retired, so she decided to start her business because they could not cover their monthly costs. She began selling clothing, but one day she was invited to a demonstration of beauty products. She was excited about this and liked that it did not require much initial investment. In addition, the prices of the products are accessible to the public and it's a well known brand, already well accepted in the market.

Now Juana has her own group of salespeople and receives commissions from their sales. She has a good sales record. Juana is asking for a loan of $925 to fill more orders for products and have a better selection of products for her clients and expand her range. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months.

She and her family very much appreciate the help that will let her continue to grow her business, and improve the quality of their lives.

Juana se considera una mujer luchadora, perseverante y responsable, est casada y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, y ella decidi poner su negocio por que al jubilarse su esposo los ingresos de l ya no podran cubrir los gastos familiares y por ello empez con su negocio, ella empez vendiendo ropa, pero un da la invitaron a una demostracin de productos de belleza y se animo a dedicarse a eso ya que le gusto mucho la idea y no requera de mucha inversin, adems que los precios de los productos son cmodos y accesibles al pblico y como es una marca conocida tienen mucha aceptacin en el mercado.

En la actualidad ella ya tiene su propio grupo de vendedoras y recibe comisiones por las ventas de ellas y ella tiene un buen record de ventas. Juana est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para realizar ms pedidos de productos y tener un mejor surtido de los mismos para poder atender a sus clientes y ampliar su cartera, ella ofrece pagar el prstamo en 6 meses

Te agradece mucho junto con su familia por el apoyo que le das para continuar su crecimiento con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: Buy merchandise for businss

loan.name: Luisa Georgina

texts.es:
Luisa is a woman who considers herself to be enthusiastic, an entrepreneur and gregarious, with many profits from her work and moving forward. She is married and her husband works as a cashier-receptionist in a hotel. They have four children, three of whom are students. One of her sons helps them in the store from time to time. She began the store because of the necessity of helping her husband out with costs of living and the education of her children. She began by selling lingerie but with time changed to selling food, specifically tacos. This business brought her more business than her previous one, and she continues to dedicate herself to this today. Little by little she increased her sales and hopes to continue to expand her store.

Luisa is asking for a loan of US $650 in order to purchase the following: kitchen utensils, spoons, chairs, sunshades, frying pans and a tank of gas, to enable her to increase her sales and cover the day to day demands that keep increasing. She is hoping to repay the loan in six months. Luisa and her family are very appreciate of your support which will enable them to continue with their business.

Translated from Spanish by Chlo Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa es una mujer que se considera entusiasta, emprendedora y amigable, con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante. Ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como cajero-recepcionista en un hotel, tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estn an estudiando, algunos de sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio a veces. Ella empez con su negocio por que tenia la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educacin de sus hijas, inicialmente empez con ventas de lencera pero con el tiempo cambio de giro a la venta de comidas, especficamente tacos, negocio que le deja mejores utilidades que el anterior, por lo que se dedica en la actualidad a eso, poco a poco ha ido mejorando sus ventas y espera continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Luisa est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US $650 para poder comprar utensilios para la elaboracin de comidas tales como ollas, cucharas, sillas, una sombrilla, sartenes y un tanque de gas, lo que le permitir mejorar sus ventas y cubrir su demanda que da a da se va incrementando, ella ofrece pagar el prstamo en 6 meses. Luisa y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase cooking utensils, among other things for her store

loan.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria Antonia is a very creative, hard-working, honest and easy-going woman. She is a widow and mother of three children who are all married. She really enjoys making crafts and took numerous courses on the subject. In order to maintain an activity and to put into practice her skills and to use her creativity she decided to start a business selling crafts. This business enables her to have a profit which helps suport the cost of living and part the cost of her apartment, and from time to time she helps out her youngest son with payments for his professional career. She began by seling pastries and then crafts and then specific orders from her home. A friend suggested she also give them to her to sell and in this way sales spread between families and friends and she accumuluated clients as the time passed.

Maris Antonia is asking for a loan of US $825 in order to purchase raw materials and thus enable her to take more specific orders from clients to satisfy their desires which also leads to more overall demand for the same products from other clients. She is offering to pay the loan back in six months. She is very appreciative of your support which will enable her to continue with her business and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chlo Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara Antonia es una persona creativa, trabajadora, honesta y sencilla, ella es una mujer viuda y tiene tres hijos todos casados, ella tiene un gusto por las manualidades y a tomado varios cursos sobre el tema, fue as como para mantenerse activa y poner en prctica sus habilidades y desarrollar su creatividad decidi poner su negocio de venta de manualidades, el cual le permite un ingreso que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y en parte los de su hogar, a la vez que ayuda a su hijo menor con los pagos de su carrera profesional. Ella empez haciendo postres y luego paso a las manualidades y arreglos para su casa, y un familiar le sugiri que tambin los hiciera para vender y as empez vendiendo entre familiares y amigos y luego se hizo de clientes con el paso del tiempo.

Mara Antonia est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US $ 825 para comprar materia prima y poder elaborar ms arreglos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y tener mayor demanda de los mismos, ofreciendo pagar el prstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loan.use: Purchase raw materials

loan.name: Selenia Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Selenia Yamileth and I have my own small business selling clothes, cosmetics and jewelry, both door to door and by special order. I have been in business for several years and it has allowed me to help with my family's living expenses.

I am requesting this loan because demand has increased and I would like to be able to offer a better selection of goods to my customers. In this business, more choices translate into better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Selenia Yamileth, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa nueva , cosmeticos y joyas, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad. Gracias a los ingresos de este negocio puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia.

Actualmente necesito mayor inversin ya que la demanda ha crecido y asi poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes. tomando en cuenta que este tipo de negocio entre mayor surtido hay mejores son las ventas.

loan.use: To purchase men's and women's jeans and shirts, and jewelry

loan.name: Teresita De Monserra

texts.es:
Teresita is an accomplished, responsible career woman. She is married and has three daughters who are 20, 16, and 14 years old. Her husband works in an agro-industrial company as a veterinarian. One of her daughters help her in her business, which she started because she enjoys sales. While she has the extra income to live on, she needs it for her all her children's tuition costs. The reason she started her business was so that she could send her children to college. She started her business 6 years ago, selling clothes amongst neighbors and close friends and acquaintances. It took off well and she increased the range of items to sell like perfumes, women's sandals and accessories, and her customer base has increased.

Teresita is seeking a loan of $925 to buy more fashionable clothes, perfumes, sandals, and accessories to stock up her business and to better attend her customers. She will repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you for giving your support to grow and develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresita es una mujer trabajadora, cumplida y muy responsable, ella esta casada y tiene tres hijas de 20, 16 y 14 aos de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja en una empresa agro industrial como mdico veterinario. Una de sus hijas le ayuda en el negocio, el cual empez por que le gustan mucho las ventas y de esta manera tambin poda tener un ingreso extra para su hogar, ya que el gasto es elevado por que todas sus hijas estn estudiando y necesitan este ingreso para que puedan terminar sus estudios, esto es el motivo ms grande que la llevo a iniciar su negocio ya que desea que todas sus hijas tengan estudios universitarios. Ella empez hace 6 aos con su negocio vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinas y amistades y le comenz a ir muy bien, entonces amplio su gama de productos e incursion en la venta de perfumes, sandalias para dama y accesorios tambin, as su clientela se ha incrementado.

Teresita est solicitando un prstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar ropa de temporada, perfumes, sandalias y accesorios para surtir ms su negocio y as atender mejor a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el prstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les das para poder continuar ampliando y creciendo su negocio.

loan.use: Buy more merchandise

loan.name: Calixtas

texts.es:
My name is Calixta and I have a small business baking bread which I then sell from my home. I have been in business for several years and this business generates enough income to help with my family's living expenses. But the most important advantage is that it allows me to work from home and care for my children, who help me in their free time.

Thanks to the income I have generated, I have been able to make improvements to our home and raise my family's living standard. This loan will be used to buy more raw materials for my bread-baking business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Calixta, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la elaboracin de pan (producto para consumo Humano), ubicado en mi casa de habitacin, cuento con varios aos de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, lo mas importante es que este negocio me permite atender a mis hijos, los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre. Gracias a los ingresos que persivo he mejorado mi vivienda logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loan.use: To purchase firewood, flour, lard, sugar and eggs

loan.name: Maria Martina

texts.en:
My name is Maria Martina and I have a small business selling firewood and dairy products from my home. I have been in business for several years and this business generates income that allows me to help cover my family's expenses and pay my suppliers.

I am requesting this loan to buy additional inventory to help me meet demand. Thanks to this business, my family's standard of living has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Martina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de lea y producto lacteos, ubicado en mi casa de habitacin en el centro de mi colinia, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y hacerle frente a los compromisos con los proveedores. Actulamente necesito de mayor inversin para satirfacer la demanda existente, gracias a los ingresos de este negoco hemos mejorado nuestro nivel de vida.

loan.use: To purchase firewood, cheeses and butter

loan.name: Maria Socorro

texts.en:
My name is Maria Socorro and I have a small business selling firewood, cosmetics and lotions from my home. This business has allowed me to take care of my family and to generate enough income to help cover my family's living expenses.

This business has been a blessing and has helped improve my family's financial situation. I am requesting this loan to purchase additional firewood, cosmetics and lotions for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola soy Maria Socorro, mi actividad principal es el comercio, tengo un pequeo negocio de venta de lea, cosmeticos y lociones, en mi casa de habitacin, tengo varios aos de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me permite generar ingresos y atender a mi familia, gracias a las utilidades que me genera puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia.

Este negocio es de mucha bendicin para mi ya que hemos vistos que nuestra situacin economica ha mejorado.

loan.use: To purchase firewood, cosmetics and lotions

loan.name: Reina Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Reina Suyapa and I have a small business selling clothing from a shop centrally located in my city. I have been in business for 3 years and fortunately have been able to generate enough income to support my family. I am a single mother with two school-age children.

I am requesting this loan to buy more inventory to be able to provide my customers with a better selection of clothes, because more variety results in greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Reina Suyapa, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 3 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que gracias ha Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos los que estan en la escuela.

Actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos, tomando en cuenta que estos negocios entra mas surtido esta mejores son las ventas ya que el cliente se atrae con el surtido, con la variedad de productos.

loan.use: To purchase men's and women's clothing

loan.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila has been in the business of selling foodstuffs to schoolchildren for over 15 years now. She's never really been able to have an ample food supply, so she's been taking up the slack with fried foods of a simple nature, such as stuffed wheat flakes and the like.

Still having to care for 2 children (out of 5 she had, three don't live with her any more), and with no help from anyone, Petronila has been 'praying' for resources with which to replenish her stock of food to sell to the schoolchildren during this season. Her prayers are answered in our having been able to get to her community, called "Mulo" (literally means "mule") in the Yamasa area, Altagracia province of the Dominican Republic.

loan.use: Restocking the store for the new school term

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en:
The clothing business is one of the favorites for microentrepreneurs, as everyone needs clothing and there's a ample profit margin in sales of such. In the case of the "pacas", we are talking of even higher margins than those usually found in the business, as these are pressed bundles of new and used clothing that are sent to poor countries as assistance, but end up being traded in an "open" market in this country. The business is even more profitable when you buy unopened bundles, as the element of surprise makes the initial sales price lower for lack of real knowledge of what's in the bundle.

Usually the bundles are made up of clothing which is much more appreciated in the market than the real price paid for the unopened bundle. (Sometimes one can get 'burnt' in the process, but this is a rare occasion, and usually one can at least 'break even' under the most negative clothing bundle conditions.)

Even though Francisca is a young mother, she now needs to take care of her offspring, and therefore is going to start out in this business, which she feels is the most lucrative she can develop. Or as she affirms..."for the time being".

loan.use: To purchase "pacas" (bundles of new and second-hand clothing) for resale

loan.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has 4 children, 3 of whom are now pretty much grown up ladies, but she still has to care for her 17-year-old son (the one in the picture). He is blind and has a drain for the fluids that accumulate around a tumor in his brain (apparently the cause for his blindness). They have long since given up on any possibilities to improve this young man's unfortunate condition. However, Carmen realizes she can't give up in searching for ways to maintain herself and this sick child.

For over 18 years now, Carmen has been sellling bedding to earn a livelihood. She now plans to have a better future by using the requested loan to buy more products for resale. She says bedding can be sold at a good profit, there being an ample market for it.

loan.use: To buy bed sheets and spreads

loan.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma T. X., 29, is a member of a women's loan group where every one of the women weaves huipiles, the traditional Mayan women's top. In this village they weave the huipil of relatively simple cloth, but then embroider it richly. Irma can make 2 huipiles in 15 days, and then she sells them in the market in Chimaltenango for about US$65 each. She'll invest this loan, as she did the previous one, in the yarn she needs for weaving and in embroidery thread. She says that having a bit of capital via the loan just makes things a little easier it's not a big problem trying to get money together to buy yarn, which used to be the case. In fact, she still has a little left from her last loan, which is completely paid off.

Irma's dream is to build a house and buy some land. She currently spends about $200/year to rent a little 20 by 40 meter plot where she grows corn, the staple food of the people here. Buying a 20 by 20 meter plot would cost her about $2000.

Irma, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Irma's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread.

loan.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel M. Marroquin, 26, weaves the huipiles which are in such demand in the highlands of Guatemala. Because women here still wear the traditional costumes, they all need huipiles, and Isabel is one of the hundreds or thousands of women that weave them by hand. She takes the bus ride to the market in Chimaltenango every 15 days or so to sell the five huipiles that she's woven and embroidered. They sell for about US$28/each. Her loan will be invested immediately in yarn to make more huipiles. Even though this is her first loan ever in her life, she's not afraid, because she knows she can earn the money to pay it back.

Isabel is single and has one little boy who's just a year old. Her dream is to just get a little ahead a little at a time. She has great educational goals for her son Isaias, partly because she dropped out after just one year of primary school.

Here is a video of the women of Isabel's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread

loan.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria has two small children to feed. She's photographed here in front of her very poor home with its earthen floor, with her younger daughter.

For over two and a half years now, in order to feed her children as well as cover other living expenses, Eleuteria has resorted to slaughtering chickens, plucking the feathers and selling them "dead", i.e., "Pollo matao". She can make a profit of some US$ 0.75 per chicken; normally, she can sell some 300 chickens a month. Thus she makes an average of some US$ 225 a month, whereas she needs to make around $550 (twice what she now makes) in order to meet the standard cost of living for a family in her area today.

Given an eager and acceptable market, this loan can supply Eleuteria with precisely what she would need in order to balance out her requirements to meet normal cost of living expenses. Eleuteria eagerly awaits the moment when she can do this!

loan.use: Buy chickens for slaughter

loan.name: Kelin

texts.en:
Kelin is a 25-year-old who makes huipiles for her livelihood. Huipiles are wonderful handmade blouses worn by the Mayan women in the highlands of Guatemala. She will buy the hand-woven material from other women in her village and then hand embroider flowers and through out the blouse. Her technique of embroidering these fabrics is highly specialized and different from that of her neighbors she actually apprenticed to another master embroiderer to learn the technique.

The current piece she is creating incorporates 33 different Mayan symbols which are called hieroglyphs. The Maya hieroglyphics were the writing system of the pre-Columbian civilization. It will take her 15 days to create the exquisite finished blouse and she will sell it for about US$85. She also makes a less expensive blouse that has embroidered flowers throughout the top part of the blouse and sells for about $35.

Kelin is married and has a 3-year-old. Her husband works in the fields. Her biggest goal, which she is passionate about, is to ensure that her child must receive an education to become a professional, escaping the limited opportunities her husband endures.

Her health is not good and like so many other women and children in her village, she suffers from many ailments during the six-month rainy season. Malnutrition is a factor in this community. The women all breast feed and most of the children under two years old are underweight and therefore get hit the hardest with illness. Many of the women are looking for resources to obtain vitamins for their babies.

Here is a video of the women of Kelin's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase embroidery thread

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. Y. T. is 23, married, and has two small children. Like all the other members of her women's group, she weaves and embroiders the traditional women's top called a huipil. She will use this loan to purchase the two basic types of yarn she needs for creating her art. The first type is the yarn used for weaving, and then she also buys cones of embroidery thread.

Maria's big dream is to get an electric pump on the well at her house. She thinks it might take her a couple of years, but she wants to make it happen.

Maria, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Maria's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread

loan.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona has been making bread for over 15 years now. She says her main difficulty is having to buy the flour, oils, and seeds she uses for bread making. However, she states that she now needs a more modern oven to bake her bread. She's presently using an oven fueled by wood. She says that she wants to have an alternative to using fuel which she knows is wasting trees.

When we sat down to do some math relative to the cost of energy, we found that for her, wood is cost-effective, plus the fact that wood as a source of cooking heat is unbeatable with respect to flavor of the final product! Thus we concluded that if she could buy more flour and other cooking needs, she might have just the right combination of cost and product effectiveness. Hence, Ramona is 'counting the hours' until she can get her loan, so as to stop "beating around the bush" to make a living!

loan.use: baking bread for her community

loan.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde M. Marroquin, 24, weaves and embroiders the traditional Mayan women's top called a huipil. She can make about 3 each month, and sells them in the Chimaltenango market for perhaps US$28 each. She'll rush right out and invest this loan in yarn and embroidery thread. This is her first loan of her life, and having a bit of capital to buy the raw materials will be an amazing experience.

Matilde is married and has a little 9-month-old. Right now she and her husband rent a plot of about 20 by 40 meters to grow the corn that they use as their primary food, but she dreams of actually buying a plot of her own, which would cost as much as $1000. And someday she dreams of constructing a house too.

Matilde, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Matilde's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread.

loan.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina Y. T. is 21 and along with the rest of her women's group, weaves huipiles, the traditional women's blouse of highland Guatemala. She can weave and then embroider four of them in a 15-day period, and then she sells them in the market in Chimaltenango for about US$70 each. This will be her second loan with Friendship Bridge, and she says that having the capital lets her make just a little progress on the economic front, making just a little more profit, since she doesn't have to struggle so to save up to purchase the yarn.

Paulina's group, the "Flor de Pascua", or "Easter Flower" group, takes their loan commitment very seriously. They receive their loans as a group and are jointly accountable for them. They're very proud of their repayment record.

Paulina, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face. Paulina's theory is that they are lacking some type of vitamins, but she is not sure what it might be.

Here is a video of the women of Paulina's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loan.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her clothes business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more stock for his shop.

loan.name: Lilik

texts.id:
Lilik, who lives in Guritama Road no. 32, owns a cookie shop. She needs about $10 daily to buy the ingredients for the cookies she sells. She expects to make $2.50 profit daily. Lilik plans to use part of that profit to pay installment for this loan from DINARI and the rest to pay school fees for her two children, currently in primary school. With her baking skill, Lilik can also help her husband in sustain their family's economic situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilik yang tinggal di jalan Guritama no. 32 ini mempunyai usaha menjual kue, dengan biaya yang dibutuhkan 100.000 rupiah/hari untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat kue Lilik mendapatkan keuntungan 25.000 rupiah/harinya yang nantinya akan digunakan untuk mencicil pinjaman yang ada di DINARI dan untuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya yang masih SD. dengan keahlian membuat kue mentah Lilik dapat membantu suaminya dalam menjalankan perekonomian keluarga.

loan.use: Purchase cookie ingredients

loan.name: Ferry

texts.id:
Mrs. Ferry V. lives at 32 Gurita St., Sesetan, South Denpasar. She lives with her husband and his three sisters. Mrs. Ferry has enthusiastically run a laundry business for about one year. This would now be the second loan period. When it's busy, she averages ten customers a day. Every customer brings 3 kilograms. For each kilogram, Ibu Ferry charges Rp. 10,000. Thus every day, Ms. Ferry receives about Rp. 300,000. When it's quiet, she only serves one to three customers. The loan of Rp. 700,000 she will use to increase the possibility of adding more customers. This will allow her to increase the income so that she can add to the family income.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ferry V. tinggal di Jl. Gurita no. 32 Sesetan, Denpasar Selatan. Dia tinggal bersama dengan suami dan tiga putrinya. Ibu Ferry mulai menekuni bisnis laundry ini selama kurang lebih satu tahun. Sekarang merupakan periode pinjaman kedua. Kalau sedang ramai setiap harinya rata -rata dapat sampai dengan 10 pelanggan. Setiap pelanggan membawa 3 kg. Setiap kg Ibu Ferry menghargainya sebesar Rp 10.000,00. Jadi Setiap hari pendapatannya sekitar Rp 300.000,00. Apabila sedang sepi dia hanya akan melayani satu sampai tiga pelanggan. Pinjaman sebesar Rp 700.000,00 dia harapkan dapat semakin memungkinkan dia untuk mencari semakin banyak pelanggan. Sehingga itu akan menambah penghasilannya untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.

loan.use:
Purchase detergent, bleach and scent. Further funds will be used to pay for the maintenance of the washing machine. -
Pembelian deterjen, pemutih dan pewangi. Selain itu juga untuk biaya pemeliharaan mesin cuci.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her fruit selling business.

loan.name: Lilik

texts.id:
Lilik, who lives in Guritama Road no. 32, owns a cookie shop. She needs about $10 daily to buy the ingredients for the cookies she sells. She expects to make $2.50 profit daily. Lilik plans to use part of that profit to pay installment for this loan from DINARI and the rest to pay school fees for her two children, currently in primary school. With her baking skill, Lilik can also help her husband in sustain their family's economic situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilik yang tinggal di jalan Guritama no. 32 ini mempunyai usaha menjual kue, dengan biaya yang dibutuhkan 100.000 rupiah/hari untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat kue Lilik mendapatkan keuntungan 25.000 rupiah/harinya yang nantinya akan digunakan untuk mencicil pinjaman yang ada di DINARI dan untuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya yang masih SD. dengan keahlian membuat kue mentah Lilik dapat membantu suaminya dalam menjalankan perekonomian keluarga.

loan.use: membeli bahan-bahan kue

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: T o expand his clothing business.

loan.name: Sutikah

texts.id:
Sutikah has realized that she has the talent to make cookies since she was a little girl playing with her friends. Now she can use that talent to help her family's economic situation. Sutikah is a master in making donuts, and from her business, Sutikah makes about $5 profit daily from $10 starting capital. She supplies the donut she makes to the vendors in nearby markets. She says that demand increases sharply during Ramadhan and Muslim fasting month. So she needs extra labor help, that she usually gets from her neighbors.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

kemampuannya untuk meracik bahan untuk membuat kue sudah dirasakan Sutikah sejak kecil ketika bermain bersama teman-temannya, bahkan bakat itu sekarang bisa menunjang perekonomian keluargannya. Sutikah ahli dalam membuat kue donat dan dari usahanya tersebut Sutikah mampu meraup keuntungan 50.000 dari modal 100.000 rupiah/hari. kue donat tersebut dmasukan ke penjual-penjual kue yang ada di pasar-pasar terdekat, menurutnya biasanya kalau mendekati bulan puasa dan ramadhan pesanan bisa meningkat tajam dan kalau sudah demikian maka Sutika membutuhkan tenaga extra yang dapat membantunya yaitu tetangganya.

loan.use: purchase cake ingredient

loan.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad H. is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli. He now lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan with his wife and three children. He runs a potato-selling business, in which he purchases potatoes from other regions of Azerbaijan and brings them to the Beylagan city bazaar. He currently sells to both families and to other bazaar shopowners and has two employees. The demand for his potatoes is so large that he sells out very quickly and is not able to work a full day as he has no products left. He would like to borrow $1,000 in order to make a bulk purchase so that he can maximize his sales and expand his business.

loan.use: To expand business

loan.name: Ferry

texts.id:
Mrs. Ferry V. has lived in Bali for about 16 years. She lives in Bali with her husband and three girls. Mrs. Ferry decided to enter the laundry business because she can make money while staying home to take care of her infant third child. She has been in the laundry business for one year. She plans to use the loan to buy detergent, bleach and fragrance that she needs. Every day her business makes about $3 (with 1 client) to $30 (10 clients) in revenue. The loan will help her to increase her capacity to serve more clients, which of course will increase her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ferry V. sudah tinggal di Bali selama kurang lebih 16 tahun. Setelah menikah dia dikaruniai tiga orang putri. Dia tinggal di Bali bersama suami dan tiga putrinya. Ibu Ferry memutuskan menekuni bisnis laundry, karena bisa dikerjakan di rumah. Hal ini disebabkan putrinya yang ketiga masih bayi. Bisnis ini sudah ditekuninya selama satu tahun. Pinjaman yang ada dia gunakan untuk menambah modal untuk pembelian deterjen, pembersih dan pewangi yang dia butuhkan. Setiap harinya dia dapat memperoleh antara Rp 30.000,00 ( 1pelanggan) - Rp 300.000,00 (10 pelanggan). Modal tersebut juga membantu dia untuk dapat menambah pelanggan. Semakin besar modal yang dia miliki, semakin banyak pelanggan yang dia milik. Hal ini tentu saja akan menambah penghasilannya.

loan.use: Purchase of detergent, bleach and fragrance

loan.name: Gubad

texts.en:
Gubad is an Internally Displaced Person from the Agdam region in Azerbaijan. He is married and has 2 children. He has a shop where he sells different types of clothing and has been running this business for 5 years.

He has little of his own funds to develop his clothing business or increase the variety of his inventory, so he has applied to Normicro Baku branch for a $500 loan.

loan.use: To increase his clothing inventory

loan.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz is an Internally Displaced Person from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. She currently lives in a hostel in Baku. She is married with three children. Aybaniz owns a workshop where she is engaged in tailoring and has 4 other employees working with her. She has been in this business for 10 years. She takes orders and makes clothes according to her clients' tastes.

Aybaniz is currently requesting an $800 loan from the Normicro Baku branch so that she can purchase enough raw materials to fulfil her orders.

loan.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring shop

loan.name: Jos

texts.es:
Mr. Jose is 37 years old, he is separated from his wife and has 2 children. The two children live with his ex-wife. Jose suffered a car accident 6 years ago when he was working for a private company, this accident left him paralyzed because he suffered injuries in his spinal cord.

After the accident he suffered the separation from his wife and now he is alone in his house and one of his brothers takes care of him, this same brother also helped him with his recovery. Jose has shown a real appreciation for life and inner strength.

Three years ago thanks to some saving he had and with the help from some family members he started a small shop in his home. Currently it is well stocked and he has good business activity. His disability has not been a hindrance. He wakes up at 4:00 am every morning to start his daily activities in his wheel chair. Jose is a very respected man in his community because of his honesty, people skills, and because he is an example to the community. He asks for a $950 loan to invest in the purchase of bulk goods such as sodas, beer, cheese, eggs and others so he can stock for the demand of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

El seor Jos tiene 37 aos, est separado y tiene 2 hijos, ambos viven con su ex esposa. Jos sufri un accidente automovilstico hace 6 aos cuando era empleado asalariado de una empresa privada, dicho accidente le dejo paraltico por haber sufrido daos en su columna vertebral. Posteriormente a este accidente sufre la separacin de su matrimonio y se quedo solo en su casa bajo el cuidado de uno de sus hermanos quien le ha ayudo en el proceso de recuperacin.

El demostr en todo momento fortaleza para vivir y hace 3 aos atrs gracias a un ahorro y ayuda de sus familiares el abri una despensa en su casa, la misma actualmente est muy bin surtida y registra buen movimiento de ventas, para l no fue ningn impedimento la dificultad fsica que tiene, ya que se despierta a las 04:00 de la maana para iniciar su jornada laboral en su silla de ruedas.

Jos, es un seor muy respetado y querido en el barrio por su trabajo honesto, su don de persona, y por ser un ejemplo para las dems personas que no tiene las dificultades fsicas que l padece.

Solicita un crdito de $ 950 para invertirlos en la compra al por mayor de gaseosas, cervezas, almidn, queso, huevo, etc. de esta forma poder abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.

loan.use: The purchase of bulk goods such as sodas, beer, starch, cheese, and eggs.

loan.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is single. He runs a small business selling antennas, phones and bags in the local market of Vasilyevka. He is a skillful manager who knows how to survive in an aggressive market economy environment. Alexander has been in this business for over 10 years. Currently, his monthly profit is about $500.
Alexanders consistency, perseverant work and commitment to his business have ensured the growth and success of his small venture. He always treats people with respect which is one of the most effective methods of providing his business with a solid foundation. He also has a unique ability to reach and maintain the right customers. Moreover, Alexander is always willing to help his clients with some tips which oftentimes is something much needed. Alexander is very hard-working and finds time not only to do his business but also take care of his elderly father who needs much attention and help. At the moment he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase the inventory for sale in his kiosk. One of his long-term plans is to open his own little store facility.

loan.use: To increase assortment of inventory for sale

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 27 years old, single, and is the owner of a photography business located in the center of the city, close to the Basilica de Caacupe, where every year crowds of faithful paraguayans gather from all over the country.

He has had this business for more than 12 years, and says that inicially he started to help his uncle, but once he felt sure professionally he decided to rent a studio, and with the initial loans obtained bought the necessary accessories to run his own business. Today he a solid client base and is associated with a group of people involved in event decoration, who inform him about festivals, birthdays, so he can present his proposals and gain more clients.

The world of photography is very competitive and requires one to be very dynamic and creative, because today clients are very demanding. Carlos is requesting a loan of $600 to buy a DVD burner, so that he can produce his work in DVD format.

Carlos tiene 27 aos, es soltero, es dueo de una casa fotogrfica, la misma est ubicada en el centro mismo de la ciudad, cerca de la Baslica de Caacup, donde cada ao se conglomeran un montn de fieles paraguayos de diferentes partes del pas. Este oficio lo desarrolla ya hace mas de 12 aos, comenta que inicialmente empez siendo ayudante de su to, y una vez que el se sinti seguro profesionalmente decidi alquilar un saln y con los primeros prstamos obtenidos fue comprando los elementos y accesorios necesarios para su independencia laboral. Hoy da ya tiene formado su clientela y se asoci con un grupo de decoradoras de fiestas quienes le facilitan las informaciones referentes a eventos, acontecimientos, cumpleaos, festivales, etc. para presentar sus presupuestos y de esta forma adquiere clientes. El mundo de la fotografa es un rubro muy competitivo y se requiere ser muy dinmico, creativo, ya que los clientes hoy en da son muy exigentes. Desea el crdito de $ 600 para comprar un reproductor de Dvd para poder realizar sus trabajos de filmaciones en formato Dvd.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: Invest in a DVD burner

loan.name: Boris

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Boris has operated a sheets and textiles sales kiosk in the central market of Pavlograd, Ukraine. Energetic and enterprising, Boris is known among his clients and fellow entrepreneurs for successful and stable business growth. He operates his business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence.
Currently, Boris is requesting a loan for $1000 to open a new vending facility. The additional business location combined with Boriss work ethic and experience will enable him to expand his business, increase his income, and employ an additional worker. As his business continues to grow, Boris looks to the future with plans to purchase an apartment for his daughter.

loan.use: Open new vending facility

loan.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor has a little business selling baked goods and chocolate at the Central market in Kherson, Ukraine. An experienced entrepreneur, he has been selling for eight years and has been successful offering good quality products for low prices. Igor supports his family of four with his venture - he and his wife, Elena, have a nine year old son and a six year old daughter.
Igor currently has two sales locations for his business, one of which is in a good location that gives him an edge in selling his products. Igor has requested a loan of $1000 so that he can purchase new food inventories to stock his kiosks. This is Igors third loan with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to more opportunities to assist him with his business.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya, pictured here in our loan office in Ivano-Frankivsk, has two little daughters, aged 3 and 2. She and her husband, Igor, have a successful childrens clothing sales business at the busy Pyatachok market in Ivano-Frankovsk. Both work together in the business which is the primary source of income for their family. In a typical month they make around 4,000 Ukrainian Ghrivna in profit which equals about $900. Mariya has an education in business and accounting. She had worked for someone else previously, but then decided to become self-employed.
Mariya has requested a loan of $800 to purchase some new items for the business. Shed like to buy a good supply of t-shirts, pants and childrens suits. With profits from their business, Mariya and Igor hope to pay off their apartment and purchase a car. They also have announced that they are expecting an addition to the family with their third child on the way. Nadiya Ukraine is happy to be able to support hard-working, dedicated entrepreneurs like Mariya and Igor. We wish them continued success with their business and family.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena and her teenage son Alexei live in Vasilyevka, Zaporozhye region. Yelena runs a small business selling womens lingerie in one of the local markets. She tries to increase the selection of her inventory regularly as it always attracts new clients. Yelenas vending stall is well known in the market because with the variety of merchandise she has for sale, she can always meet the needs of even the most demanding clients.

Yelena is a fairly new entrepreneur. However, her trade is constantly growing. Yelena has been a market vendor for 9 months and has about $1,500 in inventory.

Yelena is notable for her immense willingness to work -she is not afraid of hard labor. She works day and night to earn enough to give her son everything he needs for a normal life, as well as to develop her small business. She believes her business can bring her a good profit by helping women be more feminine and beautiful. Yelena is requesting a loan of $500 to open a new vending facility and expand her trade.

loan.use: To open a new vending facility

loan.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
Senora Cornelia is 46 years old, and is married with four children. She has been running a nursery from her home more than 20 years. One of her children helps her with care and maintenance of the business. Cornelia is a very dynamic woman, active and creative, and is always looking for ways to diversify the products she sells. She invested the prior loans in seeds and fertilizers. She is requesting $200 so that she can buy potted plants of various sizes and colors to sell.

La seora Cornelia tiene 46 aos, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Ella tiene un vivero de platas y se dedica a este oficio hace ya ms de 20 aos; y su negocio de venta de plantas lo tiene en su misma casa, y uno de sus hijos la ayuda en el mantenimiento y atencin del vivero. Cornelia, es una seora muy dinmica, activa y creativa, en todo momento busca diversificar los producto que vende ya que tiene proyectado incorporar ventas de planteras (macetas) de barro en su negocio. Los prstamos obtenidos con anterioridad los invirti en la compra de semillas y abonos, hoy solicita $ 200 para poder comprar planteras de barro de diferentes tamaos y colores para venderlos en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: Purchase potted plants in different sizes and colors

loan.name: Yelena

texts.en:
A veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, Yelena was one of the first clients of our Berdyansk loan office in Ukraine. She is a skilled and driven entrepreneur and has opened three new vending facilities in the central market of Berdyansk within the past ten months. Working with her daughter, Yelena sells womens lingerie and linens. She is organized and a great manager with an excellent reputation among other entrepreneurs.

Currently, Yelena is requesting a loan for $1,000 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits, Yelena plans to open a new vending facility near the beach, where tourists and high traffic offer an excellent business market.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena O. operates clothing and footwear kiosks in the markets of Berdyansk, Ukraine. Having graduated from Berdyansk Business School with a degree in business management, Yelena operates her business with excellence and expertise. Focused, committed, and known for her integrity, Yelena carries an excellent reputation among both clients and entrepreneurs in her region. With her excellent work ethic, Yelena has multiplied her turnover capital five times since she opened her business.

Currently, Yelena is seeking a $500 loan to re-stock her inventory and seasonal clothing. With the additional income, she plans to open a new vending facility in Berdyansk as well as continue supporting her family and two sons.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
For the past four years, Yuliya has operated a childrens clothing kiosk in the central market of Melitopol. Shy but hardworking and enterprising, Yuliya has successfully grown her business to provide herself with a stable and consistent income. Yuliya uses her income to support her mother and continue investing in her growing business.

Yuliya is a veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine and has successfully used the support of micro-loans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Yuliya is seeking a loan for $600 to increase her inventory. With the additional profits, Yuliya plans to continue developing her business and eventually purchase her own apartment.

loan.use: Purchase inventory

loan.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Mrs Fermina is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. She has been selling crafts for 25 years. Her specialty is the sale of "Planteras", which are clay flowerpots especially made for plants. There are many kinds of Planteras that vary in colors, shapes, sizes and motifs. Her main providers are the pottery makers from Aregua, which is an hour away from her own city, Caacupe.

Fermina is a very dinamic hard-working woman. In addition to crafts, she sells cow meat, which is provided by one of her brothers that owns a butcher shop. She is very good at managing both these activities. These activities generate enough income to cover the family's expenses and give a good education to her children, since they are in schooling age.

She invested her previews loans on the purchase of clay Planteras of various sizes and colors. She exhibited them herself on her house's patio. She goes to Caacupe on the weekends, where she receives plenty of visitors and therefore makes the biggest sales.

She wishes to obtain this loan to be able to purchase more ornament variety - such as decorative figures ( elves, flowers, animals, etc).

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Fermina tiene 47 aos, ella est casada y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de artesanas hace ya ms de 25 aos. Ella vende especialmente ornamentos de barro conocidos como planteras que son macetas utilizadas para las plantas. Existe un sin fin de clases variando desde el tamao hasta los colores y motivos. Sus principales proveedores son los alfareros de la ciudad de Aregu, la misma queda a 1 hora de distancia de la ciudad de Caacup. Fermina, es una seora trabajadora y dinmica, ya que de forma paralela a la venta de artesana, ella vende carne vacuna para consumo, que le son provedos por un hermano que tiene una carnicera. Ambas actividades lo maneja muy bien ya que le genera ingresos como para cubrir los gastos propios de la familia y dar una educacin adecuada para sus hijos ya que ellos estn aun en edad escolar. Los prstamos que obtuvo con anterioridad los invirti en la compra de planteras de barro de todas las medidas y colores, la misma lo tiene en exposicin en el patio de su casa. Los fines de semanas son los das en que la ciudad de Caacup recibe gran cantidad de visitante y por ende son los das en que registra mayor venta de estos productos. Desea el prstamo para comprar ms variedad de ornamentos de barros, como figuras decorativas de barro entre ellos hay duendes, flores, animalitos, etc.

loan.use: Purchase more variety of clay ornaments

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Sra. Francisca is 52 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Three of them still live at home and are going to school.

She makes homemade jam and all sorts of homemady sweets (candy) traditional to the area. She says that she inherited her talent at making sweets from one of her aunts who taught her everything she knows since she helped her aunt for many years until she decided to go on her own.

Sra. Francisca has been making and selling candy for the past 25 years. Some of the candy flavors are guayaba, apple and whatever fruit that's in season.

She works from home. She already has all the ingredients/supplies necessary to do her work. She makes candy twice a week. Her primary clients are the ones at the local market located in the city of San Lorenzo which is about 45 Km from Caacupe.

Sra. Francisca tells us that with the previous loans she has received from Fundacion Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation), she has been able to buy the main ingredients and main supplies for her business. She is hoping to display and sell her candy at the local arts/crafts expositions in the cities of Altos, Tobati and Aregua which are located about one hour away from Caacupe. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 USD so that she can purchase a big table, a chair and some sort of sunshade in order to go to these expositions.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Francisca tiene 52 aos, est casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos aun viven con ella y van al colegio. Ella se dedica a la elaboracin y produccin de dulces (mermeladas) caseros, nos comenta que el arte de elaborar dulces artesanales lo adquiri de una ta quien le enseo las tcnicas de elaborado y de quien fue ayudante por varios aos hasta que decidi independizarse. Ya van 25 aos desde que Francisca trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo sus dulces, algunos de los sabores que podemos citar tenemos dulce de frutilla, guayaba, manzana y frutas de estacin. Trabaja en su propia casa, ella cuenta con todos los elementos necesarios para la elaboracin de los mismos. Prepara sus dulces dos veces por semana y sus principales clientes son los negocios ubicados en el mercado de San Lorenzo, ciudad distante a unos 45 Km de Caacup. Francisca, comenta que los prstamos que le otorgo la Fundacin Paraguaya con anterioridad le han sido de mucha ayuda ya que de esa forma obtuvo capital para comprar las materias prima y los elementos necesarios. Tiene en proyecto mostrar sus productos en las exposiciones artesanales en las ciudades de Altos, Tobat y Aregu, las mismas quedan a menos de una hora de la ciudad de Caacup.; para ello solicita el prstamo de $ 100 de manera a poder comprar la mesa, silla y el toldo que necesita para estar en estas exposiciones.

loan.use: To purchase a table, chair and a canopy

loan.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She specializes in a type of handicraft called "aho poi", which is hand stitched embroidery for blouses, pants and dresses. It is a typical handicraft of Paraguay and many women who practice it pass on their knowledge and technique from generation to generation. Like the majoriy of women, Josefina learned how to do this from her mother, who taught her everything she knew.

Josefina attends handicraft expositions in different cities, bringing along her products to sell. In addition to the "aho poi", she also does sewing by request, things such as dresses, pants, blouses, etc. With this, she helps her husband maintain the house and the monthly bills of the family. Two of their children are already in school so the costs have increased. With the loan of $200, she would like to buy fabrics and thread in greater quantity and more colors, in this way she can save costs by getting better discounts.

Josefina tiene 34 aos, est casada y tiene 3 hijos, ella es especialista en la confeccin de ropa de todo tipo de modelos de la lnea de aho poi. El aho poi es un bordado hecho a mano con diferentes motivos y realizados en camisas, pantalones vestidos, etc., es un trabajo tpico de Paraguay y muchas mujeres artesanas lo realizan y pasan sus conocimientos de la tcnica de generacin en generacin. Como la mayora de las mujeres ella adquiri el oficio como herencia de su madre, quien le enseo todo lo que sabe. La seora Josefina, siempre asiste a exposiciones de artesanas en diferentes ciudades, llevando as su arte y vendiendo sus productos. Adems del aho poi, ella tambin realiza costuras bajo pedido, como vestidos, pantalones, camisas, etc. Con esto Josefina ayuda a su marido a mantener la casa y los gastos de la familia ya que sus dos hijos estn en la escuela y por ende los gastos son ms elevados. Tiene pensado hacerse en adquirir en mayor cantidad hilos y telas en cantidad y diferentes colores, de forma ahorrar costo obteniendo importantes descuentos; para ello solicita el crdito de $ 200.-

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: To buy thread and fabric for embroidered handicrafts

loan.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is 36 years old and a single mother of a son, to whom she gives all the love and care she can. Lilian told us that she began sewing more than 20 years ago. She learned from her mother, who she helps and trades work with. Lilian is a humble person and a very hard worker, thanks to her efforts and the support from the Fundacion Paraguaya, she has been able to gain independence and establish her own sewing shop where her clients come to request different types of clothing. Lilian makes wedding dresses, blouses, uniforms, etc.

She would like there to be more opportunities for work in her country because the economic situation for most people is more stable. In this way, they can avoid more people emigrating to other countries in search of work. Already many of her clients have left for other countries.

In recent months, Lilian has received a large quantity of orders, and to be able to complete them she would like to buy thread, fabric, buttons, zippers wholesale, because buying in greater quantities enables her to get better discounts from her suppliers. To make this happen, she is requesting a loan of $200.

La seora Lilian tiene 36 aos, es madre soltera de un hijo varn a quien ella brinda todo el amor y cuidados necesarios. Lilian nos cuenta que se inici en el rubro de la costura hace mas de 20 aos y lo aprendi de su madre, con quien siempre intercambian trabajos y se ayudan. Ella es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, gracias a su sacrificio y con el apoyo de los crditos otorgados por la Fundacin Paraguaya ella pudo independizarse y establecer su propio taller de costura donde hoy da recibe a sus clientes que solicitan diferentes tipos de trabajos. Ella realiza vestidos de novias, quinceaeras, camisas, uniformes, etc. Ella desea que en el pas existan ms fuentes de trabajo para que la situacin econmica de todos sea ms estable de esta forma evitar que la gente emigre a otros pases en busca de trabajo, ya que muchos de sus clientes emigraron a otros pases. En los ltimos meses ha recibido una gran cantidad de trabajos, para poder cumplir con todos desea adquirir telas, hilos, botones y cierres al por mayor ya que comprando en grandes cantidades obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores. Para realizar estas compras, Lilian, solicita un crdito de $ 200.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loan.use: To buy thread, fabric, buttons and zippers in bulk

loan.name: Ana Luisa De Lourdes

texts.es:
I need to add a cement overhang to the front of my house because the sun beats down there all day and the heat is unbearable even when we have the air conditioning on.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Me hace falta poner un techo de concreto al frente de mi casa ya que el sol le da todo el da y el calor es insoportable, aun y cuando tenemos los aparatos de aire encendidos. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construccin del techo de concreto.

loan.use: Add a cement overhang to the front of my house.

loan.name: Francisco

texts.es:
I have an unfinished construction; my house is missing a door and I need to plaster the walls and install the floors. This will make my house more comfortable for my family, as the space becomes limited. I am requesting $1000 to finish the construction and the plastering.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una construccin sin terminar; me falta la puerta, enjarrar y poner el piso. Esto har mi casa ms cmoda para mi familia, ya que el espacio es cada vez ms reducido. Solicito $1000 para terminar la construccin y enjarrar.

loan.use: Completing a construction, plastering and installing a door.

loan.name: Belkin Anabel

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Belkin Anabel and my main source of income is a grocery retailing business. I depend on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes sells prepared foods) in my house that allows me to help my family and contribute to household expenses. I've been operating the pulperia for a year. My future plan is to supply more merchandise so that I can offer my customers a variety of products and thereby increase my income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Belkin Anabel, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequea pulperia en mi casa de habitacin, la que permite atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi hogar, tengo un ao de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad. Mi planes futuros es surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a los clientes variedad de productos, logrando asi mejores ingresos.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loan.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
My name is Alba Luz; my main source of income is retailing and I rely on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes serves prepared foods) in my house called Pulperia "Las Gemelas" (The Twins). The pulperia generates income so that I can contribute to paying family expenses and, consequently, improve both my family's income and our standard of living. I currently need a bigger investment to satisfy existing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Alba Luz, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequea pulperia en mi casa de habitacin, llamda Pulperia "Las Gemelas" la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida de mi familia. actualmente necesito de mayor inversin para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Juan Francisca

texts.es:
Hi. I'm Juana Francisca and my main source of income is retail trading. I depend on a small pulperia (a traditional grocery store that sometimes sells prepared foods) located in the center of my neighborhood. I've built the business over the last 2 years and it allows me to contribute to paying family expenses. My business has a very good customer base because it's strategically located. I currently need more supplies because the busy season is approaching and sales will increase considerably. Thanks to this business, our children are able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Juana Francisca, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequea pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi cumunidad, tengo 2 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para aportar con los gastos de mi familia y cumplir con los proveedores. Mi negocio cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que l a ubicacin es estrategica, actualmente necesito surtir mas ya que se aproxima la buena temporada y las ventas mejoran considerablemente, gracias a este negocio nuestros hijos pueden estudiar.

loan.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loan.name: Idalia Marleny

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Idalia Marleny and my main source of income is a clothing sales business. I'm a street vendor and I rely on sales of new clothes and footwear that I get on consignment. I've been selling clothes for 3 years and the business generates income that covers my family's expenses and payments to my suppliers. Thanks to the this business, I've improved my house and the comfort of my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Idalia Marleny, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo 3 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores. Gracias a las utilidades que persivo de este negocio he mejorado mi vivienda, logrando mayor comodidad para mi familia.

loan.use: Buy clothes for clothing sales business.

loan.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
My name is Gloria Isabel, I am a merchant and I own a small business located in the center of my city. I have been doing this for 2 years, and it generates the income I need to pay for the family expenses and to pay my providers.

My biggest wish is to own my own store, so that I don't have to drag around my merchandize every day.

At this moment, I need to better assort my business because the national holidays are getting close and the sales volume is increasing.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es Gloria Isabel, soy comerciante y cuento con un pequeo negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 2 aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para aportar con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores.

Mi mayor deseo es poder tener nuestro propio local y no tener que estar acarriando la mercaderia todos los das.

Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se acercan las fiestas patrias y el volumen de venta aumenta.

loan.use: Rubber sandals, men's t-shirts, women's skirts, children's pants, and underwear

loan.name: Isidora Florinda

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Isidora Florinda. I am a merchant and I own a small business selling new clothing in the center of the city. I have been doing this for several years. Thanks to God, I have been able to run it well and it generates the income to contribute to the family expenses. Thanks to the income from this business, I have been able to pay for my children's studies.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Isidora Florinda, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es el comercio, tengo un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicada en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que gracias a Dios he sabido administrar y que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. gracias a los ingresos de este negocio he logrado que mis hijos estudien.

loan.use: Tu purchase women's blouses, jeans, children's dresses, t-shirts, boys' outfits, and underwear

loan.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
My name is Gloria Maria. I am a merchant and I have my own business selling new clothing and cosmetics. It is located in front of the Boulevard of my city and it is called Variedades GLORIA. I have been doing this type of business for two years, and thanks be to God, it generates enough income for me to cover my familys expenses and other obligations incurred with suppliers. Taking into account that the Independence Day holidays are nearing, I need to stock my business well since sales increase at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Gloria Maria, soy comerciante y cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos, ubicado frente al Boulevar de mi ciudad, llamado Variedades "GLORIA" tengo 2 aos de realizar este tipo de actividad la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos adquiridos con los proveedores. Tomando en cuenta que se acercan las fiestas Patrias, necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor

loan.use: To buy an inventory of jeans, skirts, t-shirts, and school pants and shirts

loan.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino works in his home, where he has a small, rudimentary carpentry shop. He has had for more than five years and it is the only source of income for his family. His family is made up of himself and his wife, their children no longer live with them. Paulino makes brushes, brooms, and other products that are in demand the area because of his low prices and high quality. Given the type of product that he makes, Paulino doesnt have much competition because he is the only person in the area who does this sort of work. Additionally, he repairs furniture in peoples homes.

The prices of the raw materials for the carpentry shop vary according to the type of wood he buys and according to the quality demanded by customers. This loan request is also for the purpose of buying plastic products that he needs to make the brushes and brooms, which are his specialty.

This is the fifth loan that will be granted to this client, who has shown himself to be responsible in paying back his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulino trabaja en su domicilio ya que en el mismo est instalado su pequeo taller de Carpintera, un taller rudimentario que funciona hace mas de cinco aos y es l nico sustento de la familia. Su familia est compuesta por l y su esposa, sus hijos ya no viven con ellos. En el taller, Paulino fabrica cepillos, escobillones y otros productos que son demandados en la zona por su bajo precio y calidad. Dado el tipo de trabajo y los productos que elabora Paulino, su competencia no es elevada ya que en la zona es el nico que realiza este tipo de trabajos. Paralelamente tambin efecta trabajos a domicilio para el mantenimiento y arreglo de muebles. El precio de la materia prima para el taller varia de acuerdo al tipo de madera que se compre o tambin de acuerdo a la calidad que demanden los clientes, la presente solicitud es tambin para la adquisicin de productos plsticos, que necesita para la elaboracin de los cepillos y escobillones, productos que son su especialidad. Este es el quinto prstamo que se le otorga al cliente, tiempo en el cual demostr ser una persona responsable en cuanto al pago de sus cuotas.

loan.use: To buy raw materials (wood and plastic) for making brushes and brooms

loan.name: Teodosa Laudina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Teodora Laudina. My main job is sales. I have a small business selling clothing and cosmetics, which is located in my house, that allows me to generate income and contribute to paying my familys expenses. Currently sales are good, for which reason I need to invest in inventory. I dont have sufficient capital to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Teodosa Laudina, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de ropa y Cosmeticos, ubicado en mi casa de habitacin, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante. tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me permite generar ingresos y contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito mayor inversin y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer a los clientes.

loan.use: To buy deodorant, lotion, shampoo, women's undergarments, and blouses

loan.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
I run a hair salon at my home. I would like to buy new furniture, like chairs, mirrors and armchairs, to better serve my clients and make them more comfortable, and to increase my clientele. I am requesting $1000 to acquire new furniture for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un negocio de peluquera en mi vivienda y me gustarla comprar mobiliario nuevo, como sillas, espejos y sillones para atender mejor a mis clientes, que estn ms cmodos y as aumentar mi clientela. Solicito $1000 para comprar mobiliario nuevo para mi negocio.

loan.use: Improve my business

loan.name: Nedy Suyapa

texts.es:
My name is Nedy Suyapa. My main job is sales. I have my own business selling used clothing, located in my house. It allows me to take care of my family and generates income to help out with household expenses. I have been working in this business for several years, and thanks to it we are able to give an education to our children. We have also improved our income and standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Nedy Suyapa, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicado en mi casa de habitacin. El que me permite atender a mi famia y me genera ingresos para aportar con los gasto de mi hogar, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio y gracias a ello podemos dar educacin a nuestros hijos, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos y el nivel de vida.

loan.use: To buy an inventory of used clothing

loan.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juana de Jess. My occupation is making bread and nacatamales (a type of Central American tamal). I make them at home and sell them in the street. I have been doing this for several years and it generates income to cover my familys expenses, while also allowing me to take care of my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Juana de Jesus, mi actividad principal es la elaboracin de pan y nacatamales ( productos para consumo Humano) los que elaboro en mi casa de habitacin y los distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, al mismo tiempo que me permite atender a mi familia. tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad.

loan.use: To buy flour, eggs, shortening, sugar, and margarine

loan.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Elmer Enrique. I have owned a repair shop for vehicles for 3 years. It generates the income I need to pay for the expenses of my family and other obligations.

At this moment, I need to purchase a vehicle to go buy the parts I need for the repair of the different types of cars that daily arrive at my shop.

Thanks to this business, I have been able to construct my own house.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original loan description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Elmer Enrique, mi actividad principal es la reparacin de vehiculos, actividad que realizo desde hace 3 aos el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos.

Actualmente mi mayor necesidad es la compra de un vehiculo el que necesito para trasladarme de un lugar a otra para la compra de repuestos para la reparacin de los diferentes vehiculos que a diarios llegan a mi taller.

Gracias a este negocio he logrado construir mi casa.

loan.use: Towards the purchase of a vehicle

loan.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Danelia del Carmen. I am a merchant and I own a small business where I sell cosmetics, lotions, and fashion jewelry, which I distribute as an ambulant vendor. I have done this for several years, and it generates the income I need to cover the family expenses and pay my vendors. At this moment, I'd like to better stock my business and offer a larger variety of products to my customers. Most of them are school teachers and office workers. The better assorted by business is, the better the sales and income will be.

Translated by Ran F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombre es Danelia del Carmen, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de cosmeticos, lociones y enchape, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, considerando que la mayoria de mis clientes son maestros y empleados de oficina. considerando que entre mas surtido esta el negocio mayores son las ventas y por ende los ingresos.

loan.use: Purchase of lotions, cosmetics, and fashion jewelry

loan.name: Sixto Hernandez

texts.es:
My name is Sixto Hernandez. My principal work is in commerce in a store located in the transport terminal of my city. I have several years of experience in dedicating myself to this type of work. It generates income for me to cover the expenses of my family and my commitments to suppliers. I have a very good clientele and the location of my business is strategic. For that reason, I need to supply a bit more to be able to offer a variety of products to my clients.
