Rosa tiene 34 aos y 2 hijas, ellas estn estudiando. Rosa es madre soltera su esposo la abandono hace 6 aos y desde entonces su negocio es su fuentes de ingresos. Su casa es de construccin mixta, su piso es de tierra. El anhelo de Rosa es seguir creciendo con su negocio e ir construyendo su vivienda poco a poco tal como lo esta haciendo hasta ahora. Y de esta manera dar mayor seguridad a su familia y negocio.

loan.use: Purchase greater quantity and variety of products

loan.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Business Description

Alexandra began her business twelve years ago. She manufactures garments for women, men and children, such as slacks and trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and leg warmers. She gives her customers personal attention every day, from nine in the morning until six in the evening.

Purpose of the Loan

She would use the loan to buy a machine that attaches snaps and clasps to clothing and also to buy fabric from which to make outfits. In this way, she hopes to offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

About the Applicant

Alexandra is 32. She is a single mother. Her husband left her nine years ago. She lives with her parents, and she has a space for her workshop there. She employs another single mother with a three-year-old daughter. She used her own capital to start her business. She hopes to improve herself and her business and in this way give her parents more help with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Descripcin del Negocio

Alexandra inicio su negocio ladies' undergarments hace 12 aos. Los productos que elabora son: Prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y nios como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, calentadores. La atencin de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los das desde las 9am-a -6pm.

Uso del Prstamo

Alexandra necesita del prstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquina para pegar broches y tambin adquirir telas para elaborar conjuntos de vestir. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Informacin Personal

Alexandra tiene 32aos. Es madre soltera .Su esposo la abandono hace 9 aos. Tiene 1 hija que est estudiando .vive en la casa de sus padres .Ocupando un espacio para su taller .Alexandra proporciona empleo a otra madre soltera que tiene una nia de 3 aos. Inicio su negocio con capital propio. Aspira mejorar y crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr brindar una mejor ayuda a su hogar y a sus padres.

loan.use: To buy tools for her sewing business

loan.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Rita Maria. I am a merchant and I own a store where I sell (used) American Clothes in the center of my city.I have been doing this for several years now, as it generates the income I need to pay for the educations of my children.

I am very happy with this business as it also allows me to take care of my children, and that is important to me.

At this moment, I want to stock my business and I don't have enough capital to satisfy the customer demand.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola mi nombres es Rita Maria, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de Ropa Americana en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingreso para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y cubrir los gastos de educacion de mis hijos.

Me siento muy contenta con este negocio porque me permite atender a mi familia y eso para mi es ganacia.

Actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loan.use: To buy a bundle of sweaters, pants, and shirts.

loan.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Business Description

Edmundo and his wife run a shoemaking business. Currently they manufacture only sandals. They have had this business for two years, and they have dedicated a part of their home to the business.

Purpose of the Loan

He would use the loan to buy raw materials so as to increase the amount of goods he can merchandise. He would use part of the loan to fix up the workshop, which needs repairs.

About the Applicant

Edmundo is 41. He has two children who attend school. His house is of mixed construction styles, and his family life is stable. His goal is to advance his business to ensure that his children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Descripcin del Negocio

Don Edmundo y su esposa tienen un taller de calzado en la actualidad solo hacen sandalias, este negocio lo tienen hace dos aos, y en su domicilio pues han adecuado un local para ubicar el taller

Uso del Prstamo

El necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima y asi tener mas producto para comercializar. Otra parte del credito louasara para acondicionar su taller pues necesita una remodelacion

Informacin Personal

El tiene 41 aos y dos hijos que estudian su casa es de construccin mixta y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educacin de sus hijos

loan.use: To buy raw materials for his shoemaking business

loan.name: Jos

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Jos D. and his family run an autmobile repair and painting shop. His son and another worker help him run the business. He has had this business for five years. They have bought a lot next to his house where they park the cars they are working on, so that he can run his business more effciciently.

Purpose of the Loan

He would use the loan to buy raw materials and to pour a cement floor over the earthen floor of his workshop.

About the Applicant

Jos is 57. He has five children, two of whom attend school. His wife sells soft drinks to help meet household expenses. His goal is to update his workshop with the latest technology.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Descripcin del Negocio

Don Jos y su familia tienen un taller de pintada y enderezada de vehculos, a el le ayudan en el trabajo un hijo y un obrero, este negocio lo tienen hace cinco aos, ellos han comprado un terreno al lado de su casa donde ubican a los vehculos para realizar mejor su trabajo

Uso del Prstamo

El necesita el crdito para comprar mas materia prima y para arreglar el piso de su taller pues aun lo tiene solo de tierra y desea hacerlo de concreto

Informacin Personal

El tiene 57 aos y cinco hijo de los cuales dos estudian su esposa vende bebidas gaseosas para ayudar en el hogar, sus meta es de mejorar su taller con tecnologa de punta

loan.use: To install a cement floor in his shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy cosmetics at reduced sales price

loan.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
My name is Miguel. I am an entrepreneur and I own a small diary products business, that I sell as an ambulant vendor. I have been doing this for several years now, and it generates the income I need to pay for the family expenses.

It is important to know that with the income from this business, I have improved my home and this way improved the living standard of my family.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original loan description in Spanish:

Mi nombre es miguel, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeo negocio de venta de productos lacteos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios aos de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me permite genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia.

Es importante mensionar que con las utilidades de este negocio he mejorado mi vivienda, logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida para mi familia.

loan.use: To buy cheese, butter, and cream cheese

loan.name: Herlinda Trinidad

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Herlinda Trinidad. I am am entrepreneur and I own a small grocery store at my home, named "Pulperia Isis Karina". It generates the income needed to contribute to pay for the family expenses, and it allows me to take care of my children myself.

At this moment, I would like to better stock my business so I can offer a greater variety of products to my customers, as the location of my store is very good.

Translated by Ramn F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

Hola Mi nombre es Herlinda Trinidad, mi actividad principal es el comecio, cuento con una pequea pulperia ubicada en mi casa de habitacin, llamada Pulperia "ISIS KARINA" tengo varios aos de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y lo mas impotante es que me permite cuidar a mi hijos.

Actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, ya que la ubicacin de mi negocio es muy buena.

loan.use: To purchase sugar, shortening, rice, soap, dairy, sausages, and basic grains.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Invest in new products to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Continue buying new products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy raw materials like aluminum and panels

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Buy more merchandise for her store

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy merchandise for her food market

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand dining space

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy clothing that is both varied and seasonal

loan.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Business Description

Jessica works hard to sell uniforms and books to a school in her community. She started this business 10 years ago with the help of her brother who is the direct of this school. In this business, her husband helps her. These days, her sales have increased since the school's student body has also grown.

Loan Use

She needs the loan to purchase merchandise like casual uniforms, since they are in a period of performing civic duties.

Personal Details

She is 25 years old and has one son and lives in her parents home. Her goal is to make money from her sales to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Descripcin del Negocio

La Sra. Jessica se dedica a la venta de uniformes y libros en una escuela de su comunidad empez hace 10 aos con la ayuda de su hermano que es el director de dicha escuela. En el negocio le ayuda su esposo hoy en da sus ventas han aumentado ya que la escuela tambin ha crecido

Uso del Prstamo

Ella necesita invertir en la compra de mas mercadera tales como uniformes casuales ya que estamos en temporada de actividades cvicas.

Informacin Personal

Ella tiene 25 aos y un hijo y vive en casa de los padres y su meta es en un futuro con las ganancias de sus ventas poder construir su casa.

loan.use: To buy more uniforms and other products

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Expand his workshop

loan.name: Roque

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. A. is devoted to the sale of pigs. He started his business two years ago and his regular customers are the butcher shops at nearby markets; his wife helps him with the sales and the demand is presently growing.

Loan Use

He wants to invest in the purchase of more pigs, to be able to satisfy his clients demands, and he presently doesnt have the required capital to do so.

Personal Information

He is 37 years old and has two children, who study in nearby schools. His house is made of cane and his goal is to make his business grow and, one day, have a farm to raise his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripcin del Negocio

El Sr. A. se dedica a venta de chanchos. El inici su negocio hace dos aos y sus clientes fijos son las carniceras de los mercados cercanos; en las ventas le ayuda sus esposa y actualmente sus pedidos estn aumentando.

Uso del Prstamo

El quiere invertir en la compra de ms cerdos para de esta manera poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, ya que hoy no cuenta con un capital suficiente.

Informacin Personal

El tiene 37 aos y dos hijos, que estudian en establecimientos cercanos. Su casa es de caa y su meta es un da poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener una granja en el campo donde criar a sus animales.

loan.use: To buy pigs.

loan.name: Faiq

texts.en: Faiq A. is a 32-year-old businessman who lives with his four children and wife in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Bilasuvar region. Faiq in an internally displaced person from Nagorniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. Faiq has five years experience in pharmacy. He started his business in 2002 when he borrowed some money from his friends. His chemist shop is the best one in his region and he is working very hard. He would like to borrow $1,00 to expand his business and purchase a consignment of eye glasses. This product is in high demand in Bilasuvar because people have to go to the capital of Azerbaijan to purchase them. He plans to repay the loan in 18 months.

loan.use: Going to purchase consignment of eye glasses

loan.name: Qarib

texts.en: Qarib I. is a 52-year-old farmer who owns a milk product business in the southern Azerbaijani region Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person from Nagornniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. Qarib has been running his business since 1994. He sells yoghurt, cheese and milk to the local people and also to bazaar traders in Bilasuvar. Qarib has two cows, but needs more to cover his family's needs. Qarib plans to expand his business by purchasing a cow and a calf. The estimated cost for one milk cow is 700-800 USD and for calf 400 USD. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and one calf

loan.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim M. is a 38-year-old farmer who lives in the refugees village of Varkhankend in the southern Azerbaijani region Saatli. He is married and has four children. He has one milk cow and a calf. He purchased his first calf in 1995 and grown it has up. Later when it started bringing milk he saved the money and purchased two calves for meat products. He started his meat selling business and did it very well. Now Nazim`s children are grown up and he needs more income to cover his family's needs. Nazim has applied to borrow for 1200 USD to purchase one cow for 700 USD and two baby calves each for 250 USD. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loan.name: Sabir

texts.en: Sabir M. is a 41-year-old farmer who lives with his four children and wife in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar. He is an internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in1993. Sabir has ten years experience in raising livestock. He sells cows to bazaar traders in Bilasuvar. Meat is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at home and cafes. Sabir recently raised one calf and is going to sell it, but before that he needs to purchase additional animals. He also has one cow but it does not grown up enough to give milk. Sabir applied for 1200 USD to purchase one milk cow for 700 USD and two baby calves each for 250 USD. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loan.name: Nabi

texts.en: Nabi M. is a 46-year-old farmer who has one milk cow. He is married and has four children. He recently started sell diary products. When he started his business in 1999, he was selling meat in the Saatli bazaar. Nabi lives in in the southern Azerbaijani village of Varkhankend in the Saatli region. Nabi is going to purchase one milk cow to expand his dairy production and one calf to begin selling meat production to the local bazaar trades. The estimated cost for one milk cow is 800 USD and for calf is 400 USD. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: To purchase one milk cow and one calf

loan.name: Semender

texts.en: Semender N. is a 37-year-old farmer who lives in the southern Azerbaijani village of Varkhankend in the Saatrli region. He is married and has four children. Semender has six years of experience in animal breeding. Currently he has only one milk cow, which was purchased a long ago, and Semender himself raised from a small calf. Semender sells yoghurt and milk to the local people and bazaar traders every day. He is working very hard, from early morning till late night. Dairy products are in high demand and increases every day. Keeping one cow is not enough to cover large family needs and Semender would like to borrow 1200 USD to purchase one additional cow and two calves and start selling meat products,. Meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan. The estimated cost for one cow is 700 USD and for a baby calf is 250 USD. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loan.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil Q. is a 22-year-old trader who has his own food market in the part of Bilasuvar region of southern Azerbaijan. Ramil is an internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Ramil has three years of experience in trading. In his small market he sells food, beverages, cigarettes and toiletry. Ramil lives with his old parents and his market is the only source of revenue in his family. Ramil is satisfied with his revenue in the market but he thinks he could earn much more by offering more goods to sell. He applied for 1200 USD to expand his business. He plans to pay the loan back in 18 months.

loan.use: Going to improve his store conditions

loan.name: Beydulla

texts.en: Beydulla is 57 years old, married and has two children. For the last ten years, he has owned and operated an orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has requested a loan of $600 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve the size and quality of the produce he grows on his orchard.

loan.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loan.name: Magsud

texts.en: Magsud is 36 years old and married with three children. He lives in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan, where he has owned and operated a vineyard for the last eight years. Magsud has applied for a loan of $600 to buy equipment that will allow him to increase the quality and output of his vines.

loan.use: To buy equipment to improve the output of his vines.

loan.name: Shokat

texts.en: Shokat is 52 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and four children. She has run her own farm for the past 14 years, and has used the income it generates to care for her family and raise her children. Shokat has requested a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and fertilizer, which she will use to improve the size and quality of her crops.

loan.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loan.name: Maria Carmela

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and sports accessories for more than 15 years. Both my husband and I work in this business, which is my familys source of income. Thanks to God, sales have gone well, but we want to stock up on merchandise during these cold times, and video games, since the majority of our clients are young athletes, who are asking for sports video games. We are requesting a $1200 loan, in order to buy merchandise and video games, build up our stock and increase the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya ms de 15 aos en el negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios deportivos. En este negocio, que es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia, trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Gracias a Dios nos ha ido muy bien en la venta, pero queremos surtir ms mercanca ahora en tiempo de fro, y video juegos, ya que la mayora de los clientes que tenemos son jvenes deportistas que nos estn solicitando videojuegos de deportes. Estamos solicitando un prstamo de $1200, para comprar mercanca y video juegos, y tener ms inventario y ms ingresos para la familia.

loan.use: To buy merchandise and video games.

loan.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay Q. is a 25-year-old farmer who lives with his parents in the village of Varkhankend in southern Azerbaijan. He has been an animal breeder for the last seven years, and is currently raising buffaloes.

Oktay is going to be married this fall, and is facing increased expenses as he prepares for his wedding and married life. To help meet these expenses, he has requested a loan to buy one cow and one calf. These animals will allow him to sell dairy products locally and to traders who come to his area, and will eventually be sold as meat. He has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy one cow ($800) and one calf ($400).

loan.use: Going to purchase one milky cow and one calf

loan.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar R. is a 27-year-old farmer with two cows who sells dairy products to traders who, in turn, sell them in a nearby bazaar. He lives in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar, where he relocated after fleeing Nagorniy Karabakh during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He is married and has two children.

Khanlar has been selling dairy products, including milk, butter and yogurt, for five years. He started his business with money his parents saved for him. He began with one calf, which is now a full-grown cow. This cow has produced enough dairy products to allow him to buy a second cow. Khanlar would like to continue to expand his business because dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan -- particularly in Baku, the capital, whose traders come Bilasuvar to purchase dairy products.

To meet his goal, Khanlar has come to us for a loan to buy one milk cow and two calves. He estimates that one cow will cost $700-800, and the calves will cost $200-250 each.

loan.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loan.name: Banovsha

texts.en:
Banovsha V. is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband and three children in southern Azerbaijan. She and her family relocated here after fleeing Nagorniy Karabakh during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.

For the last eight years, Banovsha has raised sheep and sold mutton to local people and to traders who do business in the bazaar in the country's capital, Baku. This is a good business to be in because mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan, where people enjoy eating meat daily at home and in cafes. Banovsha works hard to meet her family's needs, and believes this is a good time to expand her business to include raising cows and producing dairy products. Buying two cows will cost $1,600; she has saved $400, and has come to us for a loan of $1,200 to cover the balance of the costs.

loan.use: Going to purchase two milk cows

loan.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ms. Ana is 52 years old, has been married to Flix Medina for more than 25 years and has 2 daughters, who help her with her business when they can, taking into account that both study. Ana has had her shoes sales stand located at a popular market in Asuncin for 12 years. She relates that, with the shoes sales, she managed to build her own house, she is very proud and thinks its possible to make progress and make a living for the family with hard work and sacrifice, giving them an integral education. She also has a small shop at home, ran by her husband, that provides sewing services and alteration of small garments. Her sales stand is precarious, with just a wooden table and a plastic tent for shade. Her dream is to be able to expand her sewing shop, manufacture clothes carrying her own brand and sell them at her own store. She is requesting an $800 loan, in order to buy more merchandise, such as sports shoes, dressing shoes, sandals and kids shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La seora Ana tiene 52 aos, est casada con Flix Medina hace ms de 25 aos y tiene 2 hijas, que la ayudan en su negocio cuando pueden, teniendo en cuenta que estudian. Ana tiene su puesto de ventas de calzado en un mercado muy populoso de Asuncin, desde hace 12 aos. Ana nos cuenta que con la venta de calzado pudo construir su casa propia, se siente muy orgullosa y dice que se puede salir adelante y sostener a la familia con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, dndoles una formacin integral. Cuenta adems con un pequeo taller de costura en su domicilio, del cual se encarga su marido, y donde realiza servicios de costura y arreglos de prendas pequeas. Su puesto de ventas es muy precario, actualmente utiliza una mesa de madera y como sombra una carpa de plstico. Su sueo es poder ampliar su taller de costura ms adelante y as fabricar ropas con su propia marca y venderla en su propio local. Ella solicita un crdito de $800 para comprar ms mercaderas, como calzados deportivos, zapatos de vestir, chancletas y calzados para nios.

loan.use: To buy more merchandise, such as sports shoes, dressing shoes, sandals and kids shoes.

loan.name: Castorina

texts.es:
Fifty two years old Castorina is a knitter of andut, a typical embroidery from Paraguay that imitates a spider web. She became a widow six years ago, remaining the familys only support. She has five children, three of which are adults, have married and live independently. Two of her daughters live with her, go to school and help her with the knitting. The andut embroidery is used as designs or appliqu in dresses, blouses, typical garments, table cloths, purses, shoes, flags and paintings. She learned the skills when she was little, as an employee of a shop devoted to this craft. Nowadays, with great sacrifice, she managed to buy her own machine, allowing her to manufacture her embroidery and alter clothes at home; she also teaches this typical Paraguayan craft to another woman. Castorina wishes to use the loan to buy materials, such as fabrics, colored threads, needles, etc., in this way increasing production and sales. She belongs to the committee Kua Katypyry, which translates to Intelligent Woman and is part of the Program of Entrepreneur Women, a solidary work group of 16 women.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Castorina tiene 52 aos, es tejedora de andut, un bordado tpico del Paraguay que es una imitacin de la telaraa. Ella enviud hace 6 aos, quedando como nico sostn de la familia. Tiene 5 hijos, tres ya son mayores, estn casados y son independientes. Con ella viven dos de sus hijas, que van al colegio y la ayudan con el bordado. Los tejidos de andut son utilizados como apliques o como diseos en vestidos, blusas, trajes tpicos, manteles, carteras, zapatos, banderas y cuadros. Aprendi el oficio desde pequea trabajando como empleada en talleres dedicados a este rubro. Hoy da con mucho esfuerzo logr comprar su propia mquina, de manera a realizar sus trabajos y arreglos de ropas en su propia casa; adems ensea a otra mujer este trabajo artesanal tpico del Paraguay. Castorina desea utilizar el crdito para comprar materiales, tales como telas, hilos de colores, agujas, etc. y de ese modo aumentar su produccin y ventas. La seora forma parte del Comit Kua Katypyry, que significa Mujer Inteligente y que pertenece al Programa Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras, un grupo solidario de trabajo conformado por 16 mujeres.

loan.use: purchase of materials, such as fabrics, threads and needles.

loan.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana Britez is 52 years old, and she has a grocery store in her own home where she works hard to sell basic goods: oil, baked goods, sugar, noodles, rice, cigarettes, drinks, dairy products, herbs. etc. Emiliana started her business 12 years ago as a small grocer store. As the years passed, the store grew because of the special care she had towards for the customers, offering quality and low prices.

She is married to Pablo Estigarribia who is 58 years old and construction worker for 20 years. His job is not stable and obtains work only when a professional architect or engineer hires him for a contract. Their family has 5 children, who are 13, 18, 22, 27 and 31 years old. Only four of them live with them, two of them are at secondary school, and her oldest son is married and already graduated from college.

Her marriage encountered various times of financial distress, putting them at a risk of stopping their children's studies. In spite of everything, they managed to move forward and currently, their children are studying towards technical careers and wish to go to college like their oldest brother.

The loan is for $100, which will be used to buy various merchandise like milk, canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Emiliana B. tiene 52 aos de edad, ella tiene una despensa en su propia casa en la cual se dedica a la venta de productos bsicos para el consumo entre ellos se pueden citar: aceite, panificados, azcar, fideos, arroz, cigarrillos, bebidas, lcteos, yerba, etc. Emiliana nos comenta que empez el negocio hace 12 aos como un pequeo almacn de consumo, con el correr de los aos fue creciendo gracias al trato especial que tiene con la gente, por la calidad y por los precios bajos de las mercaderas.

Est casada con. Pablo Estigarribia de 58 aos de edad, quien es constructor de obras desde hace 20 aos, su trabajo no es permanente y lo realiza solo cuando algn profesional arquitecto o ingeniero lo contrata. La familia tiene 5 hijos de 13, 18, 22, 27 y 31 aos, slo cuatros de ellos viven con ella, dos de ellos estn cursando la secundaria y su hijo mayor est casado y ya posee un ttulo universitario.

El matrimonio pas por varias dificultades econmicas, poniendo en riesgo el estudio de sus hijos, a pesar de todo, salieron adelante y actualmente estudian varias carreras tcnicas y tienen el deseo de ir a la universidad como su hermano mayor lo hizo.

El prstamo de 100 USS, ser utilizado para la compra de mercaderas varias como leche, productos enlatados, azcar, gaseosas, etc.

loan.use: to buy various merchandise and products like milk, canned goods, sugar, soda beverages, etc.

loan.name: Estelvina

texts.es:
Estelvina is a seamstress. She is 47. Her husband, Ubaldo Agero, is 51. She lives in a humble house in Villa Maravilla, a neighborhood bordering the banks of the Paraguay River.

She has two daughters. One is grown and has a family of her own. The younger daughter is nine years old and is the fifth grade. Estelvina manufactures and sells clothes, such as skirts, slacks, shirts, dresses. She says that her best sellers in this winter season are sporty cotton ensembles consisting of slacks and jackets.

She learned this trade when she was very young, working in sewing factories. She goes each morning to the city's Municipal Market, where she sells her clothes from a booth. She returns to her house each evening to be with her family. She also sews in the evenings in her small home shop on her own sewing machine, which she managed to buy after much hard work.

She would use the laon to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and so on, and in this way increase her production and sales.

She belongs to the Women in Action Committee of the Program Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundacin Paraguaya. The 16 women who belong to this committee represent a unfied working group.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

Estelvina es una costurera de 47 aos, est casada con Ubaldo Agero, navegante de 51 aos. Viven en una humilde casa en el Asentamiento Villa Maravilla un barrio que queda a orillas del Ro Paraguay. Tienen 2 hijas, una es mayor de edad y ya tiene una familia establecida, la ms pequea tiene 9 aos y cursa el 5to grado de la escuela primaria. Ella se encarga de confeccionar y vender ropas como: faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc. Ella nos comenta que su prenda con mayor venta en esta temporada de invierno, son los conjuntos deportivos de algodn que consta del pantaln con la campera; este oficio lo aprendi desde muy pequea trabajando como empleada en talleres de confeccin. Todas las maanas va al Mercado Municipal de la ciudad, donde tiene un puesto de ventas de las ropas que confecciona y por las tardes regresa a su casa para compartir con su familia y seguir trabajando confeccionando mas prendas en su pequeo taller con su mquina de coser, propia, que con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar. Estelvina desea utilizar el crdito para comprar materiales para la confeccin como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc. y de ese modo aumentar su produccin y ventas. La seora pertenece al Comit Mujeres en Accin del Programa Comit de Mujeres Emprendedoras del a Fundacin Paraguaya y que consta de 16 mujeres que conformar un grupo solidario de trabajo.

loan.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loan.name: Jos

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr. Jose Gonzles was married 47 years until his wife abondoned him and their children two children 2 years ago. He is a humble salesman who stays with his work of sale of clocks, sun and Vista eyeglasses. He has been positioned for the last 12 years on Palm street (one of the commercial streets in the center of the capital which she is the most travelled of the city). He previously obtained a loan from Paraguayan Foundation so he could buy more merchandises to have more variety and this way it could improve its income and improve the standard of life of its family.

Jose tells that in its beginnings, he used to ask for loans from people who received very high interest rates that he had to pay daily , removing his profit and thus he could not progress. Nowadays he is very happy with the loans from a micro finance institution, and wishes to ask for $200 to buy more merchandises for the sale such as sun eyeglasses, clocks, radios, etc.



ORIGINAL SPANISH El seor Jos G. tiene 47 aos su esposa lo abandono y el qued con sus dos hijos hace 2 aos. El es un humilde vendedor que se mantiene con su trabajo de venta de relojes, anteojos de vista y de sol. Tiene su puesto hace 12 aos sobre la calle Palma (una de las calles comerciales en el centro de la capital que es la ms concurrida de la ciudad), gracias al prstamo obtenido con anterioridad de la Fundacin Paraguaya el pudo comprar ms mercaderas para tener ms variedad y de esta manera pudo mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Jos cuenta que en sus inicios, solicito prstamos de personas particulares que cobraban intereses muy elevados y adems tena que pagar en forma diaria, imposibilitando la capitalizacin que le quitaban todas sus ganancias y as no poda progresar. Hoy da est muy contento con los prstamos a microempresarios, y desea solicitar $ 200 para comprar ms mercaderas para la venta tales como anteojos de sol, relojes, radios porttiles, cintos, etc.

loan.use: para comprar ms mercaderas para la venta tales como anteojos de sol, relojes, radios porttiles, cintos, etc.

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Ms. Lourdes C. is 30 years old, lives with her partner Ever Moreira, a traveling salesman, and has two little daughters of 5 and 8 years of age. They live in a small house of their own, which they managed to build with great sacrifice. Fifteen years ago, she started working as a sales person; with great will and a minimal capital, she started selling brushes, handkerchiefs and bijouterie. This was only enough to eat but nonetheless, with her savings, she was able to study and learn the skills of manicure and pedicure, that presently generate income for her as well. Today, she has a stand where she sells all kinds of fruits, like oranges, apples, grapefruit, etc. She wants the $500 loan to expand her business and build a small kiosk, as her clientele has grown and she has many requests. She wishes to give a better future to her children and that they finish school and have access to a good formal job.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lourdes C. tiene 30 aos, vive con su pareja Ever Moreira, quien es vendedor ambulante, y tiene dos pequeas hijas de 5 y 8 aos. Viven en una casita propia que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Hace 15 aos empez a trabajar como vendedora; con muchas ganas y con un capital mnimo, comenz a vender diferentes productos, como cepillos, pauelos y accesorios de bijouterie. Esto le dejaba ingresos con los que solamente daba para comer, pero a pesar de ello con sus ganancias ahorradas, pudo estudiar el oficio de manicura y pedicura que hoy da tambin le genera ingresos. Actualmente tiene una casilla donde vende todo tipo de frutas como naranjas, manzanas, pomelos, etc. Desea el crdito de $500 para ampliar su negocio, construyendo un pequeo kiosco, debido a que su clientela ha crecido y tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella desea poder dar a sus hijas un futuro mejor, que culminen sus estudios y puedan acceder a un buen empleo formal.

loan.use: To build a kiosk for sales.

loan.name: La

texts.en: Mr. La S. is 60 years old and lives with his wife (pictured) and 4 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Mr. La S. currently earns $5 a day profit selling wood. He is requesting this $500 loan so that he can expand his business in order to satisfy consumer demand and increase his profits.

loan.use: To purchase more wood for their stock

payment.comment:
Congratulations! La Sok has paid back this Kiva loan early.
Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S. is 28 years old and the mother of one pre school-aged child who needs to be taken care of. To cover all of the familys expenses, her husband, aged 26 years old, operates a motor-taxi in his area where he generally earns about $8 each day. Her husband would like to drive a Tuk Tuk (a passenger cart attached with a motorbike), which would enable him to make better money than a motor-taxi, yet he faces financial constraint. To do so, he is requesting a loan to help him purchase a passenger cart to run the business. (This is a picture of her husband because Mrs. Meas S. is unavailable)

loan.use: To purchase a passenger cart for her husband to operate a Tuk Tuk.

loan.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun S. is a 38 year old housewife who lives in Phnom Penh. She has two children, one of whom is married and lives with her own family, and the other is a student. She has applied for this loan so that her son-in-law can purchase a motorcycle and operate a motor-taxi service. Receiving this loan would help to increase the income of her daughter's household, and improve their quality of life.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son-in-law to operate a motor-taxi

loan.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Chay is a widow aged 55 years old and lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She doesnt have any children. Since her husband passed away many years ago, Sok Chay has worked very hard to survive. In the morning, she works selling rice and noodles in front of a primary school, where a number of students pass by and in the evening, she starts selling different kind of desserts to the people in her community. Together, she can generally make up to $10 dollar each day. Little by little, her business is getting better to meet growing customer demand. Mrs. Sok Chay is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loan.use: To expand her business.

payment.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sok Chhay start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loan.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan N. is a 60-year-old father of 3 children and lives with his wife (pictured here) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is self-employed as an electrician, earning around $5 each day, while his wife runs a grocery store at home and typically makes about $6 in revenue. This loan will be used to purchase more electrical tools to facilitate his job.

loan.use: To purchase more electrical tools to assist in his job

loan.name: Kak

texts.en: Mrs. Kak T., 27, is married with 3 children - all of whom are students. Her husband, 47, earns $6 a day as a construction foreman. Kak T. has applied for this $300 loan so that she can purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use for transportation to and from work. She feels that this will reduce the transportation costs for the household as her husband will not have to ride motortaxis to and from work.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work

payment.comment: Kak Thy has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loan.name: Voeun

texts.en: Mrs. Voeun S. is 40 years old, married, with 4 children. She works as a market vendor, earning $2 a day from this activity. Her husband (pictured) earns $3 a day breeding domestic animals. Voeun S. would like to use this $300 loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so that he can operate a motortaxi service when he has spare time.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service

loan.name: Adelet

texts.en:
A. Adelet is a 47-year-old farmer who lives in the small village of Varkhankend situated in the southern Azerbaijani region, Saatli. Adelet is married and has four children. He has seven years of experience in animal breeding. At first, he borrowed from his friends and purchased one calf. When it grew up to a milk cow, it brought him good income and he purchased another one.

Currently Adelet has four cows and two buffaloes. These animals bring him good income from selling dairy products such as milk, butter and yoghurt to the local and capital bazaar traders. Adelet and his wife do not work and keeping animals is the only source of revenue in their family. This income is just enough to cover family needs. But he still has no place to keep the cattle. Adelet decided to build himself a shed and for this purpose he saved some money and applied for 1200 USD to purchase building materials.

loan.use: Going to build a place for keeping cattle

loan.name: Afes

texts.en:
Afes Aliyev is a 31-year-old married farmer who has small sheep herd. Afes lives in the southern Azerbaijani region, Saati, in Alisoltanli village. He is an internally displaced person from Nagorniy Karabakh, who fled to Saatli during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He sells mutton to the local and capital traders and he is very successful in his business because meat is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use it in homes and cafes a lot. Afes has eight years experience in this field.

Now Afes has decided to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and fodder. He is going to sell dairy products like milk and yoghurt. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD.

loan.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and fodder

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Mrs. Susan K., 26, lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 6 and her son is in primary school.

Her husband, Mr. Nigam K., returned from Dubai and now he has no work here. Mrs. K. decided to open a grocery shop in her house to overcome the economic problems of her family. She hasn't had enough money to buy goods for her shop, so she seeks a $150 loan to buy some.

She wants to sustain her family with her income.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Bun Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Bun Sok D. is a 48 year old widow, and the mother of three children. One of her children works as a chef and the other two are blacksmiths. Bun Sok D. is not employed, instead she works taking care of her grandchildren at home. She has applied for this $400 loan so that her son-in-law can purchase a motorcycle to use for transportation to work. The money that is left after this purchase will be used to repair her house.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son-in-law to go to work and to repair her house.

loan.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil A. is a 42-year-old farmer who lives in Varkhankend village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Saatli region. He is married and has two children. Kamil breeds cattle and sells beef to the local and capital traders. Selling meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at home and in cafes. Kamil works very hard and spends all his time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing.

Currently Kamil has only one calf, which he has raised and will now sell to the traders and will buy two additional baby calves. Kamil is going to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and start selling dairy products. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD. The rest of money he is going to spend on fodder.

loan.use: Purchase one milk cow and fodder

loan.name: Rashad

texts.en: 47-year-old Rashad lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has two children. Rashad breeds calves. He supports his family with this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow and baling presses. He wants to breed cows in order to get more milk and to improve his business and income. He has run this business for 10 years.

loan.use: To buy a cow and baling presses

loan.name: Milan

texts.en: Mrs. Milan R. lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband, Mr. Durga R.. Her husband searched for work but could not find any. There are no other grocery shops near her house, so she and her husband decided to open a grocery shop at their home, which is on the roadside where people can come and buy the things they need. She seeks a loan of $150 to buy grocery goods like noodles, biscuits, chocolates and cold drinks for her shop. The Rais want to fulfill all the needs of the family with their income.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. is a 57 year old widow who works as a street vendor. Her son earns $2 a day working as a motortaxi driver. She would now like to take out this $600 loan to repair her house. In the future, she would like to become a grocer.

loan.use: To repair her house

loan.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona A. is a 59-year-old married woman who owns a milk products business in the small, southern village of Varkhankend, near Saatli region. She has five children. Sona has twelve years of experience in selling milk products. Dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use yoghurt and milk every day. They think it is very healthy and tasty at the same time.

Sona and her husband work very hard to cover all their family needs. But now the children are growing up and life has become much more difficult. Sona decided to improve her living conditions and purchase one milk cow and one calf for meat production. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD and for a calf is 200-300 USD.

loan.use: Purchase one milk cow and one calf

loan.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Mrs. Ramita M., 26, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and two sons. Her older son is in grade 7 and her younger son is only two years old.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Krishna M., both make traditional idols. They have almost six years of experience in this field. In Nepal, idol making is very popular work and the demand for idols is increasing. So they need money to buy raw materials like brass, silver, wax and gold to make more idols to fulfill the demand. She seeks a $150 loan to buy such materials.

loan.use: To buy raw material for making traditional idols

loan.name: Heang Si

texts.en: Mrs. Hean Si C. is a 37 year old housewife. She has a husband who earns $6 a day as an air-conditioner repairman. Between them they have 4 children, who are all students. She would like to take out this loan so that her husband can go to work more easily, and without spending money on motortaxis.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for husband to go to work

loan.name: Shahmurad

texts.en:
Shahmurad A. is a 52-year-old farmer who lives with his five children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Varkhakend village of the Saatli region. Shahmurad sells dairy products to the local and capital traders and has been doing it since 1996, when he purchased his first milk cow with saved money. Shahmurad and his wife make yoghurt at their home and sell it to the local people. It brings them good income and that is enough to cover family needs.

Currently Shahmurad has two cows, but conditions to keep the cattle are very bad. Shahmurad has applied for 1000 USD to put a new roof on the cattle shed.

loan.use: Create better conditions for keeping cattle

loan.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli is a father of 2 children. He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. This 42-year old man has his own orchard. He started his business 10 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loan.use: Buy pesticides and fertilizer

loan.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov L., 38, is married with 2 children, both of whom are students. Her husband (pictured here) works as a tuk-tuk driver. Mrs. Nov L. earns $21 a day as a street vendor and is taking out this loan so that she can more easily transport her products. Any money that is left over after this purchase will be used to repair her house. In the future she would like to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her products, and to repair her house.

loan.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib B. is a 32-year-old farmer who live with his family, consisting of three children and his wife. Sahib lives in the Azerbaijani southern part of Saatli region. Sahib has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Sahib has four years of experience in selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use yoghurt and milk almost every day. Sahibs orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders and he decided to apply for 900 USD to purchase an additional cow and fodder.

loan.use: Purchase one one milk cow

loan.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Dil Kumari M., 25, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, husband, sister-in-law, brother-in-law, and son. The economic condition of her family is very poor; they can't fulfill their needs.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Gyan Bhakta M., make traditional idols. They have almost seven years of experience in this field. They are selling their idols to the local dealers.

Now she seeks a $375 loan to buy raw materials like wax and brass for their work. Mrs. M. likes to grow her business continuously and uplift the standard of living of her family.

loan.use: To buy raw material for making traditional idols

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase one cow and fodder

loan.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Laxmi Kumari M., 57, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and five sons. Her husband, Mr. Bal Mukunda M., has no work. He is illiterate and unemployed. Her two younger sons are studying in grades 5 and 6. Mrs. M. and all her five sons make traditional idols to order. They have a lot of orders for making the idols, so they need money to buy raw materials like gold, brass, and wax to make more traditional idols to fulfill the demand. She seeks $300 to buy these raw materials.

loan.use: To buy raw material for making idols

loan.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. This 27-year-old man is single. He has sold milk for 4 years. Rafig wants to get more income and therefore he is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy two cows.

loan.use: Purchase two cows

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase one cow and two baby calves

loan.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada B. is a 39-year-old mother of 3 children. She's a self-taught woman. Nada learned embroidery on her own five years ago and started her business one year later. She works from home in a village called Bayssour in Mount Lebanon.

Nada makes crochet sets and does embroidery work. To keep her business running, she currently needs $800 to produce 50 to 75 pieces. When she first started with Al Majmoua, she used to make a profit of $50, and she now employs 5 free-lancers and can make up to $400 profit. The current loan will help her buy fabrics, embroidery accessories, pearls, threads etc.; all that is needed to produce her embroidery and crochet work. "My daughter is now learning the business. I am happy to know she will be able to grow on her own."

Nada is part of a group called "Al Omara" which means the "princes." The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards women economic empowerment

loan.use: Buy the needed material to produce the embroidery and crochet work

loan.name: Tara

texts.en: Mrs. Tara S., 28, lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband and a son. Her husband, Mr. Rabi S., works in a furniture factory and her son is studying in grade 6. She opened her grocery shop 5 years ago. Now she seeks $150 to invest in the grocery shop for a better income. She needs the loan to purchase grocery items such as rice, biscuits, chocolates, mineral water, and other things to meet the demand of her customers.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Subarna

texts.en: Mrs. Subarna S., 33, lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Mohan Krishna S., works in a furniture factory. Her older daughter is studying in grade 7 and her younger daughter is in primary school. Mrs. S. opened her grocery shop a few years ago. Her family income is very low, and it's hard to fulfill their needs. They cannot provide a better education for their children. So Mrs. S. opened her own grocery shop. Now she seeks $150 to buy grocery goods for the improvement of her shop. She wants to invest a little more this year to increase their income so that she can improve their standard of living and send their children to boarding school.

loan.use: To buy grocery goods

loan.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif H. is 22-year-old young businessman who works as barber in his own barber shop. He finished his barber lessons and opened his barber shop in 2004. Asif lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Sabirabad region. He lives with his parents who are retired and Asif`s barbershop is the only source of revenue in their family. Asif works very hard; he begin early in the morning and finishes late at night. His barbershop is only for men and Asif is the one of the best barbers in Sabirabad.
Asif has a lot of clients, but his working place has very bad conditions. It needs to be repaired and Asif applied for $1000 USD to repair his barbershop. He believes that good conditions in his barbershop will help him to attract more clients.

loan.use: Repair and enlarge his barber shop

loan.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak married in 1984 and has 7 children. He started his business as a construction contractor more than 20 years ago. He contracts to build houses and other buildings from village to village. He sometimes stays at the construction site.

Vannak's wife, Sok Rady, sews clothes at home. They both only finished primary school. Therefore, they are sending all their children to school in the local schools and of course they encourage their children to pursue higher education.

Vannak is asking for a first loan of US$ 200 from MAXIMA. With this loan, he will repair his house. We feel confident that Vannak has ability to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loan.use: Repairing house

loan.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn married in 1995 and has 2 children. She learned to weave silk in 1994 from her neighbor and started making silk that same year. Her husband is a construction worker in local communities. In addition, the family also grows rice.

Sokhorn has already borrowed and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300. She will use this loan to buy silk material and sewing thread, and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom so that she can continue to expand her silk production.

loan.use: Purchasing silk material and sewing thread, and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loan.name: Aslan

texts.en: Ten years ago Aslan started his own business. He is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Aslan and his family live in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. This man needs a loan of $475 to purchase pesticides for his orchard.

loan.use: To buy pesticides for his orchard

loan.name: Sam-Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam-oeurn married in 1990 and has two daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor when she was 20 years old. She started her silk production in 1985. Besides producing silk Sam-oeurn also sells grocery items from her home. She and her husband finished primary school in the local schools. After they come home from school, her daughters help to weave silk as well.

Sam-oeurn has already taken out and repaid four loans from MAXIMA. She is now asking for a loan of US$ 400 to use to buy more grocery items, silk material and sewing thread, and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. We feel certain that Sam-oeurn will be able to repay the principal and interest for this loan on time, given her excellent track record as a client of MAXIMA.

loan.use: Purchasing more grocery items, silk material and sewing thread, and paying for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loan.name: Phos

texts.en:
Phos is an orphan with one brother and 2 sisters in her care. Her father died under the Khmer Rouge regime and her mother passed away in 1999 because of a serious illness. Phos and her sister learnt to weave silk from their neighbor 7 years ago. Her younger sister assists her by looking after cows in the village. Her brother is a construction worker and is currently working with her uncle in Phnom Penh.

Phos has already borrowed and repaid one loan from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 500. She plans to use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread. In addition, she is going to set up a loom for her sister. Since Phos repaid her first loan in a timely fashion, we feel sure she will have no problem repaying this second loan.

loan.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread

loan.name: Siem

texts.en:
Siem is a widow with 8 children, 4 sons and 4 daughters. Six of her children are still in her care. One daughter is working in a garment factory and the others are still studying and helping her with farming. Siem never finished primary school, but she is reliable and clever at making her living. When she has free time, she makes and sells cakes to her neighbors.

Siem is asking for her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to repair her pump. Judging by her business activities, Siem should be able to pay back this loan without any problems.

loan.use: Purchasing fertilizer, pesticide, and fixing the pump

payment.comment:
Dear lender,
Mrs. Siem Morm has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract and now she is requesting a nother loan for continue her business.
Thank you.

loan.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun is a widow with 3 daughters She started her business selling grocery items at her house in 2006. One of her daughters assists her in the business. Her other 2 daughters have been working in the garment factory for over 10 years. They are polite and well respected by their neighbors.

Yun would like to borrow $700 from MAXIMA (her first loan) to buy more grocery items so that her neighbors can purchase the food and other things they use daily without spending a lot of time traveling to the market. Yun will not have any problem repaying the loan because they have a good business.

loan.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory

loan.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom married in 2004 and has one daughter. She learned to weave silk in 1997 and started her silk production in the same year. Her husband is a construction worker in local communities.

Sokhom has already borrowed and repaid a loan from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 200. She will use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread and pay for set-up on the new loom. Sokhom has the ability and the commitment to repay this loan in a timely manner, as shown by the way she handled her first loan.

loan.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread and paying for set-up on the new loom.

loan.name: Vanthorn

texts.en:
Vanthorn has been married for 35 years and has 2 children, 1 son and 1 daughter. She started a little grocery store out of her home in 2004. When free from school, her son assists her in selling the groceries. Her husband is a government official.

Vanthorn has borrowed and repaid a loan from MAXIMA already. She will use the loan of US$ 300 she is presently requesting to purchase more grocery items for her inventory. Vanthorn is capable of managing her loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loan.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory

loan.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla H. is 60-year-old farmer who lives in the southern part of the Azerbaijan Saatli region. Seyfulla is married and has four children. He keeps one buffalo and has twelve years of experience in his animal breeding business. He started his business by borrowing money from his friends. Seyfulla used to keep calves for meat production and cows for dairy production. Keeping cattle for long time brought him good income and with this income he purchased land and now he breeds cattle fodder to the local farmers. Seyfulla applied for $900 USD to purchase one milk cow and a baby calf. The estimated cost for the cow is $700 USD and for the baby calf is $200 USD.

loan.use: To purchase one cow and baby calf

loan.name: Sok Kheang

texts.en:
Sok Kheang has been married for more than 20 years, and she has 7 children, 3 daughters and 4 sons. She has been selling cooked rice at her house in the village for more than 10 years. Two of her daughters weave silk at home, an art they learnt from their neighbor. Her husband, Pres Huot, has been in the business of purchasing and reselling cows from one village to another for 15 years.

Sok Kheang has already taken out and repaid 2 loans from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 250. She will use this loan to buy silk materials and sewing thread for the looms of her daughters. In addition, she also plans to use $50 to expand her existing cooked rice business.

loan.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread and selling cooked rice

loan.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif M. is a 28-year-old single man who lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has 5 years of experience in this business. At the beginning of his business he bought a plot of land and started vine-growing. Now Asif needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.

loan.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loan.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn has been married for more than 10 years and has one daughter who is now studying in a local school. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production 13 years ago. She also trained her husband to weave silk 3 years ago. Now, her husband is weaving silk at home as well.

Sokhoeurn has already borrowed and repaid three loans from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loan.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, paying for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loan.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy married in 2005 and has one son. He learned to weave silk from his sister and started his silk production business in 2006. In addition to his regular silk production, he also plants rice during the season. He was unfortunately never able to finish primary school.

Savy has already taken out and repaid three loans from MAXIMA. He is currently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 400. He will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loan.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and paying for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loan.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani I. is 36-year-old trader who sells food in Imishli region, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Khagani is married and has three children. He has nine years of experience in trading. He started selling in 1998. The food market is in high demand in Azerbaijan, especially in summer and autumn when it is very hot and beverages sell at a high speed. Khagani has problems in selling beverages and other products which need keeping in a cool place, so he applied for $1200 USD to purchase one refrigerator. The estimated cost for middle size refrigerator is $1200 USD.

loan.use: To purchase a refrigerator for his food store

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Saveth

texts.en:
Saveth is a widow with two daughters. She started a small grocery store in her home more than 14 years ago. One of her daughters assists her in selling groceries; the other is a nurse at the commune medical center.

Saveth has already borrowed and repaid one loan from MAXIMA. Now she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to expand her business, purchasing more grocery items for her inventory. Saveth is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loan.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory

payment.comment:
Dear lender,
Mrs. Saveth Koeut has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract. Thank you so much.

loan.name: Channak

texts.en:
Channak married in 1998 and has 2 children. He has been in the farming business for a long time. Since 2002, in his free time from his farm, he works as a barber out of his home. His wife is a garment factory worker in Punhea Leu district.

Channak is asking for a loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US$ 250; he has already repaid a prior loan in a timely fashion. He plans to use part of this loan to add to money he has saved up to buy a motorbike for his wife. He intends to use the rest to repair his rice threshing machine. Chanak feels sure he will able to pay back this loan without any problems.

loan.use: to complete the money he has saved up to buy a motorbike for his wife and also to repair his rice-threshing machine

payment.comment:
Deat lenders,
Mr. Channak Morn has enough money to pay off his loan before contract. Thank you so much for lending to Channak.

loan.name: Chork

texts.en:
Chork married in 1992 and has 4 children, one son and 3 daughters. He has been in business driving a remork (motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 2005. He brings workers in the village to the garment factory site in Kandal Steung district. His wife and 2 daughters are garment factory workers in Kandal Steung district.

Chork is asking to borrow $500 from MAXIMA as a first loan, in order to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi. With his remork, he can generate more income to support the family and feels sure he will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loan.use: Purchasing a new carriage for his motor taxi

loan.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin married in 1994 and has 4 children, one son and 3 daughters. She has been in business buying and selling fish since 1990. Her husband has been a construction worker in the local community for more than 6 years. With the business Sarin is in, she has been able to send all of her children to school.

Sarin is asking for a first loan in the amount of $300 from MAXIMA. She plans to use that money to expand her business purchasing and selling fish in the community market. She feels certain she will be able to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loan.use: Purchasing more fish and selling to the community market

payment.comment:
Dear lender,
Mrs. Sarin Mork has enough money to pay off her loan.
Thank you.

loan.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean married in 1964 and has 7 children, 3 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her sister-in-law in 1964 and started producing silk at that time. Two of her daughters who are still living under her roof also weave silk. Her husband farms and raises cows and buffalos.

Yean has already borrowed and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. The current loan amount she is requesting is US$ 1,000. Yean plans to use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and to pay for selecting and preparing thread on the looms for herself and for her daughters looms.

loan.use: Purchasing silk material, sewing thread, and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the family looms

payment.comment: Mrs. Yean Chey has paid off her loan earlier than her contract. Thanks so much for lending this loan to her.

loan.name: Yengibar

texts.en: Yengibar I. is 41-year-old farmer who lives in the southern Saatli region of Azerbaijan. Yengibar is married and has four children and has eight years of experience in animal breeding. Currently, Yengibar has one cow and two calves. The cow brings him income from selling milk and yoghurt and meat production from calves. The beef and dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Keeping these animals is not enough to cover his family's need and buying calves, feeding them, then waiting for them to grow takes time. Yengibar decided to enlarge his business and purchase a sheep herd. Mutton is in very high demand also and will bring him noticeable income and help him to increase his finances. The estimated cost for one sheep is $60-70 USD.

loan.use: To purchase a sheep herd

loan.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn married in 1993 and has 3 children. She has been farming for a long time. However, after getting married she also started selling fruit in order to generate extra income for the family. She began that business in 1995. Her husband farms with her and and also works as a barber out of their home.

Thoeurn has already taken and repaid one loan from MAXIMA. Now she is asking for a second loan in the amount of US$ 300. She plans to use the money to pay to have her rice fields plowed and to purchase seed. Thoeurn feels sure she will be able to pay back the loan without any problems.

loan.use: Pay to have her rice fields plowed and purchase seed

loan.name: Channa

texts.en:
Channa married in 1987 and has 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters. She started up a grocery store in her home in 2000. In addition, she also sells alcoholic beverages in her store. Her husband produces and sells ice-cream. With their businesses, all of their children are able to attend school.

Channa has already borrowed and repaid three loans from MAXIMA. With the current loan in the amount of $400, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more grocery items for her inventory and buying a small freezer. Channa is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loan.use: Purchasing grocery items for her inventory and buying a small freezer

payment.comment:
Dear lender,
Mrs. Channa Ven has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.
Thank you.

loan.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan married in 1985 and has 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters. She started up a business raising pigs in 1990. In addition, she also produces fish-paste using a machine. Her husband is a fisherman.

Yan has already borrowed and repaid two loans from MAXIMA. The current loan she is requesting is in the amount of US$ 700. Yan plans to use this loan to repair her fish-paste maker and to purchase a new fishing boat for her husband. Yan is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loan.use: Repairing her fish-paste machine and purchasing new fishing boat for her husband

loan.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn married in 1990 and has one daughter. She started her fishing business in 1995. Her husband grows rice.

Soeurn has already repaid two loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She plans to use this loan to repair her house. Soeurn is capable of managing the loan and we feel sure she will be able to repay it without any problem.

loan.use: house repairs

loan.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam J. is 33-year-old trader who owns his market where he sells toiletry products and beverages. Islam is internally dislocated person who fled to Saatli during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Saatli region is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan and Islam lives with his wife and two children in a refugee town. Islam started his business in 2004. Toiletry products sells very well and Islam decided to expand his business and open a new food section in his market. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase his first consignment of food.

loan.use: To broaden his store by opening a food section

loan.name: Vidamat

texts.en: Vidamat lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has 3 children. This 36-year-old man has 8 years of experience in vine-growing. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.

loan.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizer

loan.name: Sakit

texts.en: Sakit is 30 years old, married, and has a child. He lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. Sakit has been in this business for 3 years. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow and baling presses for improving his business.

loan.use: To buy a cow and baling presses

loan.name: Fatama

texts.en: Fatama lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has 2 sons. She works with her husband. She and her husband are tailors. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to rent a shop and also purchase all her materials. She wants to make a better future for their children.

loan.use: To purchase materials

loan.name: Zinab

texts.en: Zinab lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is young and talented. She is happy. She lives with her family. She is not married, and she helps her family. She is a tailor, and she learned tailoring from her mother. She started this business because there is no tailoring shop where she lives. She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines so she can work hard and support her family and make a good future for herself.

loan.use: To buy new sewing machines

loan.name: Seadet

texts.en:
Seadet is a 41 year old internally displaced person (IDP) and the mother of three children. She is from the occupied Lachin region of Azerbaijan. She is homeless and staying in a worker's hostel in Sumqayit. Her familys living condition is not good enough as the family income is rather limited. She began her business eight years ago. She started selling a small variety of flowers near the hostel where she lives.
With this small business and only $300 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.
In 2005, Seadet borrowed $400 from Normicro and expanded her business considerably. She rented a flower shop. For her second loan, she borrowed $500 and built a flower store in the market in the city of Sumgayit. Besides roses, she also sells carnations, daisies, jasmines and other sorts of flowers. She currently wants to borrow a $900 loan to start selling fruit near her flower store and to buy digital scales for her son. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repaying the loan.

loan.use: to start selling fruit near her flower store and to buy digital scales

loan.name: Gulam Abas

texts.en: Gulam Abas lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two sons. He is happy. His business has been the only source of income for his family. His sons are in school. He is supporting them. He is a tailor, and he has a small shop. He wants to take a group loan to get a larger shop and expand his business to make a good income for his family.

loan.use: To expand business

loan.name: Masoma

texts.en: Masoma lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, and she is a widow. Her husband died of cancer 5 years ago. She has a son. She is a very enterprising and responsible woman. She has a carpet weaving shop. She learned this business in Pakistan during the war in Kabul. Now she needs money for her business. She wants to take a group loan to purchase all her materials. She would love to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase materials

loan.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, a 25-year-old woman, is married and has a child. She has her own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her orchard.

loan.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loan.name: Shakhanim

texts.en: Shakhanim is 27 years old, married, and has a child. She lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her vine-growing. This young mother of one child has 4 years of experience in this business.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loan.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en: Nazkhanim Mammadov is 55-year-old trader who owns her store where she sells toiletry and makeup products. Nazkhanim is married and has three children. She lives in Imishli region which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. She opened her store in 1996 when she borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. She started to sell different sorts of shampoos and soaps. This brought her good income and she returned the money during her paying back period. Nazkhanim retired and her pension is approximately $27-30 USD. Her store is the first income in her family and she is working very hard. She expanded the products in her store and now she is going to open a food section; for the first time she is going to sell beverages and preserved food. She applied for a loan of $1200 USD.

loan.use: To broaden her store by opening a food section

loan.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh Y. is 23-year-old trader who owns his a food store in the southern Azerbaijani region of Imihsli. Taleh is married and has two children. He has three years of experience in selling food and beverages. The food stores are in high demand in this region and Taleh decided to purchase a refrigerator for food which needs a cooling system, like meat, yoghurt, and milk, etc. Taleh applied for $1200 USD to purchase one refrigerator.

loan.use: To purchase refrigerator to keep food

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loan.name: Amiraslan

texts.en: Amiraslan N. is 27-year-old farmer who keeps a sheep herd and lives with his wife and two children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Amiraslan is an internally displaced person who fled to Saatli from Nagorniy Karabakh during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He has kept a sheep herd since 2001. From the money he saved, he purchased his first five sheep. He sells mutton to the local and capital bazaar traders. Amiraslan does not have a bachelor degree and his family was too poor too allow him finish high school. Amiraslan started to help his father when he was fifteen.
