Currently, selling mutton is the only source of revenue in their family. The mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat meat at home and in the cafes. He applied for $1000 USD to purchase 15-16 sheep for estimated cost of $60-70 USD each.

loan.use: To enlarge his sheep herd

loan.name: Mokhbali

texts.en: Mokhbali Q. is 47-year-old farmer who lives in the small village Otuziki, in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Imishli. Mokhbali lives with his wife and three children. Mokhbala has nine years of experience in animal breeding and he has one milk cow and sells milk and yoghurt to the local and capital traders. There is a big competition in dairy products selling and he is working very hard to cover his family needs. Mokhbala is going to purchase an additional cow and a calf. He purchased his current milk cow two years ago when he borrowed $800 USD from Aqroinvest CU. He successfully paid back his loan and now he is applying for $1000 USD for a second loan. The estimated cost for the cow is $700-800 USD and $200-300 USD for the calf.

loan.use: To purchase one milk cow and one calf

loan.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad Q. is 35-year-old farmer who owns a sheep herd and lives with his three children and wife in small Otuziki village in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Saatli region. Elshad has seven years of experience in sheep breeding and mutton selling to the local and capital traders. Elhsad`s business going very well because mutton is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at home and cafes. Elshad decided to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and seven sheep. The estimated cost for cow is $700-800 USD and for one sheep is $60-70 USD.

loan.use: To enlarge his sheep herd and purchase one milk cow

loan.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin has been an internally displaced person since 1993. He is married and has four children. He opened his business in 1993. He has already received three loans, for $400, $500 and $600 to open and eventually expand his shop. Currently, he wants to borrow $800 to further expand his business in order to improve the livelihood of his family.

loan.use: to buy more inventory

loan.name: Elgiz

texts.en: Elgis is from Imishly region of Azerbaijan. He was born in 1979. He moved to Baku and started a small business on his own. He rents a booth in an underground passage and sells men's shoes. He buys his inventory at Airport market, which is famous for selling shoes wholesale. The business is running well but Elgiz wants to expand it to include shoes for the winter season and increase variety. For this purpose, he applied to Normicro (Baku branch) for a loan of $1200.

loan.use: To increase the variety of shoes in his store

loan.name: Fakhriya

texts.en: Fakhriya is an internally displaced person (IDP) as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan conflict. Originally from the Fizuli region, she now lives in a hostel with her husband and one child. She rents a shop in the market and sells various household items but mainly kitchen equipment. She started this business seven years ago with her husband. Before that, they were engaged in different types of small trade. Her current business in developing and she wants to invest more in her business. She hopes to attract more clients by selling more items. She applied to Normicro (Baku branch) for a loan of $500 as she has little funds of her own.

loan.use: To increase the amount of inventory

loan.name: Cesar Francisco

texts.en:
I have a small grocery stand that I run from my home and I would like to buy more merchandise. I had to close for several days because of health reasons and I have a shortage of many items, but I also lack the money to invest in more merchandise. I am requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase inventory for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo un negocio de abarrotes en mi vivienda y me gustarla comprar ms mercanca ya que por varios das tuve que cerrar por razones de salud, en realidad me faltan muchas cosas pero me falta dinero para la inversin Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para comprar mercanca para mi negocio.

loan.use: To invest in merchandise

loan.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a single mother to a 7 year old son and a 6 year old daughter. They are the reason she started her own business selling shoes three years ago. She has no one to rely on or help her with her children, so she has to work very hard everyday to get ahead. Fortunately, her knack for sales and her desire to provide for her family have helped her increase the number of customers and expand her business, as this is her only source of income.

She currently needs a loan in the amount of $475, to be repaid over a six month period, to fill current orders and to buy shoes for the new season. This will allow her to provide better service and continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es madre soltera de un pequeo de 7 aos de edad y una nia de 6 aos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual hace tres aos inici su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos, no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos por lo que tiene que esforzarse mucho da con da. Afortunadamente su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia la han ayudado a incrementar su nmero de clientes y hacer creer su negocio, ste representa la nica fuente de ingresos para su familia.

En estos momentos Elena necesita un prstamo de $ 475 dlares que le permitirn surtir los pedidos que tiene y adquirir calzado de la nueva temporada para ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos est el bienestar de esta familia, decdete a apoyar a Elena, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, is separated from her husband and has a 13-year old daughter. To provide for her daughter and give her a good education, Maria started a business selling products for the home three years ago. She already holds a full time job, but her salary isn't enough to cover household expenses, so she started this business to supplement her income. She has been able to obtain more customers and increase her sales because she sells high quality products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $475 to buy additional merchandise and continue to provide her customers with good service. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your assistance and support will help her expand her business and provide a better life for her family, for which Maria thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 43 aos de edad, est separada de su esposo y tiene una hija de 13 aos. Para sacar adelante a su hija y ofrecerle una buena educacin Maria comenz a vender productos para el hogar desde hace tres aos, aunque ella tiene un empleo, su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar e inici este negocio para tener un ingreso extra, la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su nmero de cliente y sus ventas rpidamente.

Para comprar mercanca y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio Maria esta solicitando un prstamo de $ 475 dlares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria podr continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que te agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Nadia Maribel

texts.en:
Nadia is a young mother of two - a 2-year old boy and a 1-year old girl. After her daughter's birth, Nadia needed to increase her income and at the same time, have enough time for her children, so she decided to start her own business selling used clothing. She sells her clothing in makets and makes a living this way. Fortunately, there is great demand for her goods and because she provides great service, her business has grown well.

Nadia needs a loan of $475 to buy additional merchandise for the coming season. She will repay this amount over a period of 6 months. Nadia and her family thank you for your assistance and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Nadia es una joven madre de dos pequeos, un nio de 2 aos y una linda nia de 1 ao de edad. Desde que naci su hijo Nadia necesitaba tener un mayor ingreso y el tiempo disponible para su pequeo por lo que decidi comenzar su propio negocio con la venta e ropa usada, ella se instala en los mercados rodante y es de esta manera como puede obtener los recursos que necesita para su familia, afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece y la alta demanda por estos productos le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora Nadia est solicitando un crdito de $ 475 dlares que destinar a la compra de mercanca, para tener surtido de esta nueva temporada y poder incrementar sus ventas, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. T puedes ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: To purchase merchandise

loan.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is originally from Guadalupe in Nuevo Leon, Mexico. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a trash collection company and earns very low wages. When Maria Teresa would bring lunch to her husband at work, his co-workers started asking to buy food from her as well. Because her food is very good, she soon had many paying customers. This is how she started her business four years ago.

Maria Teresa wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $925 which she will use to buy a larger comal - a cast iron grill used to make tortillas and char chiles - to increase her food production, and also tables and chairs to offer better service to her customers. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your help will go a long way toward helping this family. Maria Teresa and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Teresa es originaria de la localidad de Guadalupe en el estado de Nuevo Len, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de recoleccin de basura y su salario es muy bajo, cuando Maria le llevaba de comer a su esposo en la empresa, los compaeros de trabajo comenzaron a hacerle pedidos y gracias al buen sabor de sus comidas pronto sus clientes se incrementaron, as fue como inici su negocio hace cuatro aos.

Ahora Maria quiere continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un prstamo de $ 925 dlares que emplear en la compra de un comal ms grande que le permita incrementar su produccin, as como en la compra de mesas y sillas para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. T puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio, Maria y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: To purchase a table, chairs and a cast iron grill

loan.name: Cristian David

texts.en:
Cristian is a 20-year old young entrepreneur. He married a year ago and started his own business selling ice cream and snacks to cover living expenses. He used to work for a similar company and has used that experience, along with his good service and high quality products, to quickly expand his business. His desire to provide for his family motivates him to work hard each day.

He is requesting a loan of $200, to be repaid over 4 months, to buy additional merchandise for his business. Your support will be instrumental in helping Cristian's business expand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristian tiene 20 aos, es un joven emprendedor, hace un ao se cas y para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar inici su propio negocio con la venta de helados y snack, anteriormente laboraba en una empresa similar y ah adquiri la experiencia que le ha permitido crecer rpidamente, ofreciendo un muy buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad. El deseo de contar con un patrimonio para sus futuros hijos, lo motiva a esforzarse ms cada da.

Para surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Cristian est solicitando un prstamo de $ 200 dlares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. T puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, decdete y apoya a Cristian.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Juan Jos

texts.en:
Juan Jose is married and has three children - 7 and 14 year old girls and a 5 year old boy. They are originally from Linares, In Nuevo Leon, Mexico. Juan didn't get an opportunity to finish school; he attended elementary school and then went to work as an apprentice bricklayer while still a young boy. With his experience and high quality work, he has been able to make progress as a small business owner and was able to buy better tools. He also started renting scaffolding and lately has begun selling furniture.

His desire to provide for his family and his wish that his children finish school motivate him to work hard each day. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,100 to buy wood and furniture to supply his business. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Juan Jose and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Jos est casado y tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres de 7 y 14 aos de edad y un pequeo de 5, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Linares en Nuevo Len. Juan no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, solo termin su educacin primaria y comenz a trabajar como ayudante de albail desde muy pequeo. Con la experiencia que tiene ahora realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad, gracias a su esfuerzo logr progresar como microempresario y empez a adquirir herramienta ms especializada, tambin renta madera, andamios, y ltimamente comenz a vender muebles para el hogar.

El deseo de salir adelante con su familia y que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios lo impulsan a mejorar cada da, ahora est solicitando un prstamo de $ 1,100 dlares que emplear en la compra de madera y muebles para darle impulso a su negocio, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos est el bienestar de esta familia, decdete a ayudarlos, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: To purchase tools and merchandise

loan.name: Guadalupe Argelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe started her business four years ago. She is married and has two children. One of them is 13 and the other one 20 years old. They both go to school. Her husband is a bus chofer. However, his salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses. Therefore, Guadalupe, being an entrepreneurial woman, started selling candy, soda and appetizers from her home. The sales soon started to increase and, per her clients' request, she started selling other products.

Guadalupe wishes to continue growing. Therefore, she requests a $250.00 dollar loan which she commits to return in 5 months. She hopes to better supply her business and cover her clients' needs. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands. They need and thank all the trust and support you put into their business.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman. Kiva Volunteer.

Hace cuatro aos Guadalupe inici su propio negocio, elL. es casada y tiene dos hijos, D. 13 y 20 aos D. edad, ambos estudian y su esposo es chofer D. autobuses, pero con su salario no pueden cubrir todos los gastos D. su familia, por lo que Guadalupe siendo una mujer emprendedora empez a vender dulces, refrescos y botanas en su casa, pronto fue incrementando sus ventas y a peticin D. sus clientes fue incorporando L. venta D. abarrotes.

Guadalupe desea continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un prstamo D. $ 250 dlares que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses, con lo que espera surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes. En tus manos esta el bienestar D. esta familia, ellos necesitan y agradecen mucho L. confianza y apoyo que depositas en su negocio.

loan.use: Purchase merchandise

loan.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six oclock in the morning to five oclock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loan.use: Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving

loan.name: Mara

texts.en:
Maria is married and has 4 children. She is a member of the Divino Amparo association of Pro Mujer. Her main line of business is selling cosmetics and costume jewelry in the main markets of the city of El Alto. She started out as an artisan, weaving woolen items, but this activity was not very profitable. She currently has six stalls which she opens only on market days.

She needs this loan to buy a selection of perfumes to add to her merchandise mix, as this is a very profitable line of business which will allow her to quickly increase her income and will result in better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara M. de Arazaca Casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociacin Divino Amparo de Pro Mujer. Se dedica principalmente a la venta de cosmticos y bisutera en las principales ferias de la ciudad del Alto. Comenz en Pro Mujer como artesana, tejiendo prendas en lana, pero esta era una actividad muy sacrificada que adems no era redituable. En la actualidad Mara es duea de 6 puestos de venta los cuales abre solo en das de feria. Ella precisa de capital para poder incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de perfumes, actividad mucho mas redituable y que permitir mejorar sus ingresos de forma mas rpida y ayudarla a mejorar sus condiciones de vida

loan.use: To purchase perfumes for resale

loan.name: Ilsem

texts.es:
Ilsem D. Conde has a one year old child. She sells cosmetics at the Lanza's Market in the city of La Paz.Two years ago, for different reasons, mainly economical, she had no choice but to rent her selling spot to her aunt - who currently collaborates with her nephews.

Ilsem needs money to be able to own her own business and start selling cosmetics with more will and power - since his son has more and more needs to be satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilsem D. Conde Madre de 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de cosmticos en el Mercado Lanza de la ciudad de La Paz. Por diferentes motivos, principalmente econmicas se vio obligada a dar en alquiler el puesto de venta a su ta, la cual hace dos aos administra y colabora a sus sobrinos.. Ilsem precisa de dinero para poder tener su negocio y emprender con mas fuerza la venta de cosmticos, en vista de que su hijo cada vez tiene ms necesidades que deben ser satisfechas.

loan.use: purchase cosmetics

loan.name: Mara

texts.en:
Maria is married and has two children. She is a member of the Divino Amparo association of Pro Mujer. Her line of business is the sale of food items wholesale, mainly to small business owners in the area. Her sales are on credit, meaning that she delivers the merchandise and collects payment after a pre-determined time period. After getting payment, she then begins a new sales cycle. She considers herself a wholesaler. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to buy a small lot where she hopes to build a modest home.

Maria needs this loan to buy additional merchandise; she has proved that her business is not only viable but also profitable and will allow her to one day realize her dream of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mara L. Chipana pertenece a la asociacin Divino Amparo de Pro Mujer, casada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de vveres al por mayor, principalmente a comerciantes de la ceja del alto, su sistema de venta es el crdito, es decir deja sus productos por un determinado tiempo y luego cobra para nuevamente iniciar un nuevo ciclo de venta. Se considera mayorista y gracias a su esforzado trabajo consigui la compra de un pequeo terreno donde piensa iniciar la construccin de su casa.

Mara necesita de ms capital para poder incrementar su mercadera, y ha quedado demostrando que su negocio es prospero. As lograr el sueo de iniciar las obras de construccin de su casa.

loan.use: To buy merchandise

loan.name: Tauese

texts.en: Tauese P. is the mother of seven kids. Most of her children are in school. Her husband is unemployed, and she is the only breadwinner in the family. She is a good tailor and , and wants to purchase another sewing machine. She has been involved in the South Pacific Business Programme for unemployed women for some time now and used her first loan of $750.00 to purchase a sewing machine. She is now on her 6th loan of $3000ST which was used for home improvements and to help purchase equipment and agricultural chemicals for her husbands plantation, which also helps her in her loan repayments. She is very thankful and proud of her involvement in the program.

loan.use: Business expansion & home improvement

loan.name: Luca

texts.en:
Lucia holds the office of association secretary with Pro Mujer. She has been with this organization for 10 years. She is the owner of a small grocery store where she also sells accessories, such as purses and backpacks, which she makes herself. She has had this business for 5 years. Initially she made these items in small quantities, but even after investing in more materials and supplies, her sales still didn't generate enough income.

Lucia is requesting this loan to allow her to continue expanding her business and add a book shop at the same location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia P. Quispe Ella es secretaria de actas de la asociacin Escuelitas 2 de Pro Mujer, adems cuenta una antigedad de 10 aos en la organizacin. A la fecha es duea de una tienda de vveres, donde tambin vende accesorios de vestir, como ser carteras mochilas y otros que ella misma confecciona, ambas actividades las desarrolla hace mas de 5 aos. En principio Lucia confeccionaba en poca cantidad, lo que la llev a invertir en material e insumos, pero an esto no generaba los ingresos suficientes. En la actualidad Lucia ya es duea de un almacn y precisa de mayor capital para poder ampliar su negocio y lograr la apertura de una librera.

loan.use: For business expansion

loan.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra C., married and mother of three children, has been a member of the association Kantutitas of Pro Mujer for 12 years. She lives in Anticrtico in the city of El Alto and is devoted to the organization of games with cumulative money prizes (called Pasanaco); at the same time, she gives out loans at low interest rates. Unfortunately, her husbands salary as a public employee is not enough to make a living for the family, so she needs capital to continue her activities, which generate sufficient income for sustenance and to satisfy her childrens requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra C., casada y madre de tres hijos, es miembro de la asociacin Kantutitas de Pro Mujer, con una antigedad de 12 aos. Vive en Anticrtico en la ciudad de El Alto y se dedica principalmente a la organizacin de juegos, con pozos de dinero acumulable (Pasanaco); al mismo tiempo se dedica a los prstamos de dinero a bajos intereses. Lastimosamente, el sueldo de empleado pblico que percibe su esposo no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, por lo que ella precisa de capital para continuar en su actividad, que le genera los ingresos necesarios para subsistir y satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.

loan.use: She needs capital to continue her activities, which generate sufficient income to survive and satisfy her childrens requirements.

loan.name: Asiasiga

texts.en: Asiasiga is 42 years of age and has 8 children. She is known for being an excellent tailor and makes all the uniforms for the school and the village church choirs uniforms. She started her business with a loan of $750ST and is now on her 4th loan of $1250ST. The loans have been used to expand her business, to purchase a new sewing machine and to help pay her kids' school fees. She is very happy to continue on this program and is looking forward to receiving another loan so that she can improve her house.

loan.use: Business expansion and education

loan.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladys is 26 years old and was married just 6 months ago. She has been a member of Pro Mujer in the city of El Alto for several years. She started out with a small loan of about $100, which allowed her to buy small quantities of goods to stock her small grocery stand. Over the years she was able to secure larger loans, which have allowed her to get to the point today where she is able to open a well-stocked grocery store in a commercial space.

Today Gladys lives with her brand new husband in a small apartment in the Cosmos 79 area. Her plan is to find a store to rent in a commercial area of El Alto that will guarantee a higher income for the couple.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys M. de Torrez , tiene 26 aos y esta casada hace 6 meses, pertenece a la asociacin Roco de la Maana de Pro Mujer del Centro Focal de Villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto. En sus inicios como socia, Gladys consigui un pequeo crdito de aproximadamente 100 $us, con lo que inicio su negocio, comprando vveres por unidades y tratando de abastecer su tienda. Con el paso de los aos y continuando en los ciclos de la organizacin, ella logra acceder a crditos algo ms grandes con lo que por fin consolida la apertura de un almacn bien surtido.

Actualmente Gladys vive junto a su flamante esposo, en un pequeo departamento en la Zona de Cosmos 79, y su intencin es conseguir una tienda en Anticrtico por la ceja de El Alto, zona netamente comercial y que garantiza un mayor ingreso para ella y su pareja.

loan.use: To open a grocery store

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Married and mother of five children, Bertha C. de Layme is the owner of a grocery store located in her home, in the region of Cosmos 79 of El Alto city. She belongs to the association Roco de la Maana of Pro Mujer, being one of the newest members, with only two years in the organization. She has been devoted to this business for four years and started it thanks to the collaboration of her son, who works as a public transportation driver. Her husbands salary as a policeman and public service person is not enough. Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Casada y madre de cinco hijos, Bertha C. de Layme es duea de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio, en la zona de Cosmos 79 en la ciudad de El Alto. Pertenece a la asociacin Roco de la Maana de Pro Mujer, siendo una de las socias ms nuevas, con tan solo dos aos de permanencia en la organizacin. Hace 4 aos ella se dedica a esta actividad, que logr establecer gracias a la colaboracin de su hijo, quien trabaja como chofer de transporte pblico. El sueldo del esposo no es suficiente, por tratarse de un polica y servidor pblico. Bertha precisa de capital para poder ampliar su tienda con el fin de abrir una librera y una central de fotocopias, porque a la fecha el almacn solo le alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades bsicas, pero no as para incursionar en otro negocio.

loan.use: Bertha needs the capital to enlarge her store and incorporate a bookstore and a photocopy center, since the grocery store is only enough to cover her basic needs but not to venture into another business.

loan.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina C. Condori is a divorced mother of three who belongs to the February 2nd Association of Villa Adela where she serves as Treasurer. The association has been around for 10 years and is one of the precursors.

Her main activity is the sale of fast food, such as hamburgers and salchipapas (a combination of hotdogs and french-fries) among other items. She sells these items at her kiosk which she obtained thanks to credit from ProMujer. Before this she worked as a cook in a restaurant where she was paid very little and was unable to care for her children and her family because of the time she had to invest in her job.

Marina requires money so that she may be able to buy some land and, in addition to building a house, create an environment within which she can open her own restaurant. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life for all of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina C. Condori, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos, pertenece a la Asociacin 2 de Febrero de Villa Adela, donde cumple funciones de Tesorera de dicha asociacin. tiene una antigedad de diez aos, y es una de las precursoras.

Su principal actividad es la venta de comida rpida, como ser hamburguesas, salchipapas y otros. en la actualidad cuenta con un Kiosco de venta propio, que logr adquirir gracias a los crditos de Pro Mujer, ya que antes de esta actividad, ella trabajaba como cocinera en una pensin (restaurante), donde le pagaban muy poco y por el tiempo invertido descuidaba la atencin de sus hijos y su familia.

Marina precisa de capital para poder comprar un terreno y construir adems de su vivienda un ambiente que le permita abrir su propia pensin, de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus seres queridos.

loan.use: Marina requires money so that she may be able to buy some land and, in addition to building a house, create an environment within which she can open her own restaurant. In this way she will be able to improve the quality of life for all of her loved ones.

loan.name: Tiupi

texts.en: Mrs B. is married with 8 children. She is a good cooker and that is why she chose the BBQ, which is easy, as her starting business, to used her 1st loan of $750ST.Shes happy that she can get financial help to run the business and also assist her with raising her 8 kids. And she believed that she would stay longer in the program, thats because she need some help for her childrens school fees. She is looking forward to get another loan to build a special place to sell the barbeque foods and maintain the quality of her business.

loan.use: Business

loan.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi is one of the young ladies that join SPBD last year. Her business is making handicrafts such as earrings for the ladies, bracelets, hair accessories and picture frames already designed with different styles. Foketi sells her products at the flea market at Fugalei, which is preferable because more income can be earned here than anywhere else. She started last year with a loan of $750 and now she is on her second loan of $1250. She sells her products throughout the week opening seven days from six oclock in the morning to five oclock in the evening earning $800 a day. After deducting all her expenses, she earns about four hundred to five hundred profit a day and about two thousand to two thousand and eighty tala a week. She is looking forward to supply more in the following week of the South Pacific Games.

loan.use: Buy frames, paints, materials, x-saw and kofi for the carving

loan.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery Mamani Torrez, is a member of the Roco de la Maana Association from Villa Adela, in the city of El Alto and she works as a Secretary of Acts for this association. Married and mother of two children, Mery dedicates her work to manufacturing and selling childrens clothing, dresses and jackets, products that she will start to sell early in the morning in different fairs. With the purpose of earning more profits, Mery travels regularly to Desaguadero, a location where she has a set clientele that buys her products. Her tailoring and clothing workshop has been operating for the last five years and was inherited from her family, from whom she learned her profession. Currently, she owns a thriving workshop that she administers along with her husband and they have all the machinery necessary for this activity. Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer

Mery Mamani Torrez, pertenece a la Asociacin Roco de la Maana de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto, cumpliendo funciones de Secretaria de Actas de dicha asociacin. Casada, y madre de dos hijos, Mery se dedica a la confeccin y venta de ropa para nios, vestidos y chamarras, los que comercializa muy temprano en la maana en diferentes ferias. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, Mery viaja constantemente a la localidad de Desaguadero, donde ya cuenta con clientela fija que compra sus productos. Su taller de costura y confeccin funciona hace 5 aos, fue heredado de su familia, de quienes aprendi el oficio. En la actualidad cuenta con un prospero taller que administra al lado de su esposo, y cuentan con maquinaria necesaria para esta actividad. Mery precisa de capital para poder incursionar en la costura y confeccin de jeans, producto que genera muchas ms ganancias, pero que al mismo tiempo requiere de una fuerte inversin.

loan.use: Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

loan.name: Maeva

texts.en: Maeva G. is one of the new ladies joining the programme. This is her second loan of $1250 and this is a very busy time for Maeva especially the South Pacific Games on the way here in Samoa. Instead of opening her shop in front of her own house, Maeva rents one of the stores at Fugalei Market which is more profitable because it offers more customers than in the village. She opens six days of the week from six in the morning to five oclock in the evening. Maevas husband is in New Zealand and he sends about five hundred fortnightly to Maeva for the shop. They have no children and Maeva is focusing on improving her business so that she can get more in the weeks of the South Pacific Games.

loan.use: Buy two boxes of mutton flaps, chicken legs, mosquito coils, cartoon of cigarettes, and other stuff for the shop.

loan.name: Karanga

texts.en: Karanga S. is a meat and smoked cow skin salesman at the market of Port-Bout, in the south of the Abidjan District. He is 30 years old and is married. Karanga has 2 children with his housewife Adjaratou. He has been doing this business since 1997. He joined AE&I microcredit program in February 2005. Karanga will use the loan to purchase a cow, increase his business volume, and improve his margin. Karanga's 6-year-old daughter (the oldest) will start primary school in September 2007. This will increase the family's living expenses. Karanga wants to better develop his micro-business in order to meet the financial responsibilities of his house.

loan.use: Karanga Seni will use the loan to purchase a cow.

loan.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Adj Ernestine is single mother and has 6 years of work experience in selling spices. She is living with 2 of her 3 brothers and has to take care of them. Thanks to God the last one is mechanic and can get alone. Every new academic year, she has to face education charges. Her father retired and went to live with their mother in the village, where they think life is easier than in the Abidjan district. She needs to increase her micro business revenues to triumph over all that duties and life expenses. Ernestine joined AE&I microcredit program on March 2006 when she heard about the program from her sister. She is a good performer.

loan.use: Adj Ernestine will use the loan to purchase palm oil in bulk

loan.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is one of the owners of the Fugalei Flea Market. She sells earrings, bracelets, Samoan necklaces, ladies handbags and picture frames for family pictures. She is a hard working lady of thirty-eight years. Her first loan is nearly paid off and she is now looking forward to getting another loan to further improve her business. She opens six days a week, and her sales vary from $1000-$1500 a week. The net profit after all her expenses is betwen $500-$800 a week. She wants to take advantage of extra revenue that she can genearate from tourists visitng the SPG Games in Samoa.

loan.use: To buy hooks, chains, paints, afa and timber for frames

loan.name: Naite

texts.en: Naite is a mother of six children. Her husband and herself are never careless in taking care of their school fees and fares. So being a responsible mother, Naite does not rely on others for that. She is always in attendance whenever there is a seminar being held outside the village and there she gains knowledge and skill to operate a business. She sells her products at the Flea Market at Savalalo and she opens six days a week. Her sales amounts up to $1600 and earns a profit of $800 a week. She is looking forward to expand her business in producing more of the goods that earns her more profit.

loan.use: : Buy hooks, paints, chains, materials for designing hand bags, and niddles for sewing Samoan caps for protection from the sun.

loan.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa is a mother of 30 years, with three children. Two of them are girls and one boy. She provides support for her husband who works very hard at their plantation. Elenoa is responsible in selling 2-3 bags of taro twice a week at the New Market and earns $200.00-$300.00.

loan.use: To buy chemicals fertilizers, knives

loan.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Leaving school at a young age did not discourage her to operate a business. She hails from the village of Falelatai, married with three kids. Faapaia operates a Flea Market business selling handicrafts. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She earns $150.00-$200.00 per day

loan.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loan.name: Fiapule

texts.en: Fiapule is a strong woman and the mother of three children. She and her family live in Siumu B centre. She is a former employee of a privately owned pharmacy in Apia but had to resign as she had nobody to look after her children while she worked. She now works from home and helps her husband with their plantation to earn extra money to cover their everyday expenses and to help out with the kids school activities. Selling taro from the plantation earns her more money than she earned working full time. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro once a week to the market and now gets between $250.00 - $300.00 per trip.

loan.use: To buy more chemicals, tools and fertilizers

loan.name: Luatasi

texts.en: Luatasi is a married mother of three children. Her husband has a job but she doesnt want to continue to rely on his wages because it hardly covers all of their daily needs. Therefore she decided to try out her hand in operating a flea market business to help bring in more money for the family. Now daily, she earns more than $250.00 from sales and has smartly saved most of her profits earned to fall on when in need.

loan.use: To buy more stuff for her business

loan.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu runs a flea market business selling handicrafts which most of them are woven by her. She is married with 4 kids and hails from the village of Taufusi. She also buy other handicrafts from women in the rural area because it gives her stall more variety for customers to select from. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She spends most of her time at her flea market because she believes that selling handicrafts helps her family very much.

loan.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loan.name: Makalita

texts.en: Makalita is married to a farmer from the village of Siumu, quite far from town. He is unemployed and she was looking around for ways to earn money to support her children toher than depending on her husbands farming skills to bring in food for the family. When she got word about SPBD Program and how it has managed to help women that were in the same situation, she decided to give it a try. She got a loan out of the program and invested it into their plantation giving her husband encouragement to work harder while she sells their products at the market. She delivers 2-3 bags of taro to the market once a week and she gets $250.00-$300.00. This money is being used to support her family witheir daily needs and her taro plantaion.

loan.use: To buy more chemicals, knives fertilizers

loan.name: Mulimai

texts.en: Mulimai is a married and has two children. She lives in the village of Siuniu and earns money from working her husband's plantation. She joined the loan program in 2005 when she needed help to set up her plantation. She is now into paying off her third loan of $1750.00. She sells 3-4 bags of taro at Fugalei Market twice a month which earns her between $600.00 and $800.00 per month .

loan.use: To purchase chemicals & tools and equipment to upgrade her plantation

loan.name: Toaiva

texts.en: Toaiva Faaulufalega has three children. She is married to a Siumu farmer and helps him with their taro plantation to bring in money for the family. She also gets support from her brothers. She is now trying her best to pay off her second loan of $1250.000 and to apply for another loan of $1750.00 to purchase more chemicals, tools and fertilizers, so that she does not have to continue to rely heavily on her her family's earnings.

loan.use: To buy more chemicals, tools and fertilizers

loan.name: Tootoo

texts.en: I love being a business woman. It is not only a privelage but a blessing as well. Tootoo is not only a mother with six children but also a vegetable farmer. Her husband is a farmer from the village of Siumu and supports her a lot in her Vegetable Garden. She sells her vegetables just in front of her house and delivers to the market to be sold twice a week. She earns $250.00-$300.00 and uses this money to support her family and to pay her children's school fees.

loan.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds and gardening tools

loan.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
At 43 years of age, Mrs. Hanu A. is the fourth wife of her husband. Seven children among the 21 her husband has in total are hers. Each wife takes care of the daily needs and education of her own children. The husband, feeling crushed by the burden of his huge family's needs, has been driven to escape his responsibilities for them.

Hanu's primary financial source of revenue is agriculture, more precisely growing sugar cane--a very difficult job because of the manual labor involved in its cultivation.

In view of the importance of this source of income for Hanu, she would like to enlarge her fields and increase her production. To that end, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 in order to hire some help and procure agricultural inputs (fertilizer, etc.) This will allow her to increase her revenue and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 43 ans, Madame A. Hanu est la 4me femme de son mari. Elle a sept (7) enfants sur les 21 de son mari. Chaque femme soccupe des besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et de leur ducation. Lhomme cras par le poids des charges de sa famille est oblig de fuir ses responsabilits.

Madame A. Hanu a comme principale source de revenu lagriculture et particulirement la culture de la canne sucre. Un travail trs difficile cause de son caractre manuel.

Vu limportance du revenu que cette activit lui procure, elle dsire agrandir le champ et amliorer son rendement. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crdit de $800 afin de sattacher le service des mtayers et des intrants agricoles. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue dune bonne amlioration de conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: increasing production of sugar cane so as to improve her family's living conditions

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
One of the main sources of revenue for Mrs. Yawa A. has been the sale of gari (manioc flour). At 45 years of age, Yawa is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for caring for the six children of her co-spouse (another of her husbands wives) who is deceased.

In view of this unusually difficult situation, none of the children has really been enrolled in school. The girls have been married off young and the boys are in apprenticeships. Even managing to supply daily meals is difficult for Yawa, who has at present no way to purchase manioc to transform into gari, and thus no income.

In order to try to remedy this dire situation, Yawa is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will allow her to plant a field of manioc. Part of this fields yield will be sold and the other part turned into gari, a staple of the Togolese diet. Yawa has the advantage of having a good deal of experience in her chosen work, which should prove a trump card in assuring the success of her endeavor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Lune des principales sources de revenu de Madame A. Yawa est la vente du gari, (farine base du manioc). Age de 45 ans elle marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. Outre ses propres enfants, elle prend en charge les six (6) enfants de sa copouse dcde.

Face cette situation, aucun des enfants na rellement t scolaris. Les filles prcocement maries et les garons sont en apprentissage. Le repas quotidien est assur difficilement. Elle na plus de moyen pour sacheter du manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente de gari.

Face cette situation, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un crdit de $800 pour faire un champ de manioc. Une partie de ce champ sera destin la vente et lautre partie la fabrication du gari. Lexprience dont dispose Madame A. est un atout pour le succs de cette activit.

loan.use: plant a field of manioc to use to make manioc flour to sell

loan.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lu Th Chin lives in the village of Hng o, district Hng Nguyn. A retiree 10 years ago but she did not just stay home and collect pension from the government. All her five children are grown up and they would like very much help their parents financially but Mrs Chin does not want to depend on her children. This is why she had contracted a loan from "Qu Tnh thng" organization 10 years ago. With an small initial loan of only 50 USD, she invested in a small store selling basic goods. Her inventory includes cooking oil, sugar, instant noodle cups ...etc. This not only generates income for her but also provides her a sense of personal satisfaction knowing that she can take care of her self. With the full support from her husband, also a retiree, Mrs Chin requests a loan of 200 USD to buy more stock for her store which will in term increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Sau khi v hu, ch Lu Th Chin, x Hng o, huyn Hng Nguyn khng chp nhn vic ch ngi nhn nhng ng lng hu ca nh nc. Mc d cc con ch, gm 4 gi v mt trai u trng thnh v lun mong mun c gip cha m nhng ch khng mun ph thuc vo con ci. l l do v sao ch tham gia Qu Tnh thng t 10 nm trc. Vi s vn c vay ban u l 50 USD, ch u t vo ca hng tp ha. Ca hng nh bao gm nhng mn hng nh cn ng, chai du n, gi m chnh va to ra mt khon thu nhp va lm ch cm thy vui khi thy mnh vn cn sc lm vic. Vi s h tr, ng vin ca chng cng l mt cn b ngh hu, ch ang xin vay thm 200 USD mua thm hng, tng thu nhp cho gia nh.

loan.use: buy goods for her grocery store

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 55 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter at Hung Dao Commune, Hung Nguyen District, of Nghe An province. Four of her older children (2 boys and 2 girls) are working away from home and rarely visit, leaving her to take care of the family and all the housework on her own. Mrs. T. starts loaning money in 1998 with the starting amount of $50 to invest in her butchery business. After her four children grew up and left home, without any one to help out, she had to change to fish-farming and raising pigs. Her husband, Mr. Tran Minh Quy, is a disable war veteran but has helped her a lot in both of these businesses. On average, for every farrow of pig she sells (usually once in every 3 months) she earns a profit of $150. Currently, Mrs T. is asking for a loan of $825 to invest in her home projects. This amount of money will be used to buy breeding fish (for $312), breeding pig (for $200) and foodstuff for them (for $312).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ch Nguyn Th Tuyt, 55 tui sng cng vi chng v c con gi nui ti x Hng o, huyn Hng Nguyn, Ngh An. 4 ngi con ln gm 2 trai, 2 gi u i lm n xa t c dp v thm cha m, ch Tuyt mt mnh chm lo hu ht cng vic trong gia nh. Ch bt u tham gia vay vn t nm 1998 vi mc vn 50 USD u t cho vic mua tht ln bn, nhng sau khi cc con i lm xa khng c ngi ph gip, ch Tuyt chuyn sang chn nui c v ln ging. Chng ch, anh Trn Minh Qu, mt thng bnh binh l ngi ph gip ch rt tch cc trong cng vic trng nom ao c v n ln. Tnh bnh qun c sau khi bn mt la ln ( 3 thng ) ch Tuyt thu li khong 150 USD. Hin nay ch Tuyt ang lm d n xin vay 825 USD u t cho d n ca mnh. S tin ny c ch tnh ton chi tiu nh sau: 312 USD mua c ging, 200 USD mua ln ging, 312 USD dng mua thc n.

loan.use: buy breeding pigs, fishes and food for them

loan.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi S., 57 years old, currently lives with her husband and 5 children at Hung Nguyen district of Nghe An province. Of her 5 children, only two are going to school, while one is disable. To be able to make ends meet, Mrs. S. has to do all sorts of works, ranging from farming, loaning thresher and harrow machine service, to fish-farming. Though very busy with all these jobs, she still finds time to get involve in welfare works. Currently, she is the chairman of the women association as well as the head of district 17, branch 6 of the TYM Fund. Mrs. S. has had a long history of loaning money to raise pigs but the recent livestock and poultry epidemic diseases have forced her to change to rent out room for weddings. On average, each month she earns a profit of $75 from this service. Now, she is asking to borrow $250 more to buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for the service usages.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Nm nay 47 tui, ch Phm Th S. sng cng chng v 5 ngi con ti huyn Hng Nguyn, Ngh An. Trong s 5 ngi con ca ch th hai cn ang i hc, mt b tn tt. c thu nhp nui sng gia nh ch S. lm loi cng vic: lm rung, dch v my tut la, my ba, ao c. Mc d bn rn vt v lm kinh t nhng ch cng l ngi rt tch cc tham gia cng tc x hi. Ch hin va m nhn cng vic ca mt chi hi trng ph n thn va l cm trng cm 17, chi nhnh 6 Qu Tnh thng. c mt thi gian di vay vn chn nui ln nhng hin nay khi xut hin dch bnh gia sc, gia cm ch chuyn sang dch v cho thu phng rp lm m ci. Trung bnh mt thng ch thu li khong 75 USD t dch v ny. Hin nay ch ang xin vay thm 250 USD mua thm bn gh, bt a nhm pht trin dch v ca mnh.

loan.use: buy tables, chairs, bowls and chopsticks for hire

loan.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. lives with three children in district Nghi Loc, province Nghe An. Her husband, Mr. Hoang Van Chiem, and their oldest son work away from home as construction workers. They only visit home once a month. In order to raise her three kids, Mrs. M. works really hard on her 1.4-acre field of rice and peanut and breeds pigs and poultry. During the first year joining the Fund, she borrowed $200 to buy pigs and poultry. From this, she earned an average of $20-30 per month. Encouraged by the initial success, she continued to borrow money to develop her business. Unfortunately, her youngest son got in an accident. All the savings from M.s project as well as the family income is used for the hospital and medicine bills. Although facing a lot of difficulties, Mrs. M. still believes in a bright future. Now her youngest son has just been able to walk again. M. hopes that in 10 years, by the time she is 60, all of her children would be well-educated and each would have a good job. Mr.s M. wants to borrow $500 to buy more pigs to expand her project, bringing more income to her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ch Nguyn Th Mi sng cng ba con ti huyn Nghi Lc, tnh Ngh An. Chng ch, anh Hong Vn Chim, cng con trai u i lm th xy mi thng mi v nh mt ln. nui 3 con n hc, ngoi 1, 4 mu t trng la v lc, ch Mi cn tch cc u t chn nui g, ln. Nm u tin vo Qu, ch vay 200 USD mua ln, g, vt. Sau nm u khon u t ny mang li cho gia nh trung bnh mi thng 20 - 30 USD. c khch l bi thnh cng bc u ch tip tc vay vn pht trin d n. Nhng khng may, con trai th 3 ca gia nh ch b tai nn. Ton b s tin li t d n cng nh lng ca hai b con anh i lm thu u chi tiu ht vo vic thuc thang, vin ph. Tuy gp kh khn nhng ch Mi vn lun tin tng vo tng lai. Hin ti con trai ch c th i li c. Ch Mi mong 10 nm na khi 60 tui cc con ch u hc hnh t t c cng n vic lm. Cng vi s g vt hin ti, ch ang lm n vay vn 500 USD mua thm vi con ln cho d n tng thu nhp ca mnh.

loan.use: buy pigs

loan.name: Houdzeko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houdzeko T., 38, is the mother of seven of the children of a polygamous marriage. She manages to earn her living through selling groceries on a small scale. Unfortunately, she often confronts the problem of having certain items run out because she cannot afford to reorder quickly enough; thus her customers needs may go unmet and she risks losing her clientele.

In order to be able to satisfy their needs, T. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will serve as capital for wholesale purchase of grocery items that she can then stock and resell. The success of this venture will do much to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 38 ans, Madame T. Houdzeko est mre de sept (7) enfants dans une famille polygame. Elle fait essentiellement le commerce des produits vivriers qui lui procure assez de revenus. Malheureusement, elle est trs souvent confronte au problme de rupture de stock cause du manque des moyens financiers surtout et les commandes de clients ne sont pas satisfaites.

Pour faire face aux besoins exprims par sa clientle, elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour lachat en gros, le stockage et la revente des produits vivriers. Le succs de cette activit permettra damliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loan.use: wholesale purchase, stocking and resale of grocery items

loan.name: Koffi Basile

texts.fr:
Mr. Basile Koffi A. was born in Gap (Prfecture of Zio, Togo) in 1963. Coming from a poor family, he was not able to attend school. He is married and father of eight children. Besides his agricultural pursuits, he tends a small flock of goats and chickens. His financial situation does not permit him to build stalls or henhouses or install drinking troughs and mangers, etc. He is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to expand his micro-business of small-animal raising. Improving conditions for his animals will permit him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koffi Basile est n Gap (Prfecture du Zio) en 1963. Issu dune famille pauvre, il navait pas eu la chance pour sinstruire. Mari, il est pre de huit (8) enfants. En plus de lagriculture, il entretient un petit levage de petits ruminants et de volailles. Ainsi, ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de faire face aux besoins de constructions de paillote, de bergerie, de se doter des abreuvoirs, mangeoires et divers. Il sollicite un appui financier de $1000. La ralisation de ce projet contribuera son plein panouissement et celui de sa famille.

loan.use: Fo Koffi

loan.name: Gulesmer

texts.en:
In the picture you can see Gulesmer with her husband. Gulesmer is a mother of 5 children. She lives in Khachmaz town, is 54 years old, and has been farming for 6 years.
She has her own orchard where she grows fruit trees and vegetables. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticides so she can improve her business and harvest more.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loan.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akossiwa A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Gap, Togo. She is married and mother of 10 children. Her neer-do-well husband is drives a motorcycle taxi but scarcely manages to support his family. Born into a poor family, Mrs. A. began early with the business of preparing beans and gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple food) for sale. This is her main business undertaking and she works hard at it in spite of her meager resources.

A. would like to expand her micro-business, but she does not have the necessary capital to do so. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 600 which will allow her to build a shed and to purchase raw materials for her production of basic staples for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akossiwa est ne le 31 dcembre 1969 Gap. Elle est marie et mre de dix (10) enfants. Son mari malafoutier et conducteur de taxi moto arrive difficilement supporter sa famille. Issue dune famille pauvre, Madame A. Akossiwa sest adonne trs tt la prparation et la vente du haricot et gari. Cette activit est la toute premire quelle exerce avec bravoure malgr son infirmit.

Elle cherche aujourdhui renforcer cette activit mais ne dispose pas assez de moyens. Elle sollicite cet effet un crdit de $600 qui va lui servir de construction dun hangar, lapprovisionnement des matires premires pour la prparation et la vente du haricots.

loan.use: build a shed and buy raw materials for her staple food production

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add stock for his inventory

loan.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is 56 years old and married. He has three children and lives in Khachmaz town. 3 years ago , he started his business. He sells agricultural produce: tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages,etc. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more agricultural produce so he can increase his income.

loan.use: To buy agricultural produce

loan.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1971 in Gap, Togo, Mrs. Adjo B. is a seamstress. Married to a farmer who has difficulty supporting the family, she manages daily to come up with her share of financial input for their familys needs.

Adjo is illiterate since she lacked the financial means to attend school. Instead, she became an apprentice. At the end of her apprenticeship and in view of her rather difficult situation, she has been obliged to rent a sewing machine to use in order to practice her trade.

With all this in mind, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which she plans to use to buy a sewing machine and set up a workshop where she can do her work in proper fashion. This will allow her to improve her socio-economic condition and live life more fully.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ne en 1971 Gap, Madame B. Adjo est couturire. Marie un cultivateur qui arrive difficilement supporter la famille, elle se dbrouille quotidiennement pour supporter les charges du mnage.

Cest une femme analphabte parce quelle na pas eu les moyens daller lcole. A la fin de son apprentissage, compte tenu de sa situation difficile, elle se voit obliger de louer une machine coudre afin dexercer son mtier.

Vu les difficults quelle endure, elle sollicite un crdit de $1000 afin de se doter des machines coudre et amnager son atelier de couture pour exercer pleinement ses activits. La ralisation de ce projet lui permettrait damliorer ses conditions de vie socio conomiques.

loan.use: buying a sewing machine and setting up a workshop

loan.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz has sold agricultural produce in a local market for about a year. He is from Khachmaz town, is married, and has two children. He is 57 years old. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more products.

loan.use: to increase agricultural produce

loan.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in Gap, Togo in 1970. His impoverished family had problems coming up with school fees for him, leading him to go to work at an early age farming. This is the main business activity in his region and Kokou works hard at it, though he has difficulty due to seasonal weather problems. He would like to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides in order to kill the weeds that cut into his harvest. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to buy these products and increase the land he has in cultivation as well as his production. Dynamic and honest, Kokou has already received one loan which he reimbursed without difficulty.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokou est n Gap en 1970. Les difficults de lcole dues la pauvret des parents lont pousses rapidement sadonner lagriculture. Activit premire de la rgion, il lexerce avec bravoure. Seulement il se voit confronter aux intempries saisonnires. Ainsi, il pense sacheter des engrais, des insecticides et herbicides pour tuer les mauvaises herbes qui rendent insuffisante la rcolte. Pour y arriver, il sollicite un crdit de $1000 pour se doter des intrants agricoles afin daugmenter sa surface cultivable et son rendement. Dynamique et honnte, il a dj bnfici dun crdit quil a rembours sans incident.

loan.use: buying agricultural chemical products such as fertilizer, etc.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her fruit selling business

loan.name: Antiga

texts.en: Antiga (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children and lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Together with her husband, she has a small food store. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more food items so she can attract more clients.

loan.use: To buy food items

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her fish-selling business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add more inventory for her shoe business

loan.name: Essi

texts.fr:
At 28 years of age, Mrs. Essi D. is her husbands third wife and mother of three children. Generally, husbands who have several wives tend to neglect their role as fathers because they are weighted down by too much responsibility for supporting their households. It is thus the women who eke out a living for their children, feeding, clothing, and educating them. Such is the situation that Mrs. D. finds herself in.

Fortunately for her children, Essi is a dynamic woman with lots of business activities. Currently, she has opened up a little telephone stand, together with selling shoes and various other products. In order to expand these micro-businesses, Essi is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will serve her as business capital. This will allow her to increase her profit and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 28 ans, Madame D. Essi est la 3me femme de son mari. Gnralement, les hommes qui ont plusieurs femmes ngligent leur rle de pre de famille car ils sont crass par les charges du mnage. Il revient alors aux femmes de se battre pour nourrir, habiller et scolariser leurs enfants. Telle est la situation dans laquelle se retrouve Madame D. Essi qui est aujourdhui mre de trois (3) enfants.

Heureusement, elle est une femme trs active et mne beaucoup dactivits. Actuellement, elle a ouvert une cabine tlphonique et y ajoute la vente des chaussures et autres produits divers. Pour amliorer cette activit, elle sollicite un crdit de $1000 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce. Ceci lui permettra damliorer ses revenus et damliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Achat et revente des chaussures et autres produits divers

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
At 53 years of age, Mrs. Yawa A. is a very dynamic woman. Married with four (4) children, she is familiar with several activities : the sale of gari (ground cassava), cereals, and other food products. This small business allows her to contribute much to her household expenses. Currently, these expenses have become very high because her husband, already worn out by old age, has become unemployed. In order to increase the size of her business, Mrs. Yawa A. is asking for $900 in financial support, which will serve as a capital base to buy and re-sell products. This will allow her to increase her revenue and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Age de 53 ans, Madame A. Yawa est une femme trs dynamique. Marie et mre de quatre (4) enfants, elle a plusieurs activits savoir : la vente du gari et des crales et autres produits vivriers.Ce petit commerce lui permet de contribuer pour beaucoup aux charges du mnage. Aujourdhui, ces charges sont devenues trs lourdes car le mari dj fatigu par lge est devenu inactif. En vue daugmenter la taille de ses activits, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un apport financier de $900 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour lachat et la vente de ses produits. Ceci lui permettra daccrotre ses revenus et amliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy and re-sale cereals and other food products

loan.name: Amwotona

texts.fr:
At 53 years of age, Mrs. Amwotona A. is married to a polygamous man and has four (4) children. Very active, her principal activity is the fabrication and sale of cassava flour, called "gari." This is a very profitable business because her customers are primarily wholesalers. Being unable to grow cassava herself anymore, she is satisfied with buying fields' worth of cassava and making the most use of it. Currently, she is very limited by her means because the demand has grown very high. Thus, she wants to increase her production in order to suitably satisfy her clientele. She is therefore asking for a loan of $400 in order to make her purchases at lower cost and to realize higher profits.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Age de 53 ans, Madame A. Amwotona est marie un homme polygame et est mre de quatre (4) enfants. Trs active, son activit principale est la fabrication et la vente de la farine de manioc gari . Cest une activit trs rentable car sa clientle est la plupart grossiste. Ne pouvant plus cultiver elle-mme le manioc, elle se contente dacheter les champs de manioc et lexploiter. Aujourdhui, elle est trs limite par les moyens car la demande est devenue trs forte. Elle dsire donc augmenter sa production afin de pouvoir satisfaire convenablement sa clientle. Elle sollicite pour cela un crdit de $400 afin de pouvoir faire les achats moindre cot et raliser de bon bnfice.

loan.use: To buy cassava to make gari

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Widowed 5 years ago, Mrs. Yawa A. lives with her six (6) children. At 45 years of age, she is still very dynamic. Her principal activity is the sale of cereals and gari (cassava flour), a business which she combines with agriculture. The cereal business is very profitable, but requires considerable means, which Mrs. Yawa A. does not have at her disposal. She is thus asking for a loan of $850 which will serve as capital to increase her storage capacity. This will increase her income and also improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve depuis bientt 5 ans, Madame A. Yawa vit avec ses six (6) enfants. A 45 ans, elle est encore trs dynamique. Son activit principale est la vente des crales et du gari (farine de manioc), activit quelle associe lagriculture. Le commerce des crales est une activit trs rentable mais qui ncessite beaucoup de moyens. Ce dont Madame A. Yawa ne dispose pas. Elle sollicite alors un crdit de $850 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour augmenter sa capacit de stockage. Ceci amliorera son revenu et du coup les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell cereals

loan.name: Hanu

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanu A. is 50 years of age. Despite her age, she remains very dynamic and knows how to manage her time. The second wife of a polygamous husband, she is the mother of five (5) children and has two (2) additional children in her care. Every morning, from 6AM to 9AM, she sells doughballs accompanied by fried fish. Afterwards, she goes to the market to sell cereals and gari (cassava flour). It is thanks to this activity that she is able to meet the needs of her children. Currently, the household expenses are becoming increasingly high, and Mrs. Hanu A. wants to enlarge her business. She is thus asking for a loan of $750 which will serve as a capital base for the sale, storage, and resale of cereals.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Hanu est ge de 50 ans. Malgr cet ge, elle demeure trs dynamique et sait grer son temps. Deuxime femme dun mari polygame, elle est mre de cinq (5) enfants et a sa charges deux (2) autres enfants. Tous les matins, de 6 heures 9 heures, elle vend des boules de ptes accompagnes de poissons frits. Aprs elle se rend au march pour la vente des crales et du gari. Cest grce cette activit quelle parvient subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Aujourdhui, les charges du mnage deviennent de plus en plus lourdes et Mme A. Hanu dsire largir son commerce. Elle sollicite cet effet un crdit de $750 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour lachat, le stockage et la revente des crales.

loan.use: To buy, store, and re-sell cereals

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To expand her movie business.

loan.name: Jean

texts.fr:
At 45 years of age, Mr. Jean A. is married and has five (5) children and eight (8) additional people in his care. His principal work is the buying and selling of small ruminants. This business requires lots of travel because he needs to go to remote areas where these animals cost less. This necessitates considerable financial means. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household. To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of $1000 which will serve to buy, transport, and re-sell small ruminants. This will allow him to meet effectively the needs of his household.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Ag de 45 ans Monsieur A. Jean est mari et pre de cinq (5) enfants et a sa charge huit (8) autres personnes. Il a comme activit principale lachat et la revente de petits ruminants. Cette activit demande beaucoup de dplacement car il faut aller dans les localits recules o ces petits ruminants cotent moins chers. Cela ncessite assez de moyens financiers. Lactivit est trs rentable mais linsuffisance de son capital rend le revenu insignifiant et les conditions de vie demeurent difficiles dans le mnage. Pour renforcer son commerce, il sollicite un appui financier de $1000 qui servira lachat, au transport et la revente des petits ruminants. Cela lui permettra de faire face efficacement aux besoins de son foyer.

loan.use: To buy, transport, and re-sell small ruminants

loan.name: Babuu

texts.en: M. is a 28-year-old, up-coming business man and resident of Mbagala area, in Dar Es Salaam City. He had to leave school 7 years ago due to lack of school fees, and he has been in business ever since. At his grocery, M. sells food stuffs including rice, wheat, maize flour, beans, cooking oil and other household needs. M.s business slows down dry during the season, because the cost of food items shoots up and he isn't able to keep enough stock to supply his customers. M. is requesting a loan of $750 which will enable him to stock enough items to meet his customers' year-round demand and to build a store and expand his business.

loan.use: To build a store and insure supply of stock

loan.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 39-year-old mother of four and a resident of Mbagala area, Dar Es Salaams largest slum area. She owns a boutique that specializes in ladies items (shoes, clothing, and hand bags). She has been in business for the past five years, and her business has been growing steadily since joining the Youth Self Employment foundation. She trades in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaams biggest trading areas, and her business booms during the Easter and Christmas seasons. She is requesting a loan of $550 to increase her stock so she can take more advantage of her boom periods and to expand her business.

loan.use: To increase stock and expand business

loan.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima, is a 42-year-old mother of 3 and a resident of Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She has two school-aged children, both in secondary school. Halima runs a grocery business strategically located in the Buguruni area. She and her husband (seated) have been doing business for the past twenty years. She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation business trainings and this knowledge has helped her to improve her business. She has agents up country who supply her with food items, and she sells as retailer. She also sells pumped water at her home, which adds to her income. She is requesting a loan of $550, which will enable her to increase her stock and expand her business.

loan.use: To increase stock and expand business

loan.name: Khalidi

texts.en: Khalidi is 28-year-old energetic carpenter and resident of Buguruni area. He is the father of 2 children. He has been in business for 6 years and is a skilled carpenter. Khalidi received business training from programs organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. He buys wood upcountry and sells some of it retail at his workshop. He uses the remaining wood to make chairs, beds and tables. He helps his community by employing three others to work with him. Khalidi is requesting a loan of $750 so he can purchase more modern equipment, which will enable him to expand his workshop and his business.

loan.use: To buy modern equipment and expand his carpentry workshop

loan.name: Merci

texts.fr:
A young woman of approximately 38, Mrs. Merci A. is the mother of one child and is also responsible for her sisters three children. She is a woman with a great fighting spirit and her activity is the sale of poultry as well as small ruminants and snails. This enables her to meet the expenses of her household. The activity is demanding and requires a lot of input, particularly financial, which she has never had. Today she is requesting $600 in order to go herself into surrounding villages to obtain supplies at the least possible cost, thus increasing her income and improving the living conditions of her family.

Jeune femme de 38 ans environ, Madame A. Merci est mre dun enfant et a sa charge trois (3) autres enfants de sa surs. Cest une femme trs battante et a comme activit la vente des volailles et aussi de petits ruminants et des escargots. Cela lui permet de supporter les charges de son mnage. Lactivit a beaucoup dexigence et demande assez de moyens surtout financiers; ce qui lui a toujours manqu. Aujourdhui, elle sollicite $600 pour aller elle-mme dans les villages environnants pour sapprovisionner moindre cot et ainsi augmenter ses revenus en vue dune amlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: To buy and sell poultry

payment.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loan.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Aged 47, Mrs Akou A. is married and the mother of eight children. In addition to her own children, she is responsible for four others. Her husband, who has no steady employment, has five wives and about 20 children. He is totally irresponsible and shows almost no concern for the welfare of his children. As a consequence, Mrs. A. lives in extreme poverty and many of her children do not attend school. In order to survive, she generates income from growing cassava. The tuberous roots of cassava are turned into tapioca that she sells at the market. The quality of her product has given her today a large clientele, but she can no longer meet their demand because she does not have enough cassava. To address this situation, she would like to buy some cassava fields to use in her production. She is therefore requesting a business loan of $700 to buy cassava and produce and sell tapioca. This will bring change to her day-to-day life.

Age de 47 ans, Madame A. Akou est marie et mre de huit (8) enfants. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a sa charge quatre (4) autres. Son mari qui na aucun emploi fixe a cinq femmes avec une vingtaine denfants. Il est totalement irresponsable et ne se soucie gure du bien-tre des enfants. La consquence est que Madame A. Akou vit dans une extrme pauvret et nombre de ses enfants ne vont pas lcole. Pour survivre, elle a comme activit gnratrice de revenu la culture du champ de manioc. Les tubercules de manioc sont transforms en faine (gari) quelle vend sur le march. La qualit de son produit fait quelle a ce jour une clientle abondante quelle narrive plus satisfaire car elle na pas suffisamment de manioc. Pour amliorer cette situation, elle dsire dsormais acheter des champs de manioc pour sa production. Elle sollicite cet effet un crdit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour lachat de manioc, la fabrication et la vente du gari. Cela apportera un changement dans sa vie de tous les jours.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: To buy a cassava field for the production of tapioca

loan.name: Aku

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

50 years old, Mrs A. Aku is a married, mother of five (5) children and has under her care three (3) other people. Her principal business activity is sale of paraffin oil in her locality. This activity gets enough incomes to her and allows her to contribute for a great part to the loads of the household.

Today, a very strong request for products of general food is felt and Mrs. A. Aku seized the occasion to also sell food in addition to oil sales. But she needs enough money to reinforce the activity. It is regularly in out-of-stock condition, and the customers are obliged to go elsewhere to make their purchases. To cure that and to satisfy her customers effectively, she requests a loan of $500 which will be used by her for the purchase and the sale of the products of general food.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Age de 50 ans, Madame A. Aku est marie, mre de cinq (5) enfants et a sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Elle a comme activit principale la vente de ptrole lampant dans sa localit. Cette activit lui procure assez de revenus et lui permet de contribuer pour une grande part aux charges du mnage. Aujourdhui, une demande trs forte de produits dalimentation gnrale se fait sentir et Mme A. Aku a saisi loccasion pour associer ce petit commerce sa vente de ptrole. Mais elle a besoin dassez dargent pour renforcer lactivit. Elle est rgulirement en rupture de stock, et les clients sont obligs de se rendre ailleurs pour faire leurs achats. Pour remdier cela et satisfaire efficacement sa clientle, elle sollicite un crdit de $500 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour lachat et la vente des produits dalimentation gnrale.

loan.use: Achat et vente des produits dalimentation gnrale.

loan.name: Ccile

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ccile A. is a 44 year-old widow and mother of eight children.
