She does some basic agricultural work but what brings her the income needed to meet the needs of her family is African pharmacopoeia. She is blessed with knowing the powers of many plants. Today this activity is going from strength to strength, but finding the herbs and plants poses serious problems. It means a lot of traveling from one prefecture to another, and from one region to another. Likewise, it requires a minimum cash flow in order to maximize purchasing power. For this, she is asking for a loan of $500.

. Madame A. Ccile est une veuve de 44 ans et mre de huit (8) enfants. Elle fait lagriculture rudimentaire mais ce qui lui procure le revenu ncessaire pour assurer les besoins de sa famille est la pharmacope africaine. Elle a la grce de connatre la vertu de beaucoup de plante. Aujourdhui cette activit prend de plus en plus de lampleur mais la recherche de ses herbes ou plantes pose de srieux problmes. Cela demande beaucoup de dplacement dune prfecture une autre, dune rgion une autre. De mme, il faut un minimum de liquidit pour faire le maximum dachat. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un crdit de $500.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Buying herbs and plants

loan.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Aged 28, Mrs. Adjo A. is married and the mother of four children. Coming from a poor, polygamous family and wishing at all costs that her younger brothers and sisters will also be successful, she has taken responsibility for these five youngsters. Her income comes essentially from the sale of food products, especially fish. She is looking for funding to open a small grocery store. For this reason she is asking for financial support of $800.

Age de 28 ans, Madame A. Adjo est marie et mre de quatre (4) enfants. Sortie dune famille pauvre et polygame et voulant tout prix que ses petits frres et surs russissent aussi, elle a pris sa charge ces derniers au nombre de cinq (5). Ses sources de revenus proviennent essentiellement de la vente des produits vivriers et surtout du poisson. Elle cherche plus de moyen afin douvrir une boutique dalimentation gnrale. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un appui financier de $800.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Purchase and resale of food products

loan.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 40, Mrs. Abla A. is unmarried and has three children. She also supports two orphans. Her main activity is the buying and selling of poultry in the markets around her village. This business brings in enough income to meet the daily requirements of her family. However, she is still very limited in her financial resources, especially as she has no one to help her. Mrs. A. is asking today for a loan of $500 to put into her business. In view of her earnings that always show a surplus and her dynamic attitude towards work, she is more than capable of making a profit on this loan and paying it back promptly.

A 40 ans, Madame A. Abla est clibataire avec trois (3) enfants. Elle supporte aussi deux (2) orphelins. Son activit principale est lachat et la vente de volailles dans les marchs environnants de son village. Ce commerce lui rapporte assez de revenus ncessaires pour assurer le quotidien de sa famille. Cependant elle est trs limite en matire de ressources financires dautant plus quelle na personne pour lui apporter des aides. Madame A. Abla sollicite aujourdhui un crdit de $500 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Au vu de son compte dexploitation toujours excdentaire et son dynamisme au travail, elle est bien capable de rentabiliser ce crdit et de le rembourser promptement.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Buying and selling poultry

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 40, Mrs. Ablavi A. is married and the mother of five children. Her activity is to buy small ruminants and poultry from local breeders and sell them at the various markets. This work requires a lot of financial means since it involves a fair amount of travel. However, it is a very profitable activity. For this reason Mrs. A. is seeking financing to strengthen her business. She is asking for a business loan of $700. This loan is very important for improving her income as the financial burden of the family is too great.

Age de 40 ans, Madame A. Ablavi est marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. Son activit est dacheter chez les leveurs, des petits ruminants et des volailles quelle revend sur les marchs. Un travail qui ncessite beaucoup de moyens financiers car demandant assez de dplacement. Cependant, cest une activit trs rentable. Cest pour cela que Madame A. Ablavi recherche un financement pour la renforcer. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 de fonds de commerce. Ce crdit est trs important pour amliorer ses revenus car les charges de la famille sont trop lourdes.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Buying and selling small ruminants and poultry

loan.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 24, Mrs. Ablavi Z. is the mother of three children and lives with her husband in difficult conditions. Her husband is illiterate and has no trade to speak of. The childrens future is in jeopardy. But the bravery of this young woman gives the household much hope. Having obtained an initial loan of $300, she set up a small grocery business. Today, having repaid her loan, she is asking once again for help with the sum of $750, which she can put into the business. Supporting this family is also a humanitarian act for the children's future.

Age de 24 ans, Madame Z. Ablavi est mre de trois (3) enfants et vit avec son mari dans des conditions difficiles. Le mari analphabte na aucun mtier sous la main. Lavenir des enfants est presque compromis. Mais le courage de cette jeune femme donne beaucoup despoir au foyer. Avec un premier crdit de $300 quelle avait obtenu, elle a initi un petit commerce dalimentation gnrale. Aujourdhui, aprs avoir bien rembours son crdit, elle sollicite de nouveau un appui dun montant de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Soutenir cette famille est aussi une uvre humanitaire pour lavenir des enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loan.use: Buying and selling of general foodstuffs

loan.name: Vicky

texts.fr:
A young woman of 35, Mrs. Vicky A. is married and mother of three children. She sells groceries as a micro-business and primary source of income. This business is quite profitable but Vicky is often confronted with the problem of running out of certain items and she is not able to buy other things her customers need, both due to lack of business capital. In order to solve these problems and keep her clientele coming back, Vicky is asking for a loan of US$ 800. This will allow her to increase her profits and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Jeune femme de 35 ans, Madame A. Vicky est marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Elle a comme activit gnratrice de revenu la vente des produits dalimentation gnrale. Cette activit est assez rentable mais elle est souvent confronte au problme de rupture de stock et il lui manque beaucoup darticles que la clientle exige. Afin de venir bout de ces problmes et de fidliser ses clients, elle sollicite un financement de $800. Ceci lui permettra daugmenter ses revenus en vue dune meilleure condition de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: expanding the inventory of her little grocery store

loan.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
At age 47, Mrs. Dovi Y. is married and mother of ten children. Most of her children are not in school because she lacks sufficient financial means to pay school fees, etc. Illiterate parents unfortunately often do not have high expectations for their childrens education.

Farming had always been Mrs. Y.s principal source of income but nowadays, her impoverished soil has made crop production very poor and so suddenly, she finds herself with little income and living conditions for her family become worse and worse.

Mrs. Y., aware of this situation, has opened a little business selling rice, gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple), cooking oil, etc. This initiative has begun to improve her income to the point where she feels the need to apply for a loan of US$ 750 to expand her micro-business. The expansion of her business will allow her to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 47 ans, Madame Y. Dovi est marie et mre de dix (10) enfants. Presque tous ses enfants ne sont pas scolariss faute de moyens financiers. Les parents analphabtes ne nourrissent aucune ambition pour leurs prognitures.

Lagriculture est lactivit principale de cette femme mais aujourdhui, la pauvret des sols fait que les rendements sont devenus trs mauvais. Du coup, il ny a plus de sources de revenus et les conditions de vie sont devenues pires quavant.

Madame Y. Dovi, consciente de la situation, a vite mont un petit commerce de riz, gari, de lhuile et autres. Cette initiative a commerc par amliorer son revenu do le dsir de prendre un crdit de $750 afin de renforcer son commerce. Ce qui lui permettra denvoyer ses enfants lcole.

loan.use: expanding her little business selling Togolese staple foods

loan.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla Z., 46, is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for two other children. Her husband is illiterate and has become an alcoholic, so she has to support him as well.

Mrs. Z.s source of income is selling cooked rice at school in her neighborhood. This is a very profitable business, but her capital is insufficient to allow her to expand and get the most from her micro-business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to build a shed. This sum will also allow her to keep a consistent supply of cooked food on hand. She will thus be able to increase her sales and the profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 46 ans, Madame Z. Abla est marie et mre de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a sa charge deux (2) autres enfants. Son mari est un analphabte qui sest donn lalcool. Il est la charge de la pauvre femme.

Madame Z. Abla a pour activit la vente du riz prpar dans une cole de son quartier. Cest un commerce trs rentable mais ses moyens sont insuffisants pour lagrandir et le rentabiliser. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $800 pour construire un hangar et faire un stock consistant de ses aliments. Ceci augmentera son chiffre daffaire et son revenu.

loan.use: build a shed and have a consistent supply of cooked food on hand for resale

loan.name: Am

texts.fr:
Abandoned by her husband some years ago, Mrs. Am G. is around 50 years old. She has experienced hunger and much suffering in caring for her five children, but she has managed to earn a minimum income for her family thanks to rudimentary farming, selling gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple), and especially selling cooked gruel. At this point, she would like to set herself up to sell other staples along with the gruel. With that goal in mind, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which will allow her to get some basic shelving and stock and sell basic necessities. This will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Abandonne par son mari depuis plusieurs annes, Madame G. Am est ge de 50 ans environ. Elle a connu la faim et la souffrance avec ses cinq (5) enfants. Elle arrive faire survivre sa famille avec une agriculture rudimentaire, la vente du gari et surtout la vente de la bouillie qui lui procure le minimum tous les jours. Aujourdhui, elle souhaite sinstaller afin de vendre part la bouillie les produits de premire ncessit. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crdit de $500 qui lui servira monter un petit talage, acheter et vendre ses produits de premire ncessit. Ceci amliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: buy basic shelving and some staple products for resale

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has a mobile phone shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop and develop his shop. He has three children, and all of them are in school. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard. He also wants to develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase more goods for the shop.

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 22 years old and has a mini-market shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop. He has one child. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard. He also wants to develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop.

loan.name: Kofissi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kofissi G., 33, is mother of four children and has five other people for whom she is responsible. Her husband is without viable financial resources, so the whole burden of providing for the family rests with her.

A courageous and enterprising woman, Kofissi works hard every day to support her children. Her first two loans were reimbursed without problem. As micro-businesses, she raises farm animals and sells basic grocery products. Her great ambition is now to open a little grocery store. Since she has no capital for this micro-business, she is now asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to allow her to make her dream a reality.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 33 ans, Madame G. Kofissi est mre de quatre (4) enfants et a sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Le mari tant sans emploi rmunrateur viable, toute les charges de la famille se repose sur la femme.

Femme courageuse et entreprenante, elle se bat au quotidien pour nourrir ses enfants. Ses deux premiers crdits ont t bien rembourss sans aucun incident. Elle fait de llevage et le commerce des produits dalimentation gnrale. Aujourdhui son ambition est grande : ouvrir une boutique dalimentation gnrale. Faute de moyens, elle sollicite un crdit de $1000 pour la ralisation de ce projet.

loan.use: open a little grocery store selling basic necessities

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has a welding shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1000 to purchase a new welding machine. He has a big family, and he is the only one responsible for supporting them. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income. At the same time, he wants to hire two unemployed people to work with him.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase new welding machine

loan.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 41 years old and has a carpentry shop in Kirkuk. He applied to get $1200 to purchase a new carpenter machine tiger type , . His shop was burn three months ago but he work and paint the shop and he look forward to rebuild his shop and increasing his assets . He wants to develop his shop and increase his income. At the same time, he wants to hire two unemployed to work with him .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loan.use: Purchase a new carpenter machine

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Widowed three years ago, Mrs. Yawa A. is 39 and mother of six children. She has a great deal of difficulty providing the basic necessities for her children, especially their school fees, etc. The older ones have had to leave school due to lack of financial means. Yawas business activity is selling the lengths of cloth used as wraps or sarongs in Africa (pagnes) and cosmetics. Unfortunately, she has very little capital to expand her business. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to increase her profit and be able to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Devenue veuve depuis 3 ans, Madame A. Yawa est ge de 39 ans et mre de six (6) enfants. Elle a toutes les difficults pour assumer les besoins quotidiens de ses enfants et surtout leur scolarit. Les ans ont d abandonner lcole faute de moyen. Lactivit qui lui procure un peu de revenu est la vente de tissus pagnes et des produits de beaut. Malheureusement elle a des moyens trs limits pour pouvoir agrandir ce commerce. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un crdit de $800 afin damliorer ses revenus et assurer la scolarit de ses enfants.

loan.use: sale of cloth (African sarongs) and cosmetics

loan.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agossi V., 38 years of age and married to a polygamous husband, is mother of five children and responsible for six other people. In this family, every wife is responsible for the daily needs and the education of her children. Mrs. V. is dynamic and, in spite of very limited capital, manages to run a micro-business selling smoked fish. She is intent on improving her life with this business so that she can do better by those who depend on her as breadwinner. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 38 ans et marie un homme polygame, Madame V. Agossi est mre de cinq (5) enfants et a sa charge six (6) autres personnes. Dans cette famille, chaque femme soccupe du quotidien et de la scolarit de son enfant. Madame V. trs active et battante a comme activit la vente du poisson fum avec un moyen trs limit. Aujourdhui, elle compte absolument amliorer ses conditions de vie travers son activit gnratrice de revenu. Cest pourquoi elle sollicite un crdit de $500.

loan.use: buying and smoking fish for resale

loan.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan owns his home on Alberto Ostria Street, # 1568, in the Tembladerani district of La Paz. He lives there with his wife and three children. He drives his taxi every afternoon and also runs a body shop from his home. He would use the loan for car maintenance and also to buy spare parts. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004; he opened his business with a loan from us and has noticeably bettered his station in life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Juan vive en casa propia en la Calle Alberto Ostria N 1568 de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; vive con su esposa y tiene tres hijos, trabaja con su taxi todas las tardes y tambin tiene su taller de chaperia ( body shop) el cual esta ubicado en el mismo domicilio. El crdito que solicita es para la reparacin de su movilidad y compra de algunos repuestos. Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el ao 2004 y con nosotros comenz su taller y mejoro notablemente su nivel de vida.

loan.use: Car maintenance

payment.comment: early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loan.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi B., 41, is mother of six children. Coming from a poor family, she is responsible for many relativeslots of mouths to feed but few resources. Her business is stocking and reselling gari (i.e., manioc flour, a Togolese staple). This business is quite profitable and could be even more so if she were able to invest more capital into her micro-business. For this reason she is asking for a loan of US$ 800 so that she can stock a consistent amount of gari and thus increase her turnover and her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 41 ans, Madame B. Afi est mre de six (6) enfants. Sortie dune famille pauvre, elle a sa charge beaucoup dautres personnes de sa famille. Beaucoup de bouches nourrir mais peu de ressources. Son activit est le stockage et la vente du gari. Ce commerce est bien rentable et peut ltre davantage si elle sinvestit davantage. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite $800 pour faire un stockage consistant en vue daccrotre son chiffre daffaire et son revenu.

loan.use: sale of gari (manioc flour, a Togolese staple food)

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa Z., 32, is mother of three children. Her principle business activity is selling basic foodstuffs and charcoal. This enterprise requires a big input of capital because supplies of charcoal must be bought far from the coastal area where she lives.

In order to make her business viable, Yawa has to be able to buy in bulk each time she goes to replenish her supply of charcoal. This of course necessitates a ready supply of cash. For this reason, Yawa is requesting a loan of US$ 800. She has always managed to repay prior loans in a timely fashion. This loan will be a supplementary resource that will allow her to get the most out of her micro-business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Age de 32 ans, Madame Z. Yawa est mre de trois (3) enfants. Son activit principale est le commerce des produits vivriers et du charbon. Ce commerce demande beaucoup de fonds car les zones dapprovisionnement sont bien loignes de la Rgion Maritime o elle habite.

Pour rentabiliser cette activit, il faut acheter beaucoup de produits lors dun dplacement. Ceci exigerait la disponibilit de beaucoup dargent. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite $800. Elle a toujours fait ses preuves en remboursant ses crdits antrieurs sans incident. Ce crdit sera pour elle une ressource supplmentaire afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce.

loan.use: buying charcoal in bulk far from the location of her business

loan.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos lives in his own house which is located on Final Landaeta Street, #45 in the Cota zone in the capital city of La Paz, Bolivia. He is single and works with plastic tubing for the sewer system. He distributes the material throughtout La Paz. The loan that he is applying for will be invested in increasing his capital. He was also asked to supply boxes of the same item for a customer. He has his workshop at home and works by himself.

He is a new client and his financial analysis indicates that he is able to access the loan for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Santos vive en casa propia en la Calle Final Landaeta N 45 de la zona de Cota huma de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y trabaja con tubos de plstico para el alcantarillado y reparte su material en La Paz. El crdito que solicita es para aumentar capital ya que le pidieron cajas para el mismo rubro. Tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio y trabaja solo.

Es cliente nuevo y el anlisis financiero indica que puede acceder a un crdito.

loan.use: Working capital

loan.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs A. Edoh is a 55 years old woman and worn out by tiredness. In spite of her old age, it is very voluntary and full with creative idea. Its principal activity is the sales and manufacture of manioc and gari. Manioc is a starch made by leaching and drying the root of the cassava plant; the source of tapioca; a staple food in the tropics. Gari is pickled ginger.

This activity is of great benefit and allows her provide for the needs for the family. She wishes today to increase the business and requests for that a loan of $600 which will be used to her to buy provisions in manioc for the manufacture and the sale of the gari . This will enable her to provide the needs for her five (5) children and the four (4) others whom she provides for.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Madame A. Edoh est une femme ge de 55 ans et use par la fatigue. Malgr son ge avanc, elle est trs volontaire et pleine dide cratrice. Son activit principale est lachat des champs de manioc pour fabrication du gari. Cette activit lui procure de grands bnfices et lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle dsire aujourdhui agrandir lactivit et sollicite pour cela un crdit de $600 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce pour s'approvosionner en manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente du gari. Ceci lui permettra de venir bout des besoins de ses cinq (5) et des quatre (4) autres sa charge.

loan.use: Achat en gros du manioc et fabrication du gari

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos lives in a house he has rented for over 12 years on Juan Granier Street in the September 14 district of La Paz. He is 62. He's a tailor specializing in men's suits. He employs two people who work alongside Carlos; one cuts out the patterns, and the other sews. He would use the loan to buy a sewing machine and a machine for sewing buttons and buttonholes, hoping to expand his business and hire another employee. He has been an IMPRO client since 2002. His record is good and qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Vaolunteer

Carlos vive en casa alquilada hace mas de 12 aos en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 62 aos de edad, es sastre y se dedica a la confeccin de ternos. Con el trabajan dos obreros, uno corta y el otro cose, por lo tanto genera empleo. El crdito que solicita es para aumentar sus activos comprando una maquina de coser y una maquina pega botones y poder emplear una persona mas. Por su antecedente histrico, es cliente de Impro desde el ao 2002, se considera un buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crdito.

loan.use: To buy machinery for his tailoring shop

loan.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth lives in her mother's house on Fernando Diez Street in the Alto San Pedro district of La Paz. She is 30. She works as a cleaner in offices and private homes. She has a two-year-old daughter and is separated from her husband. She would use the loan to make improvements to the room where she lives and make it more habitable. She is a new client and would draw from funds in our Development Program, Service Sector.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Janeth vive en casa de su madre en la calle Fernando Diez de medina de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 30 aos de edad y trabaja como empleada de limpieza en oficinas y casas particulares; tiene una nia de 2 aos y esta separada del esposo. El crdito que solicita es para refaccionar la habitacin donde vive y hacerla mas habitable Es cliente nuevo y puede acceder a un crdito que estar dentro de nuestro programa de fomento, sector servicios.

loan.use: Household improvements

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Z., age 32, is a mother of three. Her main work involves commerce in staple foods and in charcoal. This business demands a good deal of funding because food-producing regions are located far from the Maritime Region where she lives. In order to make her business profitable, a lot of goods must be purchased on each trip. This would require access to a lot of money. This is why she is requesting $800. She has always proven herself by repaying her previous loans without incident. This loan will be an added resource for making her business worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Age de 32 ans, Madame Z. Yawa est mre de trois (3) enfants. Son activit principale est le commerce des produits vivriers et du charbon. Ce commerce demande beaucoup de fonds car les zones dapprovisionnement sont bien loignes de la Rgion Maritime o elle habite. Pour rentabiliser cette activit, il faut acheter beaucoup de produits lors dun dplacement. Ceci exigerait la disponibilit de beaucoup dargent. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite $800. Elle a toujours fait ses preuves en remboursant ses crdits antrieurs sans incident. Ce crdit sera pour elle une ressource supplmentaire afin de mieux rentabiliser son commerce.

loan.use: Commerce in staple foods and in charcoal

loan.name: Chabou

texts.fr:
Born in Tsvi in 1977, Chabou I. left middle school due to a lack of financial support. He started selling kebobs, which produces a minimum of revenues. Married and the father of two, he struggles to provide for the needs of his family given his meager income. As an energetic man with a fine command of his business with regard to good hygiene, the practice of which attracts many customers, he is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy animals for making kebobs. He can then make his business worthwhile by maximizing his profit, in order to help more with improving his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

N en 1977 Tsvi, Monsieur I. Chabou a arrt ses tudes secondaires par manque de support financier et sest lanc dans la vente de brochette qui lui procure de revenu minimum. Mari et pre de deux (2) enfants, il subvient aux besoins de sa famille difficilement par son maigre salaire. Dynamique et matrisant bien son activit par la pratique de lhygine qui attire beaucoup de clientle. Il sollicite un crdit de $1000 qui lui servira lachat des animaux pour la prparation des brochettes. Par ce crdit, il peut rentabiliser cette activit pour raliser le maximum de profit afin de mieux contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy animals to make kebobs

loan.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara makes footwear from leather, imitation leather, and other materials. She works for a shoe manufacturer that pays her for every dozen pairs of shoes she produces. Her home and her workshop are in Alto Tejar district of La Paz. She is a single mother and the sole support of her daughter. This is her first loan application. She would use the money to buy an industrial sewing machine and thus increase her productivity. She qualifies for the loan because of her experience in shoe manufacturing and her existing business, which generates enough income for her to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Clara recibe cuero, cuerina y todo tipo de material para calzado ya que se dedica a la preparacin de calzados. Trabaja con una empresa de calzados donde le cancelan por la preparacin de cada docena de calzados. Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto Tejar de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una hija y es la nica que mantiene a su familia ya que es madre soltera. Es la primera vez que solicita un crdito. El monto solicitado ser destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial para mejorar su produccin Su trabajo le permiten acceder a este crdito ya que tiene experiencia en la preparacin de calzados, lo cual le da ingresos suficientes para cubrir el prstamo.

loan.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine on which to make shoes

loan.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco has a car that he uses as a taxi cab for a company called VIP in the city of La Paz.

He lives in the area of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz. This is his second request for a loan from IMPRO. His credit history is impecable since he paid his first loan on time. He will use the loan to fix the engine, to purchase radio supplies and to do a general check-up on his car.

His credit and work history make him a great candidate for another loan, and he has experience running his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi en la empresa VIP. De la ciudad de La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crdito a travs de IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institucin lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligacin. El monto solicitado ser destinado para la arreglo de motor, compra de radio de comunicacin y un mantenimiento completo del vehiculo. Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crdito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loan.use: To fix taxi cab

loan.name: Migan Grard

texts.fr:
Born in Nots on December 20, 1980, Migan Grard K. finished primary school before halting his studies to work as a miller. Today, as the owner of two mills, he is married and the father of two. A very energetic and honest man, he figured out how to manager his first loan, which he has repaid without a problem. He is again requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new mill. He believes he can increase his throughput and thus his income. He will then be able to do more to help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

N le 20 dcembre 1980 Nots, Monsieur K. Migan Grard a cess les tudes aprs le cours primaire et sest lanc dans les activits de moulineur. Propritaire de 2 moulins, il est mari et pre de deux (2) enfants. Trs dynamique et honnte, il a su bien grer le premier crdit obtenu et la rembours sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crdit de $1200 qui servira lachat de moulin neuf. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre daffaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer davantage lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy a new mill

loan.name: Adakou

texts.fr:
Born in Tsvi in about 1971, Madame Adakou K. finished primary school before ending her studies to start selling frozen fish and chicken. Married and the mother of two, she manages to help her husband with household expenses due to the revenue she brings in from her sales. An energetic and serious woman, she figured out how to manager two initial loans, which have been repaid without a problem. At present, she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy wholesale frozen chicken and fish, in order to strengthen her business. With this loan, she believes she will increase her income to better help with improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Ne vers 1971 Tsvi, Madame K. Adakou a arrt ses tudes aprs le cours primaire et sest lance dans la vente de poissons et de poulets congels. Marie et mre de deux (2) enfants, elle arrive partager les charges du foyer avec son mari grce aux revenus que lui procurent ses ventes. Dynamique et srieuse, elle a su bien grer ses deux premiers crdits qui ont t rembourss sans incident. A prsent elle sollicite un crdit de $850 qui servira lachat en gros, de poulets congels et de poissons pour renforcer son activit. Par ce crdit, elle pense augmenter ses revenus pour mieux contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy wholesale and sell frozen chickens and fish retail

loan.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi A., age 28, dropped out of middle school due to a lack of financial support and entered into an apprenticeship in tailoring. Unmarried and without any children, he takes care of his parents and two younger brothers as dependents. The income from his poorly equipped shop fails to cover household expenses. He is requesting a second loan of $850, now that he has paid back his first one. With this new loan, for acquiring sewing machines and fabric to make ready-to-wear clothing, he intends to do more to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Ag de 28 ans, Monsieur A. Kossi a cess ses tudes au collge par manque de support financier et sest lanc dans lapprentissage de couture. Clibataire sans enfant, il a sa charge ses parents et deux petits frres. Les revenus de son atelier peu quip narrivant pas couvrir les dpenses faites dans son foyer. Il sollicite un second crdit de $850 aprs avoir bien rembours le premier. Par ce nouveau crdit qui servira lachat des machines coudre et des tissus pour la confection des habits prt--porter, il pense contribuer davantage lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric for making ready-to-wear clothing

loan.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Mr. Edoh N. is 42 years old. He gave up his high school studies due to lack of financial means and launched himself into agriculture. Having become a farmer of renown by adding a poultry farm to his vegetable-growing business, he well-managed his initial loan which was repaid without difficulty. Versatile in his business, he solicits a new loan of $950 which will enlarge the area of his cultivated land and improve his chicken farm. With the current loan he means to benefit more areas of his business after raising his turnover, to best contribute to improving the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. Edoh est g de 42 ans. Il a arrt ses tudes au cours secondaire par manque de moyens financiers et sest lanc dans lagriculture. Devenu un grand exploitant agricole de renomm par son bonne association dlevage la culture vgtale, il a su bien grer le premier crdit quil a rembours sans incident. Dynamique dans ses activits, il sollicite un nouveau crdit de $950 qui servira lagrandissement de sa surface cultive et amliorer son levage de volailles. Par le prsent crdit, il pense rentabiliser plus ses activits afin daugmenter son chiffre daffaires pour mieux contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Expand his cultivated surface and improve his poultry farm

loan.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Born in 1979 in Tsvi, Mr. Komlan A. gave up his studies in secondary school due to lack of means and launched himself in the sale of CDs, cassettes, and DVDs. Single and without children, he takes care of one little brother and his mother. Very skilled in the management of his business, he repaid his two first loans without default. Now he requests a new loan of $850 which will resupply his shop with new videos and DVDs. Through this he intends to boost his sales to best improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Ne en 1979 Tsvi, Monsieur A. Komlan a arrt ses tudes au niveau secondaire par manque de moyen et sest lanc dans la vente des cassettes et de disque CD Vido. Clibataire sans enfant, il a sa charge un petit frre et sa mre. Trs dou dans la gestion de ses affaires, il a su bien rembourser ses deux premiers crdits sans incident. A prsent, il sollicite un nouveau crdit de $850 qui servira ravitailler sa boutique en nouveaux CD et cassettes vido. Par ceci il pense augmenter son chiffre daffaires pour mieux contribuer lamlioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loan.use: Buying and selling of CDs/cassettes/DVDs.

loan.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ami K. was born in 1977 in Tsvi, a territory of Zio. She is married and mother to four children. Her husband is a farmer in the town of Yoto and contributes rarely to the costs of the household. Mrs. K. runs a restaurant that she has managed for three years. Very enterprising, she is building her small business and delivers quality service to a client base which grows larger and larger. Honest and hardworking, she capably managed and promptly repaid the two previous loans she received. Today she seeks a loan of $850, which will allow her to buy grains to strengthen her sales of pasta and other foods. She will also be able to improve her revenues and sustain the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Ami est ne en 1977 Tsvi (Prfecture du Zio). Elle est marie et mre de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur dans la prfecture de Yoto et contribue rarement aux charges du mnage. Madame K. Ami gre un restaurant quelle tient depuis 3 ans. Trs entreprenante, elle dveloppe sa petite activit et rend un service de qualit sa clientle qui devient de plus en plus grande. Honnte et rigoureuse, elle a su grer et rembourser promptement les deux prcdents crdits quelle avait obtenus. Elle sollicite ce jour un crdit de $850 qui lui servira acheter des crales en vue de renforcer ses activit de vente de boule de pte et autres. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loan.use: Buying grains to strengthen the sales of pasta and other foods at her restaurant.

loan.name: Albert Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Albert Kodjo D. is a young man of 25 years; very dynamic. His main business is farming, including raising local breeds of swine. He is married and the father of one child. Today, he hopes to improve his pork business and enhance productivity to ensure the schooling of his child, which is unfortunately well beyond his financial means. He asks to this effect a loan of $1000 which will let him redo his pens and maintain veterinary care and food supply for his animals.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Kodjo Albert est un jeune de 25 ans, trs dynamique. Il a comme activit principale llevage de porc de race local et lagriculture. Il est mari et pre dun (1) enfant. Aujourdhui, il a le souci damliorer son activit en faisant llevage de porc de race amliore afin daccrotre ses rendements et assurer la scolarit de son enfant. Malheureusement ceci demande beaucoup plus de moyen financier. Il sollicite cet effet un crdit de $1000 qui lui permettra de refaire la bergerie, dassurer les soins vtrinaires et lalimentation des btes.

loan.use: Improve the breeding and selling of pigs on his farm

loan.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi A. was born in 1976 in Gap, a territory of Zio. She resides in Tsvi where she runs her business selling root vegetables and coal. Married, she is the mother of three children who are left in her charge because her husband has just married another woman. She also cares for a niece who has lost her mother. Courageous and full of confidence, she has continued her business thanks to an initial loan she obtained for $500. This allowed her to free up much of her income for the basic needs of her children. Despite being illiterate, she manages her affairs extraordinarily well and is always on time in the repayment of her loans. She is a trustworthy woman who deserves support.

This loan of $850 that she requests will permit her to buy a very important stock of yams and wood coal. Thus, her sales will be increased and she can invest in the upbringing, health, and education of her children.

Translated from French by Erin Spencer, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Amavi est ne en 1976 Gap (Prfecture du Zio). Actuellement elle rside Tsvi o elle fait son commerce de vente de tubercules et de charbon. Marie, elle est mre de trois (3) enfants qui sont laisss sa charge car le mari vient dpouser une autre femme. En plus, elle a en charge une nice qui a perdu sa mre. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continu son activit grce un premier crdit de $500 quelle a obtenu. Ce qui lui a permis de dgager un revenu substantiel aux besoins lmentaires des enfants. Bien quanalphabte, elle gre de faon extraordinaire son activit et est toujours trs correct dans le remboursement de ses crdits. Elle est une femme de confiance et mrite dtre soutenue. Ce crdit de $850 quelle sollicite lui permettra de faire un stock plus important digname et de charbon de bois. Ainsi, son chiffre daffaires pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans lducation, la sant et la scolarisation des enfants.

loan.use: Purchase, storage, and resale of yams and coal.

loan.name: Grce

texts.fr:
Mrs. Grace F. is a 40-year-old married women and mother of three (3) children. With a high school education and training in cooking, she launched into a private initiative. Today, she manages a little restaurant where she also offers pastries which make her successful. She is very much in demand with customers who have become very loyal.

Unfortunately, Grace hasn't got the necessary equipment to satisfy her customers' demands. For that reason, she is soliciting a US$ 1000 loan to help her buy the needed equipment for her restaurant. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and improve living conditions for Grace and her family.

Translated from French by Bijou Kuzimbu, Kiva Volunteer.

Age de 40 ans, Madame F. Grce est marie et mre de trois (3) enfants. Avec un niveau dinstruction du cours secondaire, et une formation en cuisine, elle sest lance dans une initiative prive. Elle tient aujourdhui un restaurant o elle fait aussi de la ptisserie qui lui russit bien. Elle est trs sollicite par une clientle devenue trs fidle.

Malheureusement, elle na pas lquipement ncessaire pour rpondre aux vux de cette clientle. Cest pour cela quelle sollicite un crdit de $1000 qui servira acheter du matriel dquipement pour son restaurant. Ce crdit lui permettra daugmenter son chiffre daffaire et amliorer ses conditions de vie.

loan.use: Purchase of equipment for her restaurant (Achat de matriel d'quipement pour son restaurant)

loan.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya A., 40 years old, is married and the mother of eight (8) children and is supporting five (5) other persons. All the household resposinbilities lie on her because her husband is often absent and totally neglects his role as a father. Her principal activity is the sale of vegetables and food products. In spite of her efforts, Mrs. Eya A.s activities are not profitable because her household expenses are quite heavy. She is fighting so that her children can get out of the vicious circle of poverty. In order to expand the size of her business and increase her sales figures, Mrs. Eya A. is requesting a loan of $1000 that she will use as working capital.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Age de 40 ans, Madame A. Eya est marie est mre de huit (8) enfants et a sa charge cinq (5) autres personnes. Toute la charge de la famille se repose sur elle car le mari est souvent absent et nglige totalement son rle de pre de famille. Son activit principale est la vente des lgumes et des produits vivriers. Malgr ses efforts, Madame A. Eya narrive pas fructifier ses activits car les charges du mnage sont assez lourdes. Elle se bat pour que tous ses enfants puissent russir et sortir de ce cercle vicieux de la pauvret. Afin daugmenter la taille de son activit et accrotre son chiffre daffaire, Madame A. Eya sollicite un apport financier de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce.

loan.use: Purchase and resale of food products and vegetables

loan.name: Achatou

texts.fr:
44 year old Mrs. Achatou D. is currently a secretary typist at the Prefectorial Administration for Social Affairs in Tsvi. She is married and the mother of a child who is in apprenticeship. With the present cost of living, her salary is no longer sufficient to cover the household expenses thus this project to sell notions and dry goods. A woman with a strong personality, she has been able to develop a clientele that totally trusts her. To fulfill the demands and multiple inquiries of her clientele she is soliciting a loan of $900 to buy notions- dry goods in order to strengthen her business. This will allow her to increase her income and de facto contribute to the improvement of her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Age de 44 ans, Madame D. Achatou est actuellement secrtaire dactylographe la Direction Prfectorale des Affaires Sociales Tsvi. Elle est marie et mre dun enfant qui est actuellement en apprentissage. Avec le cot actuel de la vie, son salaire ne suffit plus pour faire face aux charges de la maison do ce projet de vente des articles de merceries et autres divers. Femme de caractre, elle a su dvelopper une clientle qui lui fait totalement confiance. Pour rpondre aux exigences et aux nombreuses demandes de sa clientle, elle sollicite un crdit de $900 pour acheter les articles de mercerie en vue de renforcer son affaire. Ceci permettra daugmenter ses revenus et de facto contribuer lamlioration de ses conditions de vie et celle de la famille.

loan.use: Buying and selling of notions and dry goods

loan.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yawa S. is a very active fifty-year-old woman. She is a married mother of eight (8) children who also takes care of three (3) other people. Her husband is often absent and leaves the responsibility for the household up to her. Her main business activity is market gardening, and she sells her produce herself at the market in order to meet her childrens' needs. In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting a loan of $800 to buy fertilizer and improve her land.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva volunteer.

Age de 50 ans, Madame S. Yawa est trs active. Cest une femme marie et mre de huit (8) enfants et a sa charge trois (3) autres personnes. Le mari est toujours absent et laisse toutes les charges sur la femme. Elle a pour activit principale le marachage et cest la vente de ces produits quelle vent elle-mme au march afin dassumer les besoins de ses enfants. Pour augmenter la taille de son activit, elle sollicite un crdit de $800 pour acheter des engrais et amliorer ses terres.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer

loan.name: Afi Lucia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Lucia L. was born on March 22,1966, she does not have any children but is supporting three (3) nephews and a niece. For the last 15 years she has been doing small retailing and farming. With these activities she assumes as best one can the food needs of the children. Honest and dynamic, she has been able to manage her three previous loans. In order to increase her cultivable land, she is soliciting a financial help of $750 that will allow her to cultivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut. Part of it will be designated for the sale of peanuts, medicines and others. Thus she will be able to provide for her familys needs.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Ne le 22 Mars 1966, Madame L. Afi Lucia na pas denfants mais elle a en charge trois (3) neveux et une nice. Elle fait depuis plus de 15 ans le petit commerce et lagriculture. A partir de ces activits, elle assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnte et dynamique, elle a su grer les trois prcdents crdits obtenus. Afin dtendre sa surface cultivable, elle sollicite un appui financier de $750 qui servira faire la culture de mas, de manioc, de gombo et darachide. Une partie va tre destine la vente darachide, de mdicaments et autres. Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loan.use: Cutivate corn, manioc, okra and peanut

loan.name: Komlan Kalp

texts.fr:
Born in 1953 in Bolou-Dkpo (Prfecture du Zio), Mr. Komlan Kalp A. is married and is financially responsible for eight (8) persons. His wife, a reseller, does not earn enough to be able to contribute to the household expenses. Mr. Komlan A. has been a carpenter for the last 34 years. Because of the quality of his work he has the confidence and respect of his clients. He manages his activity well and is very honest reimbursing his previous loans. In order to increase his business, he is soliciting a financial help of $950 to buy boards and logs for his work. With this loan his sales figures will be able to increase and he will be able to invest more in the education and health of his family.

Translated from French by Vronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

N en 1953 Bolou-Dkpo (Prfecture du Zio), Monsieur A. Komlan Kalp est mari et a huit (8) personnes sa charge. Son pouse, revendeuse ne gagne pas assez pour pouvoir contribuer aux charges du mnage. Monsieur A. Komlan exerce comme activit la menuiserie il y a 34 ans. A cause de la qualit de son travail, il a la confiance et lestime des clients. Il gre de faon correcte son activit et est trs honnte dans le remboursement des crdits obtenus. En vue daccrotre ses activits, il sollicite un appui financier de $950 pour acheter des planches et grumes pour son travail. Avec ce crdit, son chiffre daffaires pourra augmenter et il pourra investir plus dans lducation et la sant de la famille.

loan.use: To buy boards and logs for carpentry work

loan.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr A. Kossi was born in 1975 in Gati in the prefecture of Zio. After his primary studies, he obtained a car driving licence. Not having the means to buy a car, he completed 5 years of farming after that. Married and father of two children, his wife does not have any income generating activity -- with the result that all the needs are all supported by Mr A.. From his farming business, the family performs well -- it is responsible for the family's survival.

He is honest and rigorous, In order to have his own motor-driven pump, he requests a loan of $1000. He will be able to thus increase the farm's cultivable surface for an increase in its profits. This will be able to thus provide even more suitably for the needs of the family.

ORIGINAL FRENCH

Monsieur A. Kossi est n en 1975 Gati dans la prfecture du Zio. Aprs ses tudes primaires, il a fait la conduite auto sanctionne par un permis de conduire. Nayant pas les moyens pour sacheter une voiture, il fait depuis plus de 5 ans le marachage. Mari et pre de deux enfants, son pouse na aucune activit gnratrice de revenu, ce qui fait que toutes les charges sont supportes par Monsieur A.. A partir de cette activit quil matrise si bien et qui il doit sa survie, il assume tant bien que mal les besoins alimentaires des enfants. Honnte et rigoureux, il a su grer les deux crdits obtenus. Afin davoir sa propre motopompe, il sollicite un crdit de $1000. Il pourra ainsi agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une augmentation de ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi subvenir convenablement aux besoins de la famille.

loan.use: Achat d'une motopompe pour le marachage

loan.name: Adrian Arnoldo

texts.es:
"I was given a home to live in but I've not been able to move into it yet because I need to make it secure for my family. I work the night shift and my wife has to stay alone with the children in the house. It is not a good area and there are lots of trouble makers. I am asking for $700 to make my house more secure."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

Me dieron una casa de interes social pero no he podido habitarla ya que necesito ponerle antes las protecciones, ms que nada por la seguridad de mi familia, yo trabajo en el turno de noche y mi esposa se quedaria sola con mis hijos y no quisiera que les fuera a pasar algo debido a que en ese fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes.Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la colocacin de protecciones en mi casa.

loan.use: Security for his house

loan.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
"I urgently need to add another room to my home and install a floor because my family needs more space. My home is very small and only has 2 rooms: the living room, a bathroom and a kitchen. I am asking fo $1000 to build a room and lay a floor."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Me urge la construccin de un cuarto en mi vivienda y poner el piso ya que mi familia necesita ms espacio, mi casa es muy pequea y solo tiene 2 cuartos, la sala, un bao y la cocina. Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para la construccin de un cuarto y poner el piso.

loan.use: To add a room and install linoleum.

loan.name: Martha Cleotilde

texts.es:
"I would like to put up security and a gate around my house since I live alone and feel unsafe at night. I'm seeking a loan of $600 to put up some security and a gate."

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Me gustara poner protecciones y un portn alrededor de mi casa ya que yo vivo sola y me siento muy insegura en las noches. Solicito 600.00 dlls para poner protecciones y un portn en mi casa."

loan.use: To put up security in my home

loan.name: Christian De Jesus

texts.es:
"I have an internet cafe in my home and would like to invest in stationery and office supplies since my clients have asked me for them and I don't have any to sell. If I do, I think that my sales will increase and therefore, my income as well. I am seeking a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise for my business."

Translated from Spanish from Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo un ciber en mi casa y me gustara invertir en la compra de material escolar y de oficina, ya que mis clientes me lo han solicitado y no tengo nada de eso en venta, pienso que mis ventas aumentaran mucho y por lo tanto mis ingresos tambin. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercanca para mi negocio."

loan.use: to invest in my business

loan.name: Jos Daniel

texts.es:
Jos Daniel is married and has two small children who are 6 and 7 years old. Previously, he used to work for a gas company, but four years ago on his son's birthday, Jos wanted to rent a children's show for his party but could not find any that he liked. He bought some costumes of different characters and a sound device and put on the show himself. Afterwards, he started to offer his services with the help of his nephews and his wife, who made the costumes. Little by little, he accumulated and bought everything he needed for making spectacular shows.

These days, Jos is seeking a loan of $375, which will be used to buy more material to make more costumes and thus, create new personae that children like. He promises to repay this loan in 4 months. Be an important part of developing this unique business. Make the decision to support Jos. He and his family sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Jos Daniel es casado y tiene dos pequeos de 6 y 7 aos de edad. Anteriormente l trabajaba en una compaa de gas, pero hace cuatro aos en el cumpleaos de su hijo, Jos quera rentar un show infantil para su fiesta pero no encontr alguno de su agrado, fue as como adquiri disfraces de algunos personajes, un aparato de sonido, y l mismo hizo el show. Despus empez a ofrecer sus servicios con ayuda de sus sobrinos y de su esposa que elabora los disfraces, poco a poco fue adquiriendo todo lo necesario para hacer ms atractivos sus espectculos.

En estos momentos Jos est solicitando un prstamo de $ 375 dlares que emplear en la compra de material que necesita para elaborar ms disfraces y tener los personajes nuevos que son del agrado de los nios, l se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio especial, decdete a apoyar a Jos, l y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loan.use: Buy material to make costumes and disguises

loan.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana has been selling clothing for 12 years. She began her business when she was confronted with the need for an extra income in order to improve her familys standard of living. She is married and has three children, who are 10, 13, and 16 years old. In the beginning, one of her sisters obtained clothing for her, but eventually she went to Morolen, en Guanajuato, to get it for herself. She has now incorporated the making and selling of school uniforms. Due to the favorable payment plan she offers, she has had a lot of demand and supplies two schools in the town of Linares, Nuevo Len.

In order to cover the orders she has for this new school year, Juana needs a loan of $925.00. She will use it to buy the fabric she needs to make the school uniforms. She will return the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business. You can help this family, thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 aos Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa, inici su negocio ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 10, 13 y 16 aos de edad. Al principio una de sus hermanas le consegua la ropa pero despus ella misma fue a adquirirla a Morolen, en Guanajuato. Ahora ha incorporado la elaboracin y venta de uniformes escolares, gracias a las facilidades de pagos que ofrece ha tenido mucha demanda y surte a dos escuelas de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo Len.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene para este nuevo ciclo escolar, Juana necesita un prstamo de $925 dlares que emplear en la compra del material que necesita para la elaboracin de los uniformes escolares, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, tu puedes ayudar a esta familia, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loan.use: To buy fabric for making school uniforms

loan.name: Jos De Jess

texts.es:
Jos de Jess is from the town of Linares, Nuevo Len. He is married and has six children, all between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. His mother liked to raise quail and she came to have as many as 40 of them. People began to ask her for eggs and the birds themselves, so she decided to formalize her business. Soon after, she asked Jos to run it for her. With the help of his wife and his two oldest sons, he has been able to make the business successful. He now has Japanese quail and demand is high. He has also started making and selling jam, which has brought in many clients due to the good quality of the product.

So that he might continue growing his business, Jos is requesting a loan of $375.00. He will use it to buy labels and jars to improve the appearance of the products he sells. He will return the loan in a period of 6 months. Be a part of this business and decide to help this family. They are very thankful for the support you are able to give them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jos de Jess es originario de la localidad de Linares, Nuevo Len, est casado y tiene seis hijos entre 1 y 12 aos de edad. A su madre le gustaba criar codornices y llego a tener hasta 40, despus comenzaron a solicitarle huevos y aves, as que decidi formalizar su negocio y al poco tiempo le pidi a Jos que se hiciera cargo, con la ayuda de su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores l ha logrado sacar adelante este negocio, ahora tiene un criadero de codorniz japonesa con una alta demanda. Tambin ha iniciado con la elaboracin y venta de conserva, donde gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha logrado ganar muchos clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, Jos est solicitando un prstamo de $ 375 dlares que emplear en la compra de etiquetas y envases para mejorar la imagen de los productos que comercializa, l se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este negocio y decdete a ayudar a esta familia ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loan.use: To buy materials to improve the appearance of his products

loan.name: Jos Alberto

texts.es:
Jos Alberto is a young entrepreneur, who started his own business sixteen years ago, offering his services as a hair stylist. He has always liked this craft and, as a means to grow, having his own beauty salon has become his dream. He started with just a mirror, a pair of scissors and a machine but, thanks to the good quality of his services, his clientele has multiplied and his business has grown, while he has been able to specialize in this type of services.

In order to offer an improved service in a better and more ample locale, Alberto is requesting a $925 loan, which hell invest in the renovation of his salon. He hopes to increase his capacity to serve clients and to continue growing, as he has done so far. You can be part of Albertos accomplishments and he is sincerely thankful for the help you are providing him.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Jos Alberto es un joven emprendedor, quien desde hace 16 aos inici su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista. Este oficio siempre ha sido de su agrado y para superarse se convirti en un sueo para l tener su propia esttica. Comenz slo con un espejo, unas tijeras y una mquina, pero gracias a la buena calidad de su servicio, pronto sus clientes se multiplicaron y fue creciendo su negocio y especializndose en este tipo de servicios.

Para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y tener un lugar ms amplio y mejor, Alberto est solicitando un prstamo de $925 dlares que emplear en la remodelacin de su local. Con esto espera aumentar la capacidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. T puedes formar parte de los logros de Alberto y l agradece sinceramente la ayuda que le brindas.

loan.use: Renovation

loan.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona is divorced and has six children. The alimony that she receives from her ex-husband as very low and didn't meet her family's expenses, so she started selling tacos and hamburgers fiver years ago. The desire to get ahead and for her children to finish their studies has motivated her to work hard, and fortunately, she has been able to get a very central location where her business has grown with the help of her children.

At this time, Ramona is requesting a loan of $475 which she will use to purchase materials to increase her production and be able to meet her customer demand. She is committed to returning this amount in 6 months. The family's well-being is in your hands. Make the decision to help help them.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ramona es divorciada y tiene seis hijos, la pensin que recibe D. su ex esposo era muy baja para cubrir los gastos D. su familia por lo que comenz a vender tacos y hamburguesas hace cinco aos, el deseo D. salir adelante y que sus hijos culminaran sus estudios la han motivado a esforzarse mucho en su trabajo, afortunadamente logr conseguir un local en un lugar cntrico donD. ha hecho crecer su negocio con ayuda D. sus hijos.

En estos momentos, Ramona est solicitando un prstamo D. $ 475 dlares que emplear en la compra D. insumos para incrementar su produccin y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos est el bienestar D. esta familia, decdete a apoyarlos.

loan.use: Purchase of materials

loan.name: Kneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kneang N. is 39 years old and the mother of one school-going child. To service her familys living expenses, she rents rooms to the people in her area, which earns her around $7 each day. Her husband (pictured here because Kneang N. is not available) is a motor-taxi driver, earning on average $3/day in revenue.

Mrs Kneang N. hopes to used this $1,000 loan to open a shop selling soft drinks and some kind of grocery products to earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and save enough money for her childs education.

loan.use: To open a shop selling soft drinks and grocery items

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Kneang Ny has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Drame

texts.en: Dram M. is a dynamic 40 year old tradesman. He lives in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. M. owns a well managed store and sells fresh milk, sweets, candies, juices, soaps, sugar, etc. M. is married and has 4 children. He wants to expand his activities and diversify his product range by selling rice. He will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk from the largest wholesaler in order to get lower prices and improve his profit margin. He joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005 when he heard about the organisation from one of his friends. M. has performed very well since then and is honest and well organized.

loan.use: Dram Mamadou will use the loan to expand his product range

loan.name: Almagul

texts.en: Almagul is a mother of 2 children. She is 46 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Almagul has 2 years of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy foodstuffs.

loan.use: To buy foodstuffs

loan.name: Ngoran Eugenie

texts.en: K. Ngoran Eugenie is a dynamic and ambitious 40 year old woman. She lives with her partner who works as a driver for a public transportation company. Eugenie sells a variety of fresh legumes and vegetables in Port-Bout, one of the very populated suburbs in the south of Abidjan District. She has been in business for a number of years and has an 11 year old boy who will start grammar school in September 2007. Eugenie is one of the key contributors towards generating income for her extended family and helps to pay for the school fees and tuition of other children in the family. Eugenie joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in February 2005.

loan.use: Konan Ngoran Eugenie will use the loan to purchase goods from the fields

loan.name: Ndri Yolande

texts.en: Dj Ndri Yolande is a dynamic 44 year old woman. She is married and lives with her family in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. She has 3 children. The 2 elder daughters are in secondary school and the younger boy is in primary school. She believes that her children are her future and invests a lot in their education. Yolande has sold utensils at Port-Bout market for many years and joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005. She wants to expand her business and diversify her product range by selling high quality steel utensils which will provide her with a better return.

loan.use: Dj Ndri Yolande will use the loan to diversify her products offer

loan.name: Lucienne

texts.en: A. Lucienne has been selling ladies fashion at Port-Bout market since 1982. She is a 55 year old widow with 3 daughters and 2 sons. She works with one of her 3 daughters and spends most of her time at the market taking care of her store. She joined the AE&I Microcredit Program two years ago and has performed well so far. Her business is the sole revenue resource from which she is paying her youngest son's university tuition and fees. She is honest and rigorous in the management of her business.

loan.use: Adoni Lucienne will use the loan to purchase more goods for her store

loan.name: Minayat

texts.en: Minayat has been in this business for one year. He and his family live in the town of Khachmaz. He is a 46-year-old man with 4 children. Minayat uses this car to distribute goods to stores. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy spare parts to service this car.

loan.use: To buy spare parts

loan.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara has her own orchard where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi -Zeyid. Now Gulara needs a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loan.name: Kouadio

texts.en: Kouadio A. Christine is a single mother. she is 37 and lives with her 2 children in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells cooked cassava in the Port-Bout open market and has a lot of customers among the tradeswomen in the market who take their lunch near their businesses. She has 11 years of work experience in this business and is very dynamic. She is very happy as its her second consecutive year she gets a loan from AE&I for the payment of the school fees and tuitions for her children. Christine children who are both in secondary school will resume school in September 2007 and she will use the loan to pay for their education.

loan.use: Kouadio Amenan will use the loan to pay school fees and tuition for her 2 children

loan.name: Chichak

texts.en: Chichak (her husband is pictured) is a mother of 2 children, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Two years ago she started this business. She needs a loan of $775 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for improving her orchard.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loan.name: Suraya

texts.en: Suraya is a mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Ashagi-Zeyid. This 46-year-old has one year of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of $825 to purchase a cow. She wants to increase the number of cows and get more income to support her family.

loan.use: To buy a cow

loan.name: Koua

texts.en: Koua B. G. is 39 years old single man. He lives in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District with his 2 children, who are in primary school. He sells clothes accessories and has more than 15 years of work experience in this business from which he care to the education expenses of his children. G. is dynamic and ambitious. He joined AE&I microcredit program in March 2004 and has been a good performer since then. He wants to purchase clothes accessories stock of products for primary school dress that has been ordered from him by a group of tailors.

loan.use: Kouao Bile Guillaume will use the loan to purchase goods

loan.name: Elnur

texts.en: This single man is 26 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Alekseyevka. Elnur is enjoying his business and has a lot of clients. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy cloth to meet all the demands of his clients.

loan.use: To buy cloth

loan.name: Lasme Lou

texts.en: Lasme Lou M. is a dynamic 41 years old single woman. She has 3 children and lives in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She sells various products such as charcoal, yam, palm oil on the market of Port-Bout, M. who take care to the education expenses of her children alone is seeking for a loan to ensure the payment of school fees and tuitions in September 2007 for her 3 children. She joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 and has been a good performer so far. She is very exited to get a loan from people she doesnt know but who think about her life.

loan.use: Lasme Lou Madeleine will use the loan to pay school expenses for her 3 children

loan.name: Sudaba

texts.en: Sudaba is 40 years old, and has been in this business for one year. She is a mother of 2 children, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. This young mother would now like to apply for a loan of $825 to buy goods for her general store and increase her income.

loan.use: To buy goods for her general store

loan.name: Allani

texts.en: Allani N. is 36 years old dynamic woman. She is married to a mechanic welder and has 2 children. She lives with her family in Port-Bout, a very populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. Allani is a good tailor and clothes accessories seller on the Port-Bouts market. She has more than 12 years work experience. She consistently contributes to her family revenues generation. N. has got an important order of school dresses to be delivered for a primary school. N. who joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005 has been a good performer. She has always reimbursed her loans in good manner

loan.use: Allani Nzi will use the loan to purchase school dress accessories.

loan.name: Tra

texts.en: Mrs Tra L. T. is experienced in selling food products. She is 43 and is living in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She started selling on Marcorys open market since the very beginning of its opening in 1987. Divorced, she lives with her 8 children at their apartment. Ground nuts, corn, apples, salt, ginger, fish powder and rice are usual products she sold to customers. She needs a loan to extend her activity in order to increase revenues and care to her children education expenses. She is an honest woman who has always reimbursed her loans in good manners since she joined AE&I microcredit program in May 2005.

loan.use: Tra Lou Toe will use the loan to pay education expenses

loan.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S. is a 43-year-old father of 3 school-going children. He and his wife live with their children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works as a soldier, earning around $2 each day.

His wife generally makes around $8/day in revenue from renting rooms in their house and selling a variety of grocery products to the local community.

Mr Chea S. is requesting a $300 loan for his wife. The loan will be used to expand her inventory by buying more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand.

loan.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet his wife's clients' needs.

loan.name: Sin

texts.en:
A 50-year-old widow with 2 children, Mrs. Sin H. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To meet her familys daily needs, and especially her childrens education, Mrs. Sin H. rents different rooms of her house to the people in her area, earning around $5 each day.

Recently, Mrs. Sin H. has applied for a loan which helps her to repair and build more rooms in order to fulfill her tenants needs. She is confident that she will expand her rental business and provide a good quality of life for her family one day.

loan.use: To repair and build her rental rooms to accommodate more tenants.

payment.comment:
Congratulations! Sin Heang has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.
Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.
We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.
Sincerely, Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loan.name: Dehi

texts.en: Mrs Dehi M. lives with her family in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She is 46 years old and is married. M. is mother of 4 children. Now that her husband is retired from Air Afrique Airlines Company, she is the one who works all day long to support her children. Every New Year she makes sure they have clothes, food, shoes and their education paid, also. She struggles everyday to bring back those simple times of yesterday. Her husband income is not enough to cover all their little family charges, because of some nephews he has in charge indeed. Its the 2nd time, she is given opportunity to request AE&I a loan. She will use his loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses.

loan.use: Dehi Martine will use the loan to pay education expenses and purchase goods

loan.name: Phen

texts.en: A 41-year-old widow with 5 children, Mrs. Phen N. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family income, she rents different rooms of her house to the people in her community, earning around $5 each day. Four of her children work for a private company, and their salaries also help to pay for some of the household expenses. Mrs N. is seeking a $600 loan to be used to build more rooms so that she can generate additional profits from her room rental business.

loan.use: To build more rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loan.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama M., is a single mother, born in1968 in the north side of Cote Divoire.5 years of work experience, she is a very dynamic mother having in charge 2 children going to primary school and her taxi driver of husband, whose income is not enough to cover home charges. Her children are very excellent at school, and her husband is very proud of them meanwhile, they are facing a plenty of problems since kids grew up. The elder is 15 years old and the 2nd, 10.
