So as to overcome any bad situation and keep the balance of their children school performances, they have decided together, to join AE&I microcredit program in order to purchase a large quantity of food products and make advertising to attract more customers and improve their revenue.

loan.use: Adama Mawa will use the loan to purchase goods

loan.name: Hoyi

texts.en: Hoyi Hlne is 35 years old and has decided to live with her husband for better and worst on September15th, 2000. They have 3 children, 2 among them are freshman and sophomore in law and electricity, and the youngest is in secondary school. She has 7 years of work experience in selling food products. Hlne lives with her family in Marcory, in the south of the Abidjan District. She has demonstrated dynamism and honesty since she joined AE&I microcredit program in July 2005. She is a good performer and she is requesting this loan to pay school expenses for her children. She thanks in advance those world citizens who believes in her and help her to take care to her family.

loan.use: Hoyi Hlne will use the loan to pay education expenses

loan.name: Azoble

texts.en: Azobl E. is a very dynamic single mother. E. is 41 years old. With the first credit she was given, she opened a store of cosmetics products and another various sales business which thrives well. She lives with her 2 children in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She has long experience in micro business. E. takes care to her children life and education expenses from revenues generated from her activities. E. heard about AE&I in June 2005 and benefited her first loan 3 months later. She has performed very well since then.

loan.use: Azobl Emilienne will use the loan to purchase goods

loan.name: Blesson

texts.en: Blessou A. is 37 years old lady and part of new uprising generation. She has started bananas, yams, and cabbages sale on Marcorys market 6 years ago. She learnt with her aunt to take the very first steps in the world of trade. Today she is very happy of the long way she went through to perfect her trade capabilities .A. is not married yet, but lives with a man who works as an office clerk in a local Bank. They planned together to get married very soon and open a restaurant. She needs a loan to pay school fees for their young son who is in primary school. A. has been performing well since she joined AE&I microcredit program since November 2004.

loan.use: Blessou Angeline will use the loan to pay school fees for her son

loan.name: Lohore

texts.en: Lohoure O. is a 49 years old widowed woman. She lives in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. Lohoure sells pig meat on marcorys market. She has among 7 children. The 2 younger sons are in secondary school. They all have, good reports, and their mother is very proud of them. She pays schools fees from her micro business revenues. She has benefited several loans from AE&I since November 2004 and has always performed very well. She requesting the present loan to buy cattle of pig in order to improve margin and increase her profits.

loan.use: Lohoure Odio will use the loan to purchase pigs for meat sales

loan.name: Va

texts.en:
Mrs. Va S. N. is 48 years old and married with 6 children: one is married and 4 of the others are employed at a garment factory. Her husband is employed at the government-owned water processing plant, earning $5 a day.

In Cambodia, not all houses have access to running water from official government pipes. To receive water in this way people must pay for the cost of installing an official pipe, which is more than many people can afford. Mrs. Va S. N. would like to borrow $1,000 so that she can supply water to all her neighbors for a small profit. Once the pipe up and running, she expects to earn about $3 a day from this.

loan.use: To purchase a pipe with which to sell water from her house to her neighbours.

loan.name: Umarat

texts.en: Umarat is a mother of one child. She is 57 years old, a widow, and she lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in this business for 6 years. She sells chairs to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy more chairs and tables.

loan.use: To buy chairs

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Purchase of stationery stock

loan.name: Rahima

texts.en: Poshpohodjaeva Rahima is an accountant. She is retired now. She is married and has 4 children. Her elder son has several shops of alcoholic drinks, and Rahima helps her son as a salesperson. She became a salesperson in 2005, and she likes her job. Her son buys drinks from the factories every week. She sells them at her trade place. In the wedding time from June to September, Rahima says that they make a good profit. Their shops are situated in the big bus station, and thats why they have many clients every day. In the future she wants to increase the number of her goods; for this purpose, she is requesting $1200.

loan.use: Business expansion

loan.name: Kamran

texts.en: Four years ago this young man started this business. He is 33, married, and has four children. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Muzaffar-Oba. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve his farm and then he will be able to meet all demands of his family.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loan.name: Elshad

texts.en:
54-year-old Elshad A. lives with his family including four children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Qubadli region. He is the only breadwinner for his family. His familys living conditions are not good enough. The family income is rather limited. Elshad began his business 6 years ago. Because he did not have enough financial resources, he couldnt develop his business well enough in the beginning.

With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs. After awhile he made important steps in his business and increased the area of his trading.

Now, he wants to borrow $400 in order to further develop his business, to build a store and to buy digital scales. He will improve his familys living conditions with this additional income and obtain some funds for the education of his children.

loan.use: To build store and to buy digital scales

loan.name: Sekibuule

texts.en:
Sekibuule H. is a married man with four children: 3 boys and 1 girl. The children are all currently enrolled in school with the eldest (girl) in senior high, and the others in junior high, Fifth Grade and First Grade.

In 2002, H. bought a small taxi vehicle and operated a special hire business for 3 years. He then sold the taxi and used the proceeds to buy a small plot of land and build a house for his family. Since then, H. has been employed as a special hire taxi driver, which does not earn as much as his previous employment when he actually owned the vechicle he drove.

H. would like to secure another car to enable him to make sufficient money to support his family. He has already registered with Wandegeya Tour and Traveling Association, an umbrella organization for the special hire taxi drivers.

He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva and $1,181 from Share An Opportunity Micro finance, making a total of $ 2381 (four million Uganda Shillings 4,000,000) payable in 8 months. This loan will help H. become a self reliant person who is also able to meet all his family's living expenses.

loan.use: Puchase of a small taxi vehicle

loan.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan has 10 years of experience in this business. He is from the town of Khachmaz. This 44-year-old man is married and has 3 children. He sells agricultural produce in the market and supports his family. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more agricultural produce and improve his business.

loan.use: To buy agricultural produce
